loans.name: Winelda

texts.en:
The borrower is a single 57-year-old woman who lives in the Philippines.  She has a retail shop that sells canned goods, eggs, and snacks.  She has been in this business for 20 years.  

The borrower is a new member of HSPFI and she has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, canned goods, milk, eggs, and beverages.  She hopes this loan will improve the future of her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, canned goods, milk, eggs & beverages

loans.name: Leorie

texts.en:
Leorie is 34 years old and married with four children. The oldest child is 12 years old. 

Leorie is a farmer. She grows corn crops and vegetables. Leorie sells her harvest at her town's market. She also raises pigs in her backyard. Leorie works hard to help support her family. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and feed. Leorie hopes to be rich someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and feed

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a young woman from Palestine. She is a housewife and a mother of two children. Her husband Rabie sells retail items such as lighters, key-chains, hygiene items, etc. He uses a cart and wanders in the streets selling from market to market and door to door.

Diana took out a loan from FATEN for her husband who wants to increase the variety of items he sells but he can't pay for it all at once.
Diana is a conservative woman. Therefore, her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase items such as lighters, candies, and hygiene items to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 24 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Marilou works very hard to provide for them.

Marilou runs a business buying & selling sea cucumber in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional sea cucumber to sell.

Marilou has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional sea cucumber to sell

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman with five children. Four of the children attend school and one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling at retail to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she sells dried fish and cereals, which adds another source of livelihood. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Bahati dreams of becoming a cereals supplier in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase building materials, cement and sand and pay labor to construct her stall. She decided to join to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase building materials, cement and sand and pay for labor to construct her stall.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with three children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & biscuits. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, biscuits & beverages.

Gina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, biscuits & beverages.

loans.name: Maimona

texts.en:
Maimona is 35 years old and married with three children.

Maimona works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying & selling jewelry in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of jewelry to sell.

Maimona has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her jewelry business for two years and earns additional income from selling dry goods.

Maimona aspires to build & expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry to sell

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 41 years old and married with three children.

Miriam works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying & selling jewelry in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of jewelry.

Miriam has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her jewelry business for three years and earns additional income from selling ready to wear clothes.

Miriam aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional jewelry to sell

loans.name: Noroneza

texts.en:
Noroneza is 24 years old and married with one child.

Noroneza works hard to provide for her family. She sells sunglasses and watches in the Philippines, and she has requested a 25,000 Philippines pesos loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Noroneza has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sunglasses and watches business for six years and also earns an income from buying and selling jewelry.

Noroneza aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Chính's Group

texts.en:
Chính is a 29-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong-Bắc Ninh. Chính is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Diên Lộc nhóm 02 (2). 

Chính is married and has three school-aged children. To making a living, Chính makes and sells rice products in the local community. Chính has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from these activities. 

Chính joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND which will be used to buy more  raw rice as  fresh products to meet the demand of customers. This will be her second loan from SEDA. Chính plans to use this  loan amount, buying grain for resale, pigs, and pig feed.  With this ways, she can expand more the scale of business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 

1. Tặng is a 34-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business  raising livestock and food (chickens and pigs). 

2. Duyên is a 26-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business making furniture such as beds, wardrobes, and tables. 

3. Hương is a 31-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business  making & selling foods with beef. 

4. Thành is a 25-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business selling fruits such as apples, watermelons, and mangoes. 

5. Học is a 47-year-old man who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support his business raising livestock such as chickens and pigs. 

6. Sủng is a 35-year-old man who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support his business raising livestock and pigs. 

About SEDA: 

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. 

Chính h là 29 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong-Bắc Ninh. Chính là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có seven các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Diên Lộc nhóm two (two). 

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương. Chính thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn three năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Chính kiếm được khoảng 3,500,000 VND. Chính đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/anh ấy. 0 Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7,392,000 VND. 

Khoản vay sẽ là second khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. 

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 

1. Tặng là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,944,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 

2. Duyên là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,944,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất. 

3. Hương là 31 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,944,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 

4. Thành là 25 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,944,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh hoa quả như táo, dưa hấu, xoài. 

5. Học là 47 tuổi nam. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,152,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 

6. Sủng là 35 tuổi nam. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,152,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 

Về SEDA: 

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam 

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch.. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.. "

loans.use: to  buy more raw rice to meet the demand of customers

loans.name: Femelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Femelita works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a sari sari (variety) store. Femelita is borrowing 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase stock of vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Femelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is 61 years old and lives in Bañadero, Ozamis City. She is married with three children. To earn a living, Mila has a business selling a variety of products such as shampoo, soap and anything that is needed in the household. She earns about 3,000 Philippines pesos each month doing this type of work. Mila has requested a loan to purchase more stock of products for her grocery store. Mila became a member of PMPC just this year. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en:
Julie Ann is 32 years old and single.  She helps her parents to meet the family's needs.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines.  She also earns additional income from poultry, pigs, buying and selling vegetables and from a general store. Julie Ann is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restauran.

Julie Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 59 years old and widowed.

Merlina runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.

Merlina has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Merlina would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Susana has been in this business for 2 years. Susana also earns income from selling of vegetables.

Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF.  She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Sukunthea

texts.en:
Sukunthea, 46 years old, has been selling pottery with her husband since 2000. They have four children, 17, 13, 11, and 9 years old. Three are studying and one is helping them to sell pottery. 

The income of this family is $20 per day. Every month, she has to spend $150 on food, $10 on electricity and $15 on school fees. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike with a trailer attached to transport the pottery to sell in the provinces nearby. She will try hard with her business to get a good income that can send all of her children to study in the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike with a trailer attached to transport her pottery products.

loans.name: Yeuk

texts.en:
Mrs. Yeuk, who lives in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Tom Province, has been a farmer for a long time. She can make a profit of approximately $2.50 a day. Her husband works in the construction field and is earning around $5 a day to help with the family's daily needs. 

They blessed with five children; three are married and two are single. Mrs. Yeuk is concerned that one of her children is unemployed. She wants to assist her child to go to work abroad, in Korea, but her current savings are not adequate to pay for the documentation costs. So Mrs. Yeuk would like to apply for a loan which will be used to pay those document fees.

loans.use: to pay document fees for her child to work overseas.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is from the village of Elburgon, Narok-Kenya.  She is 41 years old, married and has five school-aged children.  She has been practicing mixed farming for about eight years and earns KES 26,400 in a month. 

She has never borrowed from any other MFI and this is her first loan which she plans to use to buy farm supplies like manure, seeds and insecticides. 

She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: buy farm supplies like manure, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with 2 children, all of whom graduated from school.  She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing. 

She has operated a fish selling business for the past 10 years, selling from her home to her neighbours and passersby.  In addition, she also sells vegetables, tomatoes and onions which contribute to her other source of income.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Rose dreams of expanding her business to improve her living standards.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of dried fish for sale.  She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of dried fish for sale.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and lives with four family members, one of whom works.

H. has had a shop for electrical materials since 2008. He has a long experience in this field and in electrical installation and has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in his area.

He is requesting $1800 to renovate his shop, tiling floors and painting walls. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his shop, tiling floors and painting walls.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam, age 35, is a single mother with one child.  She sells handicrafts which she has been doing for one year.  The business earns her a monthly income of KES 5,000.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy more handicrafts for resale.  Miriam intends to use the anticipated profits to educate her child and hopes to join international exporters in the future.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts for sale

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is married with one child.  Sheila is 29 years old and lives in Balok, Sindangan Zamboanga del Norte.

Sheila has a general store which sells products such as ricec, oil, soy sauce to earn living and has had this business for 3 years.  Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to purchased more products for her general store such as rice, oil, soy sauce, soap, shampoo, etc.

Sheila has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchased more products for her general store such as rice, oil, soy sauce, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia, a 38-year-old married mother of four children, works hard to provide for her family. She has been operating a sari sari store for two years in the Philippines and also earns an income from food vending. Having received and repaid five previous loans from NWTF, she is now requesting a PHP 13,000 loan to buy items to sell such as milk, groceries, etc. in her sari sari store.

Nelia aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with four children.  She has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & biscuits.

Fely is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Fely hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & biscuits.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne, aged 29, is a single mother of three children. She sells handicrafts in the Westlands area in Nairobi, which she has been doing for nine years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES.40,000.

This is her first loan with KADET LTD. She will use the loan  funds to buy more handicrafts for sale. Most of her customers are tourists from different countries but some are also local residents.

Carolyne will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and hopes to grow her business and export the handicrafts in future.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase potatoes, wheat flour, maize flour and green grocery items.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 49 years old and married with nine children. With four children in school, Nelly works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like sugar, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Nelly has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles, soap, etc. 

In the future Nelly would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, married and has three children.

Ali has been a carpenter since 2005; he makes bedroom sets, wood counters and doors. He has a long experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is being well known in his area.

He is requesting $2400 to buy carpenter machine tools. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him and his family a positive growth.

loans.use: To buy carpenter machine tools.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel, aged 39, is married to Gladys and blessed with four children. He sells handicrafts which he has been doing for eleven years.The business earns him a monthly income of KES.30,000.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan funds to buy more handicrafts for resale. Ezekiel intends to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and hopes to join international exporters in future. He has never borrowed from any other MFI.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts for sale.

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en: Quyen was born in 1969. She lives with her husband and two sons in Dai Bi Village. Her husband is a builder. She not only grows rice but also raises chickens. She has participated in SEDA since 2005. The last cycle, she borrowed 8,502,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy chickens and food for them.

loans.use: to buy chickens and food for them

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Rosanna has a shop that sells coconuts for copra. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy additional coconuts.

Rosanna has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Rosanna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional coconuts.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past two years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also cooks chapati (flat bread) and doughnuts for sale. She dreams of expanding her business and purchasing a motorcycle for  business transport in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts, bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of coconuts, bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 53 years old and married with nine children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a  rice retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of rice to sell.

Pacita has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice retailing business for three years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Pacita aspires to save enough to buy farm land and send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of  rice to sell.

loans.name: Baraka

texts.en:
Baraka, aged 27, is married to Tabitha and blessed with one child. He sells curios which he has been doing for two years, and he earns  a monthly income of KES.20,000.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend, and this is his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the funds to buy more curios for resale.


Baraka intends to use the anticipated profits to educate his child and hopes to join international curio exporters in future.

loans.use: To buy curios for sale.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 48 years of age and a married woman. She is presently residing at Buenavista Santiago. She is grateful because she is blessed with three children and all are pretty much in their adult years. Marilyn has been engaged in a hog raising business for almost 16 years while her motorcycle transport business is now 6 years in operation. With her strong determination in life, she is able to make her business grow so that she can sustain the needs of her family.

Marilyn would like to make her business more productive; that's why she's doing her best to increase the profit she generates. She would like to take out a loan of PHP 7000 to purchase hogs to raise and feed for them. Marilyn hopes that she will be granted this loan amount to improve her businesses and uplift their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase hogs to raise and feed for the hogs.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa  is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, biscuits & beverages.

Marissa  has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marissa  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits & beverages.

loans.name: Khanim

texts.ru:
Khanim opened dental clinic for 12 years ago. She is 44 years old. She has a daughter who will enter to university in this year. She has no husband. Khanim grows her daughter by herself. Khanim and her daughter live in Baku region.
She wants to improve her dental clinic in order to improve the quality of services to her clients. 
Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy medicines for her work.
texts.en:
Khanim opened a dental clinic twelve years ago. She is 44 years old. She has a daughter who will enter the university this year. She has no husband. Khanim is raising her daughter by herself. Khanim and her daughter live in the Baku region.
She wants to improve her dental clinic in order to improve the quality of services she provides to her clients. 
Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy medicines for her work.

loans.use: to buy medicines

loans.name: Pech

texts.en: Pech has been spending most of her time working in the agriculture sector. She and her husband have helped each other to plant different crops on their own fertile farm since 1999. From this business, they can generate around $5 in revenue each day to support the whole family. The couple is blessed with five children, two of whom are single and work in a garment factory in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, as a sewing worker and a machine repairer, getting a fixed salary each month. Pech will be using part of her loan to buy a secondhand motorbike for her kid to ride to work. With the remaining funds, she will support her son by paying for a machine-repairing course.

loans.use: to buy a secondhand motorbike for her kid to ride to work, and to pay for a machine-repairing course

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Salome works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling root crops and vegetables in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling banana chips. Salome is borrowing 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her root-crop and vegetables business.

Salome has sustained her business activities through 26 past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of repairing and renovating her family home.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Sinak

texts.en:
Sinak, 20 years old, is a student and a farmer when he is not in school. His parents are farmers and they sell groceries at home. He is the first child in his family and is responsible to help his mother to earn money to support his younger brother and sister. His sister is working in the factory and his brother is studying. He also lives with two nephews so there are seven members living in that family. 

This family can make good income of $18 per day. Every month, his parents spend $50 on food, $8 on electricity, $35 on school fees of the children and $23 on other expenses. Because he is the first child, he wants to help his parents to take care the family, especially since they are getting old now. 

He would like to request a loan of $700 to buy rice seed for his father’s farmland. The repayment will be made by his parents because the loan is for his father’s farmland. He is just helping to use his name on the loan because his father is too old to qualify for a loan and our agency doesn't allow it.

loans.use: To buy rice seed for his father's farm.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. She has a retail shop that sells school & office supplies. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional stock of school papers, folders & school supplies.

Ignacia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ignacia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of paper, folders & school supplies.

loans.name: Benkadi Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe  BENKADI IV sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 24 ans, 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à KOULOUWO, un des villages de la commune de KABOILA dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : la tomate et le jakatou avec  FATOUMATA  1ère à droite position debout de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 1,5 hectares. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village, du village de Fachoribougou et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The six members of the BENKADI IV group are married women with an average age of 24 and 2 children. They live mostly in polygamous families in KOULOUWO, one of the villages in the municipality of KABOILA in the prefecture of SIKASSO, the third largest administrative region of Mali.

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to develop their farming business during the rainy season.  They are on their fourth loan with the institution. Their prior loans have been fully repaid.  The crops are: tomatoes and jakatou (a vegetable that resembles a small green tomato but is actually a member of the eggplant family) by FATOUMATA the first person standing on the right of the photo.  With her loan, she plans to pay labor costs and buy inputs and agricultural seeds for maintaining 1.5 hectares. The output is sold at the village level, at the Fachoribougou village and at the SIKASSO market, after the harvest, to customers consisting of men and women.  She plans to earn an average profit of 95,500 FCFA per year. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenditures.  She wishes to maintain this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso to farm an even larger area to better earn more income.

loans.use: to pay labor costs and to buy inputs and agricultural seeds.

loans.name: Frankie

texts.en:
Frankie is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. He has a shop that sells canned goods, foods & beverages. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Frankie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Frankie hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. She has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages & biscuits. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, biscuits & beverages.

Florita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Florita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits & beverages.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a widow with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Riziki operates a food-stall business, selling retail to her neighbors and passersby. Her major goal in the business is to expand and establish a restaurant. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, and milk for her food stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, and milk for her food stall business

loans.name: Kotognogontala 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à FACHORIBOUGOU, un des villages de la commune de KABOILA dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : la tomate et le jakatou avec FANTA 1ère à droite position debout.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 2hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Kotognogontala group are married women averaging 38 years of age, with four children, and living for the most part in polygamous families in Fachoribougou, a village in the community of Kaboila, prefecture of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali).
They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiniwaso in order to ensure success of their agricultural activities during the winter season.
They are on their eighth loan with the institution. Past loans have been duly reimbursed. They cultivate tomatoes and  "jakatou" [a vegetable belonging to the eggplant family], as, for example, Fanta does. She is the first one standing on the right in the photo. 

With this loan she plans to pay the costs of manual labor, buy agricultural inputs and seeds in order to cultivate 2 hectares [5 acres] of land. The produce is sold in their village as well as at the market of Sikasso, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to achieve a monthly income of 145,500 per agricultural cycle. This income will allow her to pay her loan and to help her husband with everyday expensive. She would like to continue this collaboration with Soro Yiriwas on order to cultivate a larger plot and increase her income.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of labor, agricutlural inputs and seeds

loans.name: Luyen

texts.en: Luyen was born in 1972. She is married and has two children, a daughter and a son. She lives in Dai Bi village. Her husband is a builder. Ms. Luyen is a farmer. Not only does she grow rice, but she also raises fish and chickens. She has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2004. The last cycL., she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and repaid punctually. In this loan cycL., she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy food for her fish and chickens.

loans.use: to buy food for her fish and chickens

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mr. Mom, 59, lives with his wife and five children. Three of his children are single, and two of them are employed in various jobs. Mr. Mom and his wife are local farmers who are able to make around $2 USD each day. The couple has longtime experience in the crop-planting business in the province of Kompong Cham. It is a skill they learned from their grandparents back when they were single. Mr. Mom will use the loan to pay for plowing costs and to purchase other materials to start planting crops. Mr. Mom is pictured with his wife under their wooden house.

loans.use: to pay for plowing costs and to purchase other materials to start planting crops

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. She has a shop that sells animal feed for pigs & chickens. She has had this business for 14 years. She requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy sacks of animal feed.

Veneranda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Veneranda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of animal feed.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. She has a shop that sells a variety of fish. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more fish to sell.

Elvira has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Kotognogontala  3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à FACHORIBOUGOU, un des villages de la commune de KABOILA dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : la tomate et le jakatou avec ABI 2ème à droite position debout.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 65.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Kotognogontala 3 group are married women averaging 38 years of age with four children and living mainly in polygamous families in Fachoribougou, a village in the commune of Kaboila in the prefecture of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to ensure the success of their agricultural activities during the winter season.
They are on their eighth loan with the institution. The previous loans have been duly repaid.

They cultivate tomatoes and jakatou [a vegetable from the eggplant family]--as for example, Abi (second from right standing) does.

With her loan, she plans to pay the costs of labor, buy agricultural inputs and seeds to work 2 hectares [ 5 acres[ of land.
After harvesting, the produce is sold at their village and at the Sikasso market, to a customer base composed of both women and men.
She plans to earn an average monthly income of 65,500 West African franks per agricultural cycle. This income will allow her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of labor, agricultural inputs and seeds

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman with four children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are poultry feed and food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a poultry business, selling at wholesale from her home. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. The major challenge Victoria faces in her business is seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 70,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she wants to purchase poultry chicks and feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry chicks and feed

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 37 years old and married. She has a retail shop where she sells biscuits, soap, shampoo, and detergents to the people in her community. She has had this business for five years. Rebecca is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase soft drinks and canned goods to increase the capacity of sales from her business and to generate more income. Each month, Rebecca earns about 4,000 PHP doing this type of work. In the future, Rebecca hopes to continuously send her children to school and assure a brighter future for them.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Natalia

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia de Sofala, centro de Moçambique, tem 36 anos de idade é casada,  mãe de 2 filhos,de 9 e 18 anos, todos vão  a Escola. Vive na casa própria com sua familia sustenta sua sogra e sobrinha que vivem com ela. Fez a 9ª classe não concluiu devido a falta de concições.

sai de Sofala com seus pais para Maputo no tempo da guerra, devido a falta de condições teve que começar a trabalhar muito cedo, consegue uma proposta de  trabalho na Escola EP1 de Mugado( na vila da namaacha) como auxiliar administrativa onde se encontra ate então.  Trabalha das 6:45 as 14h auferindo mensalmente 1.821.02mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa. Para alêm do salário conta com ajuda do seu marido que trabalha na Africa do Sul. 


  Ja teve empréstimo no BIM ( outro banco comercial), Conhece a Hluvuku atraves dos colegas que também são clientes da instituição. Este é o quinto empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção ( chapas de zinco, portas e cimento) para dar continuidade da sua obra. Os três empréstimos anteriores de (3.500.00, 5.000.00  9.00.00 e 10.000.00)mt  foram para a mesma finalidade. 

  Esta feliz porque dentro em breve vai se mudar para a sua própria casa. Ira reembolsar cem nenhum problema para aceder a mais empréstimos.
texts.en:
This customer was born in the province of Sofala in central Mozambique.  She is 36 years old and married, the mother of two children ages 9 and 18.  Both attend school.  She lives in her own home with her family and also supports her mother in law and a niece who live with her.  She completed school through the 9th grade but did not finish because she did not have the means. 

She left Sofala with her parents for Maputo during the war.  Due to her situation, she had to begin working very young.  She was offered a job  at School EP1 in Mugado (in the town of Namaacha) as an administrative assistant, and she still works there now.  She works from 6:45am to 2pm and earns 1.821.02mt per month, which she uses for household expenses. In addition to her salary she has help from her husband who works in South Africa. 

She has already had a loan from BIM (another commercial bank).  She learned about Hluvuku through colleagues who are also clients.  This is her fifth loan, in the amount of 10.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase construction materials (zinc panels, doors, and cement) to continue building her home.  Her four prior loans were for 3,500.00, 5,000.00, 9.000.00 and 10.000.00mt, for the same purpose.  

She is happy because she will soon move into her own home.  She is going to pay her loan back without any problems in order to have access to future loans.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (zinc panels, doors and cement)

loans.name: Kotognogontala 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43ans, 4enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à FACHORIBOUGOU, un des villages de la commune de KABOILA dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : la tomate et le jakatou avec MAIMOUNATA 1ère à droite position debout.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 2hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Kotognogontala 4 group are married women averaging  43 years of age with four children and living mainly in polygamous families in Fachoribougou, a village in the commune of Kaboila in the prefecture of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to ensure the success of their agricultural activities during the winter season.
They are on their eighth loan with the institution. The previous loans have been duly repaid.

They cultivate tomatoes and “jakatou” [a vegetable from the eggplant] family. This is, for example, what  Maimounata  ( standing on the far right in the photo) does. With her loan, she plans to pay the costs of labor, buy agricultural inputs and seeds to work 2 hectares [5 acres] of land.

After harvesting, the produce is sold at the village and at the Sikasso market, to a customer base composed of both women and men.
She plans to earn an average monthly income of 145,500 per agricultural cycle. This income will allow her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with everyday expenses. She would like to continue her collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to work a greater plot of land and increase her income.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of manual labor, agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install more shelves and buy inventory to fill them

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more veterinary drugs to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is a talented lady; she shares the financial burden of her family by sewing clothes for neighboring clients. She learned this art as a teenager. Her business is earning enough for her to pay off the utilities. Her husband is a pastor in a church. 

Zubaida has given birth to two sons and a daughter. Her eldest son left his education after ninth grade and started doing a job. He works in the factory and is an expert in making pants and trousers. Her second son is a salesman and sells toffees and candies to different shops in the city. Her daughter is 22 years old, stays at home, and helps Zubaida in her daily routine. 

Zubaida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her business of sewing clothes. With the help, she will buy thread, lace and a new sewing machine to prepare better quality clothes and increase her profits. She has been operating her business for the past 10 years. She hopes that a loan investment will bring positive changes to her business and increase her income. 

She wants to marry off her daughter and hopes that increased profits will help her in buying a dowry for that purpose. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Zubaida.

loans.use: To buy thread, lace & a sewing machine for sewing business.

loans.name: Kotognogontala  5 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37ans, 4enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à FACHORIBOUGOU, un des villages de la commune de KABOILA dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : la tomate et le jakatou avec  ABI 1ère à droite position debout.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 65.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
Group Kotognogontala 5's ten members are married women who are on average 37 years old with four children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Fachoribougou, one of the villages of Kaboila Township in Sikasso prefecture (Mali's third administrative region).
They collaborate with microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their eighth loan with the organization, previous loans having been repaid successfully.
The species they cultivate are tomatoes and jakatou for Abi, who is standing up on the right. With her loan, she intends on paying plowing costs and buy fertilizers and seeds to cultivate 2.5 acres.
After the harvest, production is sold at the village level and at the Sikasso market to a clientele composed of men and women. She is counting on an average profit of 65,500 FCFA per agricultural cycle. This benefit will allow her to repay her loan and to also help her husband with daily expenses.
She wishes to maintain this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to operate an even larger cultivation space, the better to increase her profits.

loans.use: to pay plowing costs and buy agricultural fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Phuc

texts.en: Phuc was born in 1962. She lives in Dai Bi Village, Uy No Commune. She has three children. Two of her daughters are married. Her son is still young. Her husband is a builder. Ms. Phuc is a farmer. She not only grows rice but also raises fish. She has  had this job for 10 years. She has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2004. The last cycle, she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy food for fish.

loans.use: to buy food for fish

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. He has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages & biscuits. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional bread, biscuits & beverages.

Michael is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Michael hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional bread, biscuits & beverages.

loans.name: Kotognogontala 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA 6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36ans, 3enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à FACHORIBOUGOU, un des villages de la commune de KABOILA dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : la tomate et le jakatou avec AFOU 2ème à gauche position debout.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 65.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Kotognogontala 6 group are married women who average 36 years of age with three children; most of them live in polygamous families in Fachoribougou, one of the villages in the municipality of Kaboila, which lies in the prefecture of Sikasso, Mali's third administrative region.

They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to manage their businesses as well as possible during the rainy season. They are on their eighth loan with the institution, and the previous loans have all been paid in full and on time. 

Afou, who is standing second from the left on the photo grows tomatoes and jakatou (a vegetable belonging to the eggplant family). With her loan she is planning to pay for labor and buy agricultural inputs and seeds to maintain one hectar of land. Once it has been harvested the produce is sold in the village and at the market in Sikasso to a customer base made up of men and women. She is expecting to make an average profit of 65,000FCFA per season. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband with the daily expenses. She would like to maintain this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to farm an even larger piece of land and make more money.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs and the purchase of agricultural inputs and seeds

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. She makes a living running a retail store where she sells household goods like maize and wheat flour, salt, sugar and tea leaves, to  neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is competition from other retail shops. In the future, Rehema dreams of opening a reliable wholesale business. She is applying for a loan for Kshs 20,000 to buy bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and tea leaves. She decided to join Yehu to access loans that would allow her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of wheat and maize flour, sugar and tea leaves.

loans.name: Kamolidin

texts.ru: Камолидин житель города Худжанд. Ему 58 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена работает в колхозе и ежедневно получает 15-20 сомони. Сам Камолидин зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он у себя дома создал все условия для разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 8 лет. В сезонный период его ежемесячный доход составляет 1000 сомони. Он берет кредит для того чтобы закупить крупнорогатый скот и увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Kamolidin lives in Khojand.  He is 58 years old.  He is married.  He has three children.  His wife works on a collective farm and earns 15-20 somoni every day.  Kamolidin earns a living by raising cattle. He built everything necessary to raise cattle at home.  He has been doing this work for eight years.  In season, he earns 1000 somoni a month. He is taking out a loan to buy cattle and to increase his herd.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine  is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. She  has a retail shop that sells beverages like soft drinks & alcoholic drinks. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks of beverages.

Cristine  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Cristine  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of beverages.

loans.name: Kotognogontala 7 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA 7 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37ans, 4enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à FACHORIBOUGOU, un des villages de la commune de KABOILA dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : la tomate et le jakatou avec  AMINATA 1ère gauche position debout.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 65.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Kotognogontala 7 Group are married women, on average 37 years old, with four children, who mostly live in polygamist families in Fachoribougou, a village in the district of Kaboila in the Sikasso prefecture, the third administrative region of Mali.  They are working with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to better manage their agricultural business during the winter season.  They are on their eighth loan with the institution; all prior loans have been fully repaid.  

Aminata, the first woman on the left of the photo, in the front row, primarily grows tomatoes and jakatou- a type of small green eggplant.  With this loan, she intends to pay labor wages, purchase agricultural inputs and seeds to tend a 1 hectare plot.  After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and in the market of Sikasso, to a clientele of men and women.  She intends to earn an average profit of 65,500 FCFA per year.  This profit will allow her to payback her loan and also to help her husband with household expenses.  She hopes to maintain this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso in order to work an even larger plot in order to draw more profits.

loans.use: to pay wages and to purchase seeds and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Moeun is a domestic farmer who lives with her husband and two school-age children in the province of Kompong Cham. 

To earn revenue, Moeun cultivates crops and has been farming for many years. Her husband also supports her in the same business. They can earn a profit from her crop-planting business of about US $3 each day. With this slight income, they pay for the family expenses. 

Moeun would like to ask for a Kiva loan to pay for plowing costs and to buy fertilizers, insecticides and seeds for planting in the rainy season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing costs and to buy fertilizers, insecticides and seeds for planting in the rainy season.

loans.name: Helene

texts.en:
Helene  is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. She  has a retail shop that sells snacks, canned goods, biscuits & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & biscuits.

Helene  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Helene  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & biscuits.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a married and has six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped-in water, and her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For the past 20 years, she has run a business in her home where she sells snacks to neighbors and passersby. She also owns rental houses which contribute to her income. Amina dreams of expanding her business and owning more houses in the future. She is applying for a loan for Kshs 100,000 to renovate her houses by buying cement, sand and paint. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses by buying cement, sand and paints.

loans.name: Ochirsuren

texts.en:
Ochirsuren is 44 years old and makes a living as a professional driver. He lives with his wife and two children, who are 16 and 18, in a small house in Mongolia’s capital, Ulaanbaatar. Both of his children attend college, so the family has to pay high school fees. Ochirsuren’s wife helps him in his transportation business and they both work hard because they are determined to provide their children with a good education. 

Since 2003, Ochirsuren has run his business by using the family minivan. He has permission to carry passengers in one of the city’s remote areas which lacks bus service. He is applying for this loan to buy spare parts to service his van and ensure compliance with transportation safety regulations. Now he has 200,000 MNT on hand, and is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to get the rest of the money he needs to do this work.

He said, “I want to buy a big bus to run my transportation business, and then to be able to improve my children's education and buy my own apartment.”

loans.use: to buy parts to improve and repair his van.

loans.name: Merrylou

texts.en:
Merrylou is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. She has a retail shop that sells coconuts. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional stock of coconuts.

Merrylou is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Merrylou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of coconuts.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba is married and the loving mother of two children. She works hard at her business, which is selling different kinds of fabrics from a stall in the center of a local market. Her shop is located in a crowded place, which makes it easy for her to sell her goods. Matluba would like to get a loan of 7,500 TJS to buy fabrics to expand her business and increase the assortment of goods she has for sale. She will use her profits to pay for the cost of sending her daughter to a university.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being the home of a key post along the Silk Road and the place where the rule of Alexander the Great ended. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only seven percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have viable business propositions. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy fabrics to sell to her customers

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is married with eight children. Juliana is 56 years old and lives in Goin, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

She sells a variety of products such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and other household needs to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns Php 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase more products such as soap, shampoo, and anything that is needed in a household.

Juliana has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase more products such  as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and other household needs.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43ans, 4enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à  ZERLABA, un des villages de la commune de PIMPERNA dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : la tomate et le jakatou avec  GNIRE 1ère à gauche position debout de la photo.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 1hectare. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter au mieux son espace cultural pour en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkadi 1 Group ("Harmony") are married women who, on average, are 43 years old and have four children. Most of them live in polygamous families. They live in Zerlaba, one of the villages in the municipality of Pimperna in the prefecture of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to finance their agricultural business during the winter season. This is their seventh loan with the institution, the previous loans having been repaid on schedule.

They grow tomatoes and jakatous (a vegetable that resembles a small green tomato but is actually a member of the eggplant family). Gnire, who grows jakatous, is pictured standing at the left. She intends to use her loan to pay for plowing and buy supplies and seeds to cultivate one hectare of farmland. The harvest will be sold in her village and at the market in Sikasso a clientele made up of men and women.

Gnire expects to make an average profit of 145,500 CFA francs per season, which she will use to repay her loan and help her husband to cover daily household expenses. She wants to keep alive her cooperation with Soro Yiriwaso to best farm her land and earn more income from her activity.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and buy supplies and seeds.

loans.name: Hour

texts.en:
Hour, 35, is the mother of three school-aged children.
 
She is a fish vendor in the busy market in Siem Reap Province. Every day in early morning, she goes to buy fish from the fishermen to sell. Hour’s husband makes additional income by using his boat to pick up passengers for fees. 

Hour's business is going smoothly. She has a lot of regular customers who buy and eat her fish. She hopes to be able to look for extra income by using a Kiva loan to purchase a large quantity of fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of fish to sell.

loans.name: Jim

texts.en:
Jim is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Jim has a shop that sells used clothing. He has had this business for two years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of used clothing or "ukay-ukay." 

Jim is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jim hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy used clothing

loans.name: Elina

texts.en: Elina is 35 years old, she has five school-going children who are ages seven to eighteen years. Her husband is a farmer. She has owned  a general store for 10 years. From this business she has managed to have enough money to pay her children's school fees and meet her needs. Elina is requesting a loan to buy more items for her shop. She plans to save all her profits.

loans.use: To buy items for her shop.

loans.name: Hanifaan's Group

texts.en:
Hanifaan, 51, is a mother of three. Her two sons are drivers by profession while her daughter makes thread from used clothes. 

Hanifaan is very supportive in nature. She also makes thread from clothes on order. Besides her work, she carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. 

Her husband deals in scrap. He receives orders from different factories and other scrap dealers and earns profits. 

Hanifaan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy a donkey cart for her husband. It will help him delivering scrap such as used papers and plastic bottles to his client. Hanifaan is very confident that an investment will help her husband improve his business which will help her family to enjoy a better standard of living. 

She is a new loan user and this is her first application to Asasah. 

Note: "In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Hanifaan ".

loans.use: To buy a donkey cart for a scrap business

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42ans, 4enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à  ZERLABA, un des villages de la commune de PIMPERNA dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : la tomate et le jakatou avec  KARY 1ère à droite position accroupi de la photo.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 1hectare. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 142.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter au mieux son espace cultural pour en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 2 Group are married women, on average 42 years old, have four children, and mostly live in polygamist families in Zerlaba, a village in the district of Pimperna, in the Sikasso prefecture, the third administrative region of Mali.  They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better manage their agricultural businesses during the winter season.  They are on their seventh loan from the institution; all prior loans have been fully repaid.

Kary, the first woman squatting on the right of the photo, cultivates tomatoes and jakatou- a type of small green eggplant.  With this loan, she intends to pay labor wages, purchase seeds and agricultural inputs to work a 1 hectare plot.  After the harvest, the produce is sold within the village and in the Sikasso market to a clientele of men and women.  

She intends to earn an average profit of 142,500 FCFA per year.  This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and help her husband with household expenses.  She hopes to maintain this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso in order to make the most of her plot and reap more profit.

loans.use: to pay wages and to purchase seeds and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 5 children. 
Avelina has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and biscuits. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Avelina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Avelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 29 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. She owns a general store in which she sells different kinds of foodstuffs, such as beans and rice, together with other items. She has been doing this for five years and it is going  well.  The income she earns has enabled her meet her needs. Vestine is requesting a loan to buy rice and beans. With the profits she plans to save some of her earnings and continue feeding her children.

loans.use: To purchase rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Perla has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Perla is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, (Name) hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Benkadi  3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à  ZERLABA, un des villages de la commune de PIMPERNA dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : la tomate et le jakatou avec  ALIMATA 2ème à droite position debout de la photo.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 0.5hectare. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 65.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter au mieux son espace cultural pour en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The ten members of Group Benkadi 3 are married women who are on average 42 years old with four children. Most live in polygamous families in Zerlaba, one of the villages of Pimperna Township in Sikasso prefecture (Mali's third administrative region).
They collaborate with the micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan, previous loans having been successfully repaid.
The crops they grow for profit include tomatoes and jakatou for Alimata, the second standing woman from the right of the picture. With her loan, she intends on paying plowing costs and buying fertilizers and seeds to cultivate 1.2 acres.
After the harvest, productions are sold at the village level and at the market in Sikasso to a clientele composed of men and women. She plans on making an average benefit of 65,500 FCFA per cultivation cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with daily expenses.
She wishes to maintain this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso to make the most of her cultivation space and to increase her profit.

loans.use: to pay plowing costs and buy agricultural inputs (fertilizers, seeds...).

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Marivic has a shop that sells wood charcoal. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional wood for makingcharcoals.
Marivic has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Marivic hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional wood to make charcoal

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe  BENKADI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39ans, 4enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à  ZERLABA, un des villages de la commune de PIMPERNA dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : la tomate et le jakatou avec   DJENEBA 1ère à gauche position accroupi de la photo.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 1hectare. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter au mieux son espace cultural pour en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The 10 members of this BENKADI 4 group are married women with an average age of 39 and four children, who mostly live in polygamous families in ZERLABA, one of the villages of the township of PIMPERNA in the prefecture of SIKASSO, third administrative region of Mali.
