They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so that they can succeed in their activities during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution, and their preceding loans were correctly reimbursed. 

The crops they cultivate are tomatoes and "jakatou" (a local vegetable), as for example in the case of DJENEBA, the first on the left, sitting on her heels in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for plowing expenses, to buy farm inputs, and seeds to farm one hectare of land. Her produce is sold in the village and in the market of SIKASSO after harvesting, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 145,500 F CFA per season. 

This profit will allow her to repay he loan and to help her husband cover day-to-day expenses. She hopes to continue this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso so as to better manage her land and thus earn more from farming it.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, buying farm inputs, and agricultural seed.

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena, a married woman with one child who attends school, owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and transport for her child attending school.

For the past four years, Lena has operated a curio-selling shop near the coastal beaches to attract tourists who are her potential customers. Lena's major challenge is seasonality. Peak season for her business extends from July to December, when tourists are in Mombasa for holidays; low season is from January to May. Lena dreams of establishing another curio shop in the future.

Having joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business, Lena is now requesting a loan of Kshs 40,000 to purchase windows and doors to complete her house.

loans.use: to purchase windows and doors to complete her house.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Rosalie has a retail shop that sells wood charcoal. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy wood to make charcoal.
Rosalie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rosalie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy wood for making charcoal

loans.name: Solange

texts.en: Solange is 36 years old. She has two children who are ages eight and ten. Her husband is a business man. Solange owns a shop in which she sells different kinds of items which include sugar, rice, salt and sandals. She has done this business for 10 years and it has enabled her to develop. She is requesting a loan to buy more items such as salt, rice and sandals. With the profits she plans to construct a family house together with her savings.

loans.use: To buy items such as salt, rice and sandles for resale

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Rosalinda has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages & biscuits. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Rosalinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Sos

texts.en:
Sos, 42, is married and currently lives with his one child and her mother in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City. 

He is a fruit trader. Every day, he leaves his home to buy fruits in bulk from local farmers and then he sells it in the busy market. He has been in this selling business since 2007 and earns more or less $5 a day to cover the whole family's expenses. 

Currently, his selling business is getting better step-by-step, and he often adds new clients who come to buy his fruits. To expand this business, Sos is requesting a loan in the amount of $700 to purchase more fruits for future sale.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits for future sale.

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 4 1 ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à  ZERLABA, un des villages de la commune de PIMPERNA dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : la tomate et le jakatou avec  DJENEBA 1ère à gauche position debout de la photo.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 1hectare. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter au mieux son espace cultural pour en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The 10 members of this BENKADI 5 group are married women with an average age of 41 and three children on average, who mostly live in polygamous families in ZERLABA, one of the villages of the township of PIMPERNA in the prefecture of SIKASSO, third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so that they can succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution, and their preceding loans were correctly reimbursed.

The crops they cultivate are tomatoes and "jakatou" (a local vegetable), as for example in the case of DJENEBA, the first standing on the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for plowing expenses, to buy farm inputs, and seeds to farm one hectare of land. Her produce is sold in the village and in the market of SIKASSO after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 145,500 F CFA per season.

This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with day-to-day expenses. She hopes to continue this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso so as to better manage her land and thus earn more from farming it.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and buy farm inputs and seed.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is 30 years old. She has a one year old child and her husband is a driver. Flora has been selling food stuffs for two years. This business has been so useful to her family because it has enabled her to meet her needs and feed her family. She is requesting a loan to buy food stuffs such as beans. With the profits she plans to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs for sale

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en: Bibiana is a fifty six year old single mother living in a semi permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda. She does not have any dependents and her dream is to build a permanent house. In order to provide basics she decided to venture into selling clothes and has been in business for ten years. Her challenge is high rental cost and her dream is to build her own business premises. Bibiana intends to use the loan facility to buy clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna  is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 
Luna  has a shop that sells wood charcoal. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy wood for charcoal making.
Luna  has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Luna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy wood for charcoal making

loans.name: Nyabubare Twimukye Group

texts.en: 33 year old Gerald is a down to earth and dignified married father of 4. This hard working and warm hearted food sales business man has only been in this business for 4 years but he says the prospects for even greater success are getting better year in year out. What lies at the root of his optimism is the fact that there is a growing demand for the foods he sells not only in food markets in Bushenyi and other parts of western Uganda, but also in Rwanda. He sells principally cassava, beans, maize, millet, etc. Gerald is aided by the fact that he has a big farm from where he grows and harvests most of the aforementioned crops, which he resells. He reckons this business generates profits totaling 120,000 shillings per week. This loan is for the purchase of high grade manure to apply at his farms.

loans.use: to purchase high grade manure.

loans.name: Milicent

texts.en:
Milicent is a married woman with three children. Two of them attend school while one is underage. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She operates a hawking business of selling clothes from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase on credit. She dreams of establishing a butcher shop in the future.

With the 15,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a thirty-seven-year-old hardworking married man with two children, living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For six years he has been brewing alcohol and is also in the transport sector after diverting from bricklaying, which he had practiced for ten years. He has a challenge of limited capital to meet the demands of his customers, and his desire is to own a liquor store and buy a motorcycle. Robert needs the loan facility to buy bananas for brewing alcohol.

loans.use: to buy bananas for alcohol brewing.

loans.name: Joslyne

texts.en: Joslyne is 33 years old and she has a one-year-old child. Her husband is a businessman. Joslyne sells locally made beer.She has been selling beer for the past eight years and it has enabled her make some savings for her child and the others she hopes to have in the future. She is requesting a loan to buy more beer and hence make more profits. With the profits she plans to save for her child's school fees and meet her family's needs as well.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica, 43 years old is married to a farmer and is a mother of 3. She has a retail store and which has been operated for almost 7 years. Her net income is 25,000 PHP a month. She's asking a loan for 50,000 PHP to purchase additional grocery items to sell and for business improvement. She would like to continue availing herself of loans and hopes Kiva lenders will extend their assistance to her in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items to sell

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is a domestic farmer in the Siem Reap Province. She works at growing fruit on her farm. Chea and her husband make approximately US $3.5 per day from their fruit-planting business. 

This couple has given birth to six children, all of whom are single. Three of them are employed as local workers and work by picking potatoes at a farm. 

The family owns some medium-size farm land where they plant jackfruit, banana, and mango trees, but now they don’t have enough money to plant more. Hence, Chea is looking for a loan to purchase different kinds of fruit seeds for planting. She wants to use the remainder to sell some goods in front of her house.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of fruit seeds for planting.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer, 53 years old is married and blessed with one child. She has a retail store which she has been operated this business for almost 4 years. She's asking a loan for 50,000 PHP to purchase additional grocery items and for business expansion. Her net income is 25,000 PHP a month. She hopes to continue to avail herself of loans and to achieve her dreams for her children through patience and hard work.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items to sell

loans.name: Delgermurun

texts.en:
Delgermurun is 35 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters, ages 10 and 12 in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a small house in the outer ger (traditional Mongolian housing tent) districts. 
She sells clothes at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. Her husband works as a plumber at a local company. 
Usually, it is very difficult to obtain a rental contract at Narantuul because the stalls are in such high demand. When Delgermurun first began her business in 2003, she rented a stall at Narantuul from another person who had a rental contract with Narantuul. This was an unstable business situation for her because the middleman could dismiss her at any time.
In 2005, however, Delgermurun had the opportunity to sign a rental contract directly with Narantuul in order to make her business more stable. Now her working capital is 3,300,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT), and she sells clothes at her own two stalls.
For the past 8 years, Delgermurun and her husband have been successfully improving their living conditions gradually. For example, they built their own small house in 2010 and then they bought a used car with 8,000,000 MN of their business earnings in January, 2011. So, Delgermurun’s working capital decreased.

With this loan of 2,500,000 MNT, Delgermurun will purchase more clothes from Ereen City, China. Delgermurun wants to use this loan to help support her in this very busy shopping season of the year.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 42 years old, unmarried, and lives with her brother. She supports her brother financially by sewing clothes for her neighborhood clients. She is very skillful and receives regular orders every month. 

Her brother sells leather and also makes shoes. He sells leather to different factories which they use in making different leather products such as jackets, shoes etc. He sells shoes to different shops in the city. 

Rukhsana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother. With the loan, he will buy leather in bulk which will help him make better quality shoes and earn more income. He has been operating this business for the past four years and Rukhsana is hopeful that an investment will help him improve his business conditions and increase his profits. 

Note: "In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rukhsana ".

loans.use: To buy leather for shoe-making

loans.name: Daphine

texts.en: Daphine is a thirty eight year old married woman with three children living in her own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For ten years she has been selling second hand clothes, which has facilitated her in paying school fees for her children. She has challenges of natural hazards since she operates in the open. Her desire is to rent a sheltered business premise. Daphine needs the loan to buy clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Meswaleh

texts.en:
Meswaleh is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of opening a hairdressing school in the future.

With the 25,000 KES, she wants to purchase a sewing machine and cloth materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and cloth materials.

loans.name: Benkadi 7 Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe BENKADI 7 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40ans,  5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à  ZERLABA, un des villages de la commune de PIMPERNA dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : la tomate et le jakatou avec  NATEIKE CHAKA 2ème à gauche position debout de la photo.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 1hectare. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter au mieux son espace cultural pour en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The four members of this BENKADI 7 group are married women with an average age of 40 and five children on average, who mostly live in polygamous families in ZERLABA, one of the villages of the township of PIMPERNA in the prefecture of SIKASSO, third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so that they can succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution, and their preceding loans were correctly reimbursed.

The crops they cultivate are tomatoes and "jakatou" (a local vegetable), as for example in the case of NATEIKE CHAKA, the second on the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for plowing expenses and buy farm inputs and seeds to farm one hectare of land. Her produce is sold in the village and in the market of SIKASSO after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 95,000 F CFA per season.

This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with day-to-day expenses. She hopes to continue this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso so as to better manage her land and thus earn more from farming it.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and to buy farm inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Adégan Edem

texts.fr: Agée de 29ans, Mme Adégan est mariée à un coiffeur. Elle désire venir au secours des personnes en difficultés (femme enceinte, malade) c’est pour cela elle a ouvert en 2008 sa clinique nommée « EL SHADDAI » pour venir en aide aux couches vulnérables. Ce prêt lui servira à acheter des matériels d’accouchement (bassin de table, pince, table d’accouchement)
texts.en: Mme Adégan, 29, is married to a hairdresser. She wants to help women in need (pregnant or ill women) and for that reason she opened her clinic in 2008, calling it « EL SHADDAI » to help with difficult deliveries. This loan will be used to buy supplies for delivering babies (a standing sink, forceps, and a birthing table).

loans.use: to buy supplies used for birthing babies.

loans.name: Tchotchovi

texts.fr: Accoucheuse de profession, Tchotchovi est mariée à une secrétaire. Elle est âgée de 33ans, Elle a ouvert en 2009 sa clinique pour venir en aide surtout aux femmes enceintes. Elle voudrait ajouter à cette activité la vente des produits génériques c’est pour cela elle sollicite ce prêt.  Elle s’approvisionne dans une société pharmaceutique et revend dans sa clinique.
texts.en: A trained midwife, Tchotchovi is married to a secretary. She is 33 years old. In 2009, she opened her clinic to come to the aid, first and foremost, of pregnant women. She would like to add the sale of generic medicines to this business and that is why she is requesting this loan. She buys her supplies from a pharmaceutical company and sells them at her clinic.

loans.use: to buy generic medicines.

loans.name: Jiguiseme 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe JIGUISEME 3 sont des  hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41  ans,  5 enfants et vivant avec leurs femmes et leurs  enfants à Foh, un village situé à environ 35 km de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces producteurs sont à leur deuxième cycle de prêt  avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés avec satisfaction. 
Ce groupe de producteur fait la culture du maïs et sa vente depuis plusieurs années,  fait l’objet d’une activité rentable dans la zone.
KLEZANGA,  se tenant en position debout au milieu est le président de ce groupe,  il compte utiliser de la façon suivante son prêt : achat de 6 sacs d’urée, 4 sacs de complexe céréale, 5 litres d’herbicides et le reste comme frais de labours. Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Jiguiseme 3 group are married men averaging 41 years of age, with five children, and living with their wives and children in Foh, a village about 35 km from the city of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali).

These farmers are on their 10th loan cycle with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the goal of meeting customer demand. All prior loans have been repaid satisfactorily.

This farmers’ group has been cultivating and selling corn for years. This is a profitable activity in the region. Klezanza, standing in the middle in the photo is the group’s leader. He plans to use his loan in the following way: to buy six bags of urea, four bags of complex fertilizer, five liters of herbicides and to use the rest to pay manual labor. He plans to achieve an average monthly income of 90,000, which will be used for everyday family expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and pay for manual labor

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a thirty year old married man with two children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is the sole bread winner of the family and his desire is to educate his children up to the university level. He has been running a restaurant for four years after saving money from motorcycle riding. He has challenges of high labour turnover and his desire is to employe skilled waitresses. Julius needs the money to buy land and build a hotel.

loans.use: To buy land to build a hotel

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a married woman with 5 children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated an open food market business for the past 20 years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation, especially when the price of wheat flour and beans goes high. She dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and sacks of beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and sacks of beans.

loans.name: Akpéné Romaine

texts.fr: Mère de 02 enfants, Akpéné est revendeuse de boissons et de la nourriture. Elle a un bar  depuis 2005. Son conjoint est revendeur. Elle sollicite ce premier montant pour acheter de la boisson pour satisfaire sa demande croissante et assurer en partie à la charge de la famille.
texts.en: The mother of two children, Akpéné sells drinks and food. She has had a bar since 2005. Her husband is a small-scale merchant. She is asking for this loan to buy drinks to satisfy the growing demand and to help support the family.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Fazli

texts.en: Fazli is a 41-year-old woman. She is married and has two children. Fazli sells men's breeches, shorts and underwear in the local market of Isfara. She purchases her goods from Khujand and Istaravshan cities. Her husband and son help her trade when she goes for the purchase of goods. Fazli would like to get a loan of 6,000 TJS for purchasing a new assortment of goods in order to expand her business and improve her living conditions. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of clothes

loans.name: Arkadi

texts.en:
Arkadi works at the army. He lives with his wife and daughter. 

The main income to the family comes from the pig farm that Arkadi keeps. Currently, Arkadi needs to expand the business to earn additional income. Arkadi has applied for this loan to acquire two mother pigs and forage.

loans.use: to pay for pigs and forage.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a single woman with 4 children, all of whom are adults. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a green grocery business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also sells fried potatoes which contribute to her other source of income. She dreams of establishing a big restaurant in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes and vegetables to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Wouyessouly  1 Group

texts.fr:
WOUYESSOULY 1 est un regroupement de 10 hommes tous mariés vivant des familles traditionnelles élargies à  KOMALABA. Ils ont  en moyenne 42  ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. KOMALABA un village situé à environ 45 km de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces producteurs sont à leur premier cycle de prêt  pour la production du maïs avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
LADJI se tenant au milieu en position debout, compte utiliser son prêt de la façon suivante : achat de 6 sacs d’urée, 3 sacs de complexe céréale, 3 litres d’herbicides et le reste comme frais de  labour.
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice d’environ 100.000 FCFA utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
Il ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
WOUYESSOULY 1 is a group of ten men who are all married living in traditional extended families in KOMALABA. They average 41 years of age and five children each. KOMALABA is a village located about 45 km from Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). With the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, these producers are on their first loan cycle for producing corn.
 
LADJI, who is standing in the middle of the photo, intends on using his loan in the following way: to buy 6 sacks of urea, 3 sacks of a fertilizer mixture for grains, and 3 liters of herbicides. And the rest will be used for the cost of plowing.

LADJI envisions making a profit of about 100,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover day-to-day family expenses. His ambition is increase his turnover, so as to satisfy his customers further.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Wouyessouly  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe WOUYESSOULY  2 sont tous mariés. Ils ont une moyenne d’âge de 40  ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Ils vivent dans des familles traditionnelles à KOMALABA. Le village est situé à environ 45 km de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces producteurs sont à leur premier cycle de prêt  pour la production du maïs avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.  
MOUSSA, se tenant au milieu en position assise, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  6 sacs d’urée, 3 sacs de complexe céréale, 3 litres d’herbicides et le reste comme frais de  labour.
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice d’environ 100.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Wouyessouly 2 Group are all married.  They are, on average, 40 years old and have about five children each.  They live in traditional families in Komalaba.  The village is located approximately 45 km from this city of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.  

These growers are on their first loan cycle for the production of maize with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  Moussa, sitting in the middle of the first row, intends to use his loan to purchase 6 bags of urea, 3 bags of complexe céréale (a type of fertilizer), 3 liters of herbicide, and use the remainder to pay labor wages.  He hopes to earn a profit of about 100,000 FCFA which will be used for household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Amiran comes from a small village in the Abasha District. This district is well-known in the country for maize and nut growing. Amiran is 37 years old and a farmer. He lives in the village with his parents, who are retired and actively involved in the family agricultural business, which is the primary source of the income for them. 

Amiran has one bull and a milk cow, which gives them approximately 20 kg of cheese per month. It is sold to local dairy product retailers. They also have nut trees and sell 180-200 kg nuts per season. Two hectares of family-owned land are used for maize growing, where in total eight tons of maize is harvested. Half of the harvested maize is sold to local retailers and the rest is used in the dairy farm. On another two hectares of land the family grows four tons of musk-melon and 20 tons of watermelons. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 Laris. 

With the requested loan Amiran plans to purchase fertilizers for the melon garden. According to his estimation, after proper fertilization he will get six tons of musk-melon and 25 tons of melons for the season. It will mean an approximate 20% increase in the family's income 

Amiran plans to use the increase in income to renovate their house, as well as to purchase a mini-bus, which will work in West Georgia for transportation of people between nearby towns. It will bring additional income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilzers for a melon garden

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en: Ashot has been engaged in beekeeping for three years. The current production level does not allow Ashot to receive sufficient income, which would also enable him to increase the number of bee hives he has. With the help of this loan, Ashot will purchase more bee hives. Ashot lives with his wife, who is a school teacher.

loans.use: to pay for bee hives.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, soap, etc. to resell

loans.name: Roza

texts.en: Roza works at her city’s local TV station and lives with her parents, who are pensioners, and a brother who is unemployed. She supplements her income by selling milk from a cow she owns and by running her own fruit orchard. She and her family use this income to buy food, but it is not enough for provide them with a reasonable life. That is why Roza is applying for a loan to buy three new cows. This will help her and her family earn additional income and live a better life.

loans.use: to buy three cows.

loans.name: Ubaidullo

texts.en:
Ubaidullo is a farmer. He is married and the father of four children.  Since 1999 Ubaidullo has been running a cattle sales business and he has had a good business experience.  From the market in the villages he purchases cattle and he feeds them, then sells in the local market.  Ubaidullo is requesting a loan of 7,000 TJS for purchasing of sheep in order to increase his livestockl.  Ubaidullo hopes that the lenders will support him and allow him to expand his business.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Delvina

texts.en:
Delvina is married with one child.  Delvina is 38 years old and lives in Piao, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Delvina sells canned goods and other daily needs such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, oil, soy sauce, etc. to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years.  Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to purchase goods and other products.

Delvina has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  Delvina hopes to make her store bigger in the future.

loans.use: To purchase goods and other products like canned goods, soap, and other daily supplies.

loans.name: Musyoki

texts.en:
Musyoki is a 33 year old business man who is married to a woman named Alice.  They are blessed with two children, ages 10 and seven years respectively.  He has been running a green grocer business for the past 10 years earning an income of KES 15,000 per month.

He is taking out his third loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully.  He will use the loan to increase the stock that he buys, like kale, tomatoes and potatoes.  With the anticipated profit from the business he intends to educate his children.

His hope and dreams are to open a general shop which will enable him to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 35 years old and supports three members of his family. He is married to Lucy who is also a business lady. They have two children ages seven and four years respectively. 

He has been operating a retail shop for the past two years with a good income of KES. 20,000.  Charles is taking out his second loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully.  He will use this loan to purchase stock in his business like basins, plates, toy cars etc. 

His hopes and dreams are to own a big car garage which will support the family financially.

loans.use: To increase business stock like basins, plates, toy cars for sale.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen was born in 1979.  He lives in Sevkar village, Tavush marz, with his parents, his wife, and his three children: two daughters and a son.
Since 1985 Karen’s family has engaged in stock-raising, bee-keeping and land cultivation. With the profits from farming they supported their family, bought furniture and constructed a new cow-house. 

Also Karen is also involved in charcoal production, which is allowing him to increase his family income.  This is Karen’s second loan from Nor Horizon and Kiva and now he is asking for a 700.000 AMD to buy some calves for his farm and also fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy some calves for his farm and also fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil comes from the Samtredia District of the Imereti Region. This district is known in the country for high quality maize and nuts. Avtandil is 41 years old. He lives with his wife Fatima, two daughters aged 24 and 18, and his mother. His younger daughter goes to school and plans to enter a high school this year. His older daughter works as a cashier in a local credit institution. Avtandil's mother is retired. 

Avtandil and his mother are intensively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they run a small dairy farm with four cows and calves. Fatima produces and sells 70-80 kg of cheese on local open market. Also the family has two hectares of land where five tons of maize are grown. It is used for feeding the livestock. Also they have 800 nut trees and sell one ton of nuts to the local wholesalers. 

Avtandil will use 60% of the loan to purchase fuel to till the land with a tractor and the remaining 40% will be used for purchasing fertilizers. 

After fertilizing he will get eight tons of maize; five tons will be used on the farm and three will be sold at the local market.

The increase in income will be used to pay for the education of Avtandil's younger daughter–Avtandil and Fatima want to send her to a high school in Germany, which will give her a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and fuel for a tractor (for tilling the land)

loans.name: Fernandino

texts.en:
Fernando, 32 years old and  single, lives in Bañadero, Ozamis City where he rents a motorcycle in order to provide transportation services, earning  approximately PHP 5,000 per month.

A member of PMPC for two years, Fernando is requesting a loan to purchase his own motorcycle in order to increase his earnings.

loans.use: to purchase his own motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: tTo purchase seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Munkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Munkhtsetseg, a 40-year-old hardworking widow, lives with her daughter and son in one room of her rented apartment sewing workplace in Mongolia’s capital, Ulaanbaatar. Her daughter is a 20-year-old student, while her 19-year-old son recently became a drill man at a local drilling company.

Munkhtsetseg supports the entire family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia, and also has a clothes-making business with two sewers who repair and produce a variety of clothing items for their customers at a rented workplace. When Munkhtsetseg first began her clothing retail business in 2009, she had 500,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital at another person’s stall. Now she has 1,500,000 MNT in working capital at her own stall and she has 1,000,000 MNT in equipment at her sewing workplace.

With this loan of 1,300,000 MNT, Munkhtsetseg will purchase more clothes from Ereen City, China for this very busy shopping season.

Her family wants to build their own small house.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kasheshero United Group

texts.en: Selling timber has been 39-year-old Peace's business for four years now in Bushenyi, Western Uganda. Previously, this mother of three farmed. Peace has worked very hard for her success and is not looking to slow down, saying hard work is her formula to achieve longevity. Weekly she can earn profits of up to shillings 100,000, and this loan will be used to purchase more timber to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more timber to resell.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 22 years old, married to Veronica, and the father of one child aged six years. Joshua has been selling motorcycle spare parts for the past five years and makes a monthly income of KES. 8,000.

Now applying for his first loan of KES.30,000 after being introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member, he plans to purchase motorcycle spare parts for sale. With the profits from the business he intends to service his current motorcycle and improve his parents' living standard. Joshua also hopes to educate his child, improve his family's living standard, and eventually own a car wash machine.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase two calves and fodder

loans.name: Goderdzi

texts.en:
Goderdzi is a 42-year-old farmer from the village of Norio in the Abasha District in West Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife Shorena and three children: two daughters aged 17 and seven, and a 13-year-old son. All three children go to school. 

Goderdzi is a machinist by profession. He accepts orders from his and nearby villages and creates various items with the total cost of 350 Laris per month.

Along with his main profession he and Shorena run quite a strong family farm: they have three cows and four calves and sell 60 kg of cheese per month at the local market. They also have two pigs and sell 20 piglets per year. Along with this they have 0.7 hectares of land on which they grow maize. Any harvested corn is used for feeding the livestock. The total average monthly income is 700 Laris. 

With the requested loan Goderdzi will purchase a mini tractor. Then using his professional skills, he will modify the engine and increase its capacity, so he'll be able to use it in his and neighboring large farms for tilling. It will supply the family with additional income. The increase in income will be used to improve the living conditions of the family, including the purchase of new household goods.

loans.use: to purchase a mini tractor

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a hardworking man who is married and has 4 children. Juma is engaged in animal husbandry. He has 5 cattle and 12 sheep. Besides this business, he also cultivates vegetables. Using the profits from the business, he plans to repair his house. 

Juma would like to get a loan of 5,000 TJS to purchase sheep and to expand his business.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase 5 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more merchandise for his grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase new inventory to expand the business

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en:
Ephantus is 36 years old, married, and has two children. He has been running a general shop for the past 15 years with a monthly income of 11,000 KES. He is requesting his second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. He will use the loan to add stock such as sugar, rice, wheat flour, and cooking oil for sale.  

With the anticipated profit from his business, Ephantus intends to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to expand his retail shop, educate his children up to high levels, and improve the living standard for his family.

loans.use: To add stock like sugar, rice, wheat flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ryamatumba Twimukye Group

texts.en: John is 55 years old, married, and has six children. His business is a butcher shop in Bushenyi Town. This business has been in existence for the last four years. He began this business with capital from his farming business. He has not dispensed with the farming business though because he says he still earns handsomely from it. The only challenge John cites in the farm sales business is competition. His weekly business sales profits are 150,000 shillings.  With this loan, John will purchase cattle for slaughter purposes.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Benjelyn

texts.en: Benjelyn is 36 years old, married, and has one child.  She lives in Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. To earn a living, Benjelyn runs a restaurant. She earns about 5,000 PHP each month. Benjelyn joined PMPC this year and is requesting a loan to purchase raw ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three calves.

loans.name: Urandari

texts.en:
Urandari is 27 years old, married, and has one child, who attends school.  They live in a small house in Mongolia’s capital, Ulaanbaatar. Her husband is a taxi driver. Urandari’s mother, who lives with them, is retired.

Urandari supports her family by operating a retail stall at the local accessories shop. She sells clothes and accessories at a low price so demand for her products is high. She is planning to expand her business so that she can rehabilitate her own small house.

With this loan of 3,000,000 MNT, Urandari will purchase more clothes and accessories from Ereen City, China. She wants to use this loan to help support her in this very busy shopping season of the year.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and accessories to sell

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey is 28 years old, married, and has one child. He works as a mechanic in auto repair, which he has been doing for six years.The business earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES. This is Geoffrey's second loan with KADET LTD and has successfully repaid his previous loan. He will use the loan to purchase a tool box for auto repair. Geoffrey hopes to own a garage in future.

loans.use: To purchase a tool box for auto repair

loans.name: Gloria Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kavuo, représentante du groupe d’affaire « Gloria »,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 33 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants. Son mari est un vendeur ambulant des divers (colporteur) dans la ville de Goma. Elle est vendeuse de farine de manioc au petit  marché sectoriel de Majengo.  Il ya 5 ans révolus qu’elle exerce cette activité. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  12 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  6 sacs de farine de manioc.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants, acheter une parcelle et y construire une maison.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire «  Gloria» est composé de 26 clientes. Certes, 2 figures furent invisibles sur la photo  du groupe. Cette photo fut prise à l’intérieur de la chapelle catholique.
texts.en:
Kavuo, the client who represents the business group called «Gloria»,  is an entrepreneur aged 33, married and the mother of seven children. Her husband is an ambulant seller of various items (peddler) in the town of Goma. She sells manioc flour in the little neighborhood market of  Majengo.  She has been in this business for five full years, and she has just completed 12 loans with Hekima. 

This new loan will serve to buy six sacks of manioc flour. Moreover, Kavuo wishes to put her children in school and buy a plot of land and build a house on it. This cllient thanks Hekima for its endeavors in favor of poor women who are excluded from the conventional banks. Please note that the business group «Gloria» is made up of 26 clients. Of course, two of them were not visible in the group photo. This photo was taken inside a Catholic chapel.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of manioc flour.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ira

texts.en:
Ira comes from the village of Zenobani, Chokhatauri District, West Georgia. She is 64 years old and lives in the village with her large family: her husband – Anatoly, 27-year-old son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren – six-year-oldy Saba (who goes to school) and three-year-old Ana-Maria.
Ira runs a small mixed store in Chokhatauri. She sells grocery, household goods and clothes. She purchases her stock in Kutaisi (the administrative centre of West Georgia) and sells it in the store. Her shop's daily turnover is 50 to 60 Laris. Her total monthly profit amounts to 300 Laris.
Along with her small business, Ira’s family’s income comes from an agricultural business run by Anatoly. He has a small dairy farm with two cows, which gives them 30kg of cheese per month; and also some nut trees – one tonne of nuts is sold to the wholesalers in season. The total monthly income of the family is up to 1,100 Laris.
With the requested credit, Ira will increase her store's stock to ensure the smooth functioning of her business. According to her estimations, new goods will attract new customers and her daily turnover, as well as profits, will increase. With the increase in income, Ira plans to replace the roof of her house, as it is already old and can’t protect the house from rainfall and snow.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store.

loans.name: Coka Kiwalani Group

texts.en:
Irene, who is in her late 20s, is single. She has a small general store, which she has run for six months. She works from 6 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Irene's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to increase the shop inventory. Her dream is to one day own a grocery where she can sell drinks and snacks. Irene will share this loan with her loan group "Coka Kiwalani," which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase the shop inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of palm oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare the land for planting and also buy sheep and goats to raise.

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en:
Nargiz lives together with her husband and two student sons. 

She is an economist by profession, but since 1999 Nargiz has been trading fruits and vegetables at one of the city's most popular fruit and vegetable markets. 

She would like to increase the variety of fruits and enlarge her business. With the help of the loan, she will increase sales, meet clients’ demands and receive more income. 

Additional income will help her cover the family’s daily costs as well as pay for her sons’ university fees.

loans.use: to increase the variety of fruit and enlarge her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a sack of wheat flour, 30kilos of beans, a sack of rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare the land for farming and purchase maize seeds.

loans.name: Arus

texts.en:
Arus is engaged in farming. She keeps cattle and pigs. Arus is married and lives with her husband, their child and husband’s parents. 

The couple is planning to expand their family, and to insure a stable future for the children and the grownups, Arus would like to increase her income through expanding the business. With this loan, Arus will buy more livestock.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to expand her business.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya comes from the small village of Sujuna in Samtredia District. She is 36 years old and works as a doctor’s assistant in a local hospital. Maya is married and lives with her husband, Guram, her elderly father, five-year-old daughter and four-year-old son. The children go to kindergarten.
Along with Maya’s salary (300 Laris per month), the family’s other source of income is an agricultural business, which is led by Guram. The family owns a dairy farm with five milk cows and four calves. Milk is used for cheese production, which is sold by Guram on the local open market – approximately 100kg per month. Along with the dairy, Guram and Maya grow maize on two hectares of the family-owned land. Eighty per cent of the harvested corn is used in the farm for feeding the livestock and the remaining twenty per cent is sold on the local open market.
With thirty per cent of the requested credit, Maya and Guram will purchase fertilizers, which will increase the productivity of the land and thus the amount of harvested corn by twenty to thirty per cent. More corn will be sold on the market and the income of the family will increase. The rest of the funds will be used for bathroom renovation. Maya plans to use her increased income to renovate her house as it is already old and needs some repairs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for maize growing and materials for bathroom renovation.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en: Bella and her husband work in the local schools. Bella is a high school math’s teacher. Unfortunately their salaries, even combined, are not enough for the family with two children to live on. Together with her husband Bella grows vegetables for the family and to sell. Thanks to this loan Bella will purchase potato seeds and cabbage seedlings.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds and cabbage seedlings

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 29 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with two children. Edna works in the fish industry, catching and selling fish for a living. She has been doing this for six years. She has requested a loan to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Samarik

texts.en: Samarik has been a farmer for the last three years. He is 23 years old, single, and supports his parents. He learned about KADET from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area. This is his third loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to us it to purchase farm supplies. He intends to use the returns from the loan to reinvest in farming and buy a bigger farm. His dream is to be the best farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Daniela's Cruz Group

texts.en:
Daniela, is married with two children, She is 45 years old and lives in Bañadero, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. Daniela has a motorcycle transport business and earns approximately Php 3,500 each month.  A member of PMPC for 3 years, she is  requesting a loan to purchase equipment for motorcycle maintenance.

Daniela is the leader of a two-person loan group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair treatment products and a hair dryer.

loans.name: Unión Estrella Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIÓN ESTRELLA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Lola. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicio 

La señora Lola indica que es la primera vez que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida y humintas, que inicio hace diez años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de refrescos, cerveza, insumos para la elaboración de las comidas), que consiguieran por mayor de la Ceja y el Puente Vela (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto) y los venderá en la parada del minibús 692, de lunes a sábado. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación continua y salud básica.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Unión Estrella” (Union Star) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Lola. The members of this Communal Bank have succeeded in their various businesses in the retail, manufacturing, and service sectors.

Sra. Lola says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation at a promotional event. She currently has a business selling food and Bolivian tamales. Lola started her business ten years ago.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital so that she can buy soft drinks, beer, and supplies for preparing her dishes. She acquires her supplies in bulk in the neighborhood of La Ceja and at El Puente Vela (a commercial area in the city of El Alto). Lola sells her dishes Monday through Saturday at the No. 692 Minibus Stop. By working in this manner, she is able to generate income to support her family as much as possible. Lola is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Lola said that she enjoys the continuing education seminars and the basic health services.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, beer, and supplies for preparing dishes.

loans.name: Armie Gumisad Group

texts.en:
Armie, married with four children, is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines where she has been growing rice to earn a living for 15 years. A member of PMPC for four years, Armie is requesting a loan to purchase farm supplies.

Armie is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: St. Noah Development Group

texts.en: Scolastic, 34 and living with her husband in a permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda, is very hardworking, charged as she is with the responsibility of looking after her five children whom she longs to see educated and self-sustaining. Scolastic has been selling fish for one year and is requesting a loan to buy more fish for resale.  Her dream is to buy a car for the transportation of her fish.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Ruphelle

texts.en: Ruphelle, a 39-year-old married mother of two children, lives in Bañadero, Ozamiz City where she operates a grocery store and earns approximately Php 6,000 each month. A member of PMPC for one year, she is requesting a loan to  purchase additional grocery stocks.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery stocks.

loans.name: Tarsisio

texts.en: Tarsisio is a 43-year-old married father of five children, and he  owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Being a basket-maker for 10 years has enabled him to pay for his children's school fees. Tarsisio's hardship is a lack of sufficient capital, but he dreams of setting up a crafts' centre and educating children. Tarsisio intends to use the loan to buy materials for weaving baskets.

loans.use: to buy materials for weaving baskets.

loans.name: Las Bendecidas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS BENDECIDAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Norah. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, venta de verduras, repuestos de olla, comedera, venta de cosméticos

La señora Norah,  indica que hace un ciclo que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de su amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y de comida que inicio desde hace cinco años aprendió el oficio de su mamá. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra insumos para la elaboración de comida (fideo, arroz, aceite, verduras, etc.). Estos productos los comprará por mayor de la Ceja de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo venderá en el Desaguadero. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera y  tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Bendecidas” (The Blessed Ones) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center.  This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Norah.  The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as selling clothes, selling vegetables, repairing cookware, preparing food, and selling cosmetics.  

Sra. Norah says that she has worked with Pro Mujer for one loan cycle.  She joined the organization after being invited by a friend.  At the moment, she has a business in which she sells clothes and food.  Norah started her business five years ago after learning the trade from her mother.

Her loan will be used to buy supplies for preparing food such as noodles, rice, oil, vegetables, and other items.  She sells her dishes in mass quantities in the neighborhood of La Ceja in the city of El Alto.  Norah also prepares and sells her food in El Desaguadero (an area along the border between Bolivia and Peru).  By working in this manner, she is able to generate income to support her family.  Norah is single and has one child.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Norah responded that she enjoys the savings.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, rice, oil, vegetables, and other supplies.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson, 42, is a married man with four children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling clothes for four years. He used  to sell cooking oil, and after accumulating reasonable capital, he ventured into his current business. His hardship is limited capital and his vision is owning a boutique and educating his children. Jackson needs the loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Zaira

texts.en:
Zaira and her husband live in village Gomi, Samtredia District, West Georgia. She is 53 years old and heads the family agricultural business. Zaira’s husband Geno works as a trailer driver. He is also involved in the family business. 

Zaira and Geno have three milk cows and 2 calves. Zaira produces cheese and sells it on the local open market, approximately 60 kg of it per month. Also they have 200 hens and sell 400 eggs per month. Along with the above-mentioned, the family sells flour. The monthly turnover in their business is 7500 Laris. There is potential (demand on the market) for increasing the business, but Zaira lacks space for stockpiling the flour, as she keeps it in a separate room of her house, which can’t hold more of the product.  

With one-third of the requested credit, Zaira will purchase an additional milk cow and will be able to produce and sell more cheese and two-thirds of the borrowed amount will be used for construction of a flour storehouse, which will allow Zaira to increase sales made by her business. 

Zaira and Geno plan to reinvest part of their profit in their business and the other part will be used for improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and materials for storehouse construction.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy barbed wire for fencing.

loans.name: Hope

texts.en: Hope is a 42-year-old single mother with three children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in secondhand clothes for ten years, during which she started with retail and now has a wholesale shop. Her hardship is poor quality clothes that lead to losses, and her vision is a big boutique plus educating her children. Hope needs the loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mapinduzi Group

texts.en:
Zena, who is in her late 20s, is married with three daughters. Two of them attend school. Zena has been selling mobile telephones and phone accessories since 2003. She works from 7am to 9pm daily, and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use for buying more mobile phones and phone accessories to sell. Her dream is to one day open another shop of the same business.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Mapinduzi", which has a total of 15 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phones and phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Virginia Ester

texts.es:
Virginia, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos D. 25, 20 y 17 años D. edad, ellos tienen casa propia. Virginia se dedica a la venta D. merienda y tablilla, el negocio lo inicio hace 9 años, ha ella sus hijos le colaboran.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. cacao para hacer la tablilla, también materiales para las meriendas, como pollo, carne, verduras, condimentos y aceite, este préstamo le ayudara a tener disponibilidad D. materiales para el negocio.
Su objetivo es tener un negocio rentable, aumentar las ganancias para su familia.
texts.en:
Virginia lives in her own home with her husband and three children (ages 25, 20, and 17). She sells meals and chocolate desserts. Virginia started her business nine years ago and her children help her with managing it.

She is currently requesting a loan in order to buy cacao for making chocolate as well as ingredients for her meals such as chicken, meat, vegetables, condiments, and oil. This loan will help her have available supplies on hand for her business.

Her goal is to have a profitable business so that she can generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cacao, chicken, meat, vegetables, condiments, and oil.

loans.name: Edreda

texts.en: Edreda, 35, is a married woman with two children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the poultry business for ten years, and with the income generated, she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Her hardship is limited capital to meet the increasing demand of her customers and her vision is to increase on her poultry projected to at least 2,000 birds, as well as educate her children. Edreda needs the loan to buy chicks and feed for her poultry farm.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed

loans.name: Zephanus

texts.en: Zephanus is a 43-year-old married man with four children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the beer and soda sales business for 16 years. He got his initial capital from rearing goats and crop farming. His hardships are debtors and price fluctuations, and his vision is to have a wholesale beer and soda shop plus a well educated family. Zephanus needs the loan to buy sodas and beers for resale.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beers for resale.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Amaqella, tiene 50 años, es casada, tiene 6 hijos, se dedica a la venta D. materiales D. construcción. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en el pago D. los peones que elaboraron los ladrillos.
Juana, se dedica a la venta D. ladrillos, cemento, fierros por pedidos, aprendió D. este negocio desD. muy joven D. sus padres. Esta está en FINCA Perú, hace 17 años, le gusta por la facilidad en la que recibe los préstamos, trabaja a base D. confianza. Se aprenD. mucho D. las capacitaciones que da su promotora y se pasa bonitos momentos con las compañeras D. su banco. Con sus ahorros y algunos préstamos se pudo comprar su volquete con lo cual reparte agregados cuando le solicitan. Con sus últimos ahorros se compró un terreno en Chacco. Tuvo algunas dificultades garantizo a su comadre y no pago así que ella tuvo que asumir la deuda. Su sueño es poder adquirir otro volquete más granD. y construir un recreo en el terreno que adquirió hace poco.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “Amaqella”. She is 50 years old, married, and has six children. Juana has a business selling construction materials. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay her workers who make bricks.

Juana sells bricks, cement, and iron by request. She learned this business from her parents when she was a young woman. Juana has been with FINCA Peru for 17 years. She enjoys the convenience that comes with the loans and having a working relationship based on trust. Juana has learned so much from the training seminars conducted by her loan officer and has experienced some wonderful moments with the other members of her Communal Bank. Using her savings and a few loans, Juana was able to buy a dump truck for delivering gravel whenever her customers requested this product. More recently, she used her savings to purchase a plot of land in Chacco. Juana has had some difficulties after guaranteeing a loan maD. by the godmother of her children. She was not able to pay, so Juana had to assume the debt.

Her dreams incluD. acquiring another dump truck and building a recreation center on the land she recently purchased.

loans.use: to pay her workers who make bricks.

loans.name: Bismark

texts.en: Bismark, 24, is married with one child and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the retail business for three years, and with the income earned, he has been able to buy land. His hardship is debtors who delay payments and his vision is to have a wholesale business plus a building in town. Bismark needs the loan to buy biscuits for resale.

loans.use: to buy biscuits and drinks for resale.

loans.name: Dios Ante Todo 1 - 2 Group

texts.en:
Margo is the coordinator of her group, Dios Ante Todo 1, 2 (God first), located in a village where most of the citizen are Haitians. She lives in a modest home with one of her three children. With this effort, she can make extra income and help her long-term partner. In the meantime, she enjoys doing business.

Margo is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for almost one year, after starting by selling a dozen pairs of jean pants she bought with her first loan. Now she has a clothing sales business and will start to sell coffee and breakfast in the mornings, so she is planning to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothing, in different sizes for men and women, as well as coffee, sugar, sausages and other items to be able to offer some meals in the mornings. She will reinvest the profits in her business by purchasing more products and expanding her business with more options and new clients. She is dreaming to become someone with a very important business.

Margo represents her group and many Haitians who emigrated to the Dominican Republic to improve their lives. In this group are a sample of ten Haitian families fighting to overcome the Haiti crisis. Thanks to all of you for supporting this group.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, underwear; also coffee, sugar and sausages, etc., to expand her business.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza es socia del Banco Comunal Amaqella, tiene 67 años, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos ya profesionales.
Lorenza tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en general en su domicilio, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. abarrotes para surtir su mercadería. Esta en FINCA Perú, hace 17 años le gusta por la facilidad D. los préstamos sin tantos papeles. Estando en FINCA Perú construyó su casa, educó a sus hijos e implementó su tienda, compró su congeladora refrigeradora.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a member of the Communal Bank “Amaqella”. She is 67 years old, married, and has two children who are already professionals.

Lorenza manages a grocery store out of her home. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of groceries to restock her inventory. She has been with FINCA Peru for 17 years and enjoys the convenience of accessing the loans without a lot of paperwork.

While working with FINCA Peru, Lorenza has been able to build her house, proviD. her children with an education, establish her business, and purchase a refrigerator and freezer.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to restock her grocery store.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es: Rosaura es socia del Banco Comunal Amaqella, tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mas mercadería. Ingresó a la venta de cosméticos por la invitación de una amiga por su buen desempeño fue escalando cargos ahora es supervisora de la zona “C” le gusta FINCA Perú, por la facilidad de los créditos, por las capacitaciones y se puede ahorrar.
texts.en:
Rosaura is a member of the Communal Bank “Amaqella”. She is 38 years old, married, and has two children. Rosaura sells cosmetics and is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of more merchandise. She got involved in selling cosmetics after being invited by a friend. As a result of her good performance, Rosaura was able to climb the ranks and is now the supervisor of District “C”.

She enjoys FINCA Peru because of the convenience of the loans, the training seminars, and having the ability to save.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Mujeres Siempre Adelante Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "MUJERES SIEMPRE ADELANTE" porque ellas consideran que tienen que ir creciendo hacia delante, tanto personal como en su trabajo, este grupo esta ubicado en Hidalgo, México. Esta conformado por 9 integrantes. La señora Valeria es la tesorera del grupo, tiene 26 años, estudió hasta la secundaria y es madre soltera de 2 hijos varones de 8 y 3 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos desde hace ya 5 años, ella requiere dicho prestamo para expandir su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades del cliente ofreciendoles mayor variedad de mercancia, asi mismo poder mejorar sus ingreso y con ello elevar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y alimentar su espiritu emprendedor. Con el prestamo ella va a comprar zapatos y ropa de diferentes colores, tallas y modelos para que todos los gustos de sus clientes, ya que le hacen pedidos distintos y de diferentes marcas.
texts.en: This group is called Mujeres Siempre Adelante (Women Always Moving Forward) because they feel that they must be moving forward, both personally and professionally. This group is located in Hidalgo, Mexico. It is formed of nine members. Valeria is the group's treasurer. She is 26 years old, studied through high school, and is a single mother of two sons who are eight and three years old. She has been selling clothes and shoes for five years. She needs this loan to expand her business and satisfy her customers' needs by offering a better variety of merchandise. This is how she will be able to improve her revenue and improve her sons' quality of life, as well as boost her entrepreneurial spirit. With this loan she will purchase shoes and clothes in different colors, sizes, and styles to please all her customers, since they put in distinct orders for different brands.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and clothes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase better manure to apply on her farm

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la reparación de redes y elaboración de hamacas, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos  de 21 y 25 años de edad, José inicio hace 20 años con su negocio, cuando trabajaba en barcos pesqueros, este trabajo le ha permitido dar a sus hijos lo necesario en alimentación y vestuario. 
Actualmente él solicita un préstamo para la compra de material para la elaboración de hamacas y redes, su principal material es cáñamo, hilo de seda de diferentes colores, este  préstamo le ayudara a contar con todo lo necesario para producir y tener mayor disponibilidad para los clientes.
Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio a través de financiamientos, aumentar las ganancias y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Jose makes a living repairing nets and making hammocks.  He lives with his wife and his two children of 21 and 25 years of age.  Jose started his business 20 years ago, when he was working on fishing boats.  This work has allowed him to provide the necessities such as clothing and food to his children.  He is currently requesting a loan to purchase materials for the making of hammocks and nets.  His main material is hemp and silk thread of various colors. This loan will make him able to get all that is necessary to produce and have more available for his customers.  His objectives are to improve his business through financing, increase his profits and improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: to purchase hemp and silk thread of various colors for the making of hammocks and nets.

loans.name: Eddy Antonio

texts.es: Eddy Antonio es tiene 36 años, su actividad es la venta de granos básicos. El  es una persona muy conocida en su barrio por ser una persona alegre, honrada y muy trabajadora. Además el se dedica a brindar el servicio de guarda de seguridad, son los fines de semana que se encarga de visitar a sus clientes para enviarles los pedidos que le realizan.
