Siempre piensa en ampliar cada día más su negocio y al mismo tiempo incrementar su inventario. El crédito es para la compra de maíz, frijoles, arroz, aceite, concentrado y azúcar.
texts.en: Eddy Antonio is 36 years old.  His business is selling basic grains.  He is a very well-known person in his neighborhood as he is a cheerful, honest and very hard-working person.  He also works as a security guard.  On weekends he visits his customers to deliver the orders that they have made with him.  Eddy Antonio is always thinking of expanding his business every day and, at the same time, increasing his inventory.  He will use this loan to buy corn, beans, rice, oil, concentrate and sugar.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, rice, oil, concentrate and sugar

loans.name: Maribel De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Maribel, se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas, vive con sus padres y sus hijas de 10 y 7 años de edad, ella para el sostenimiento de sus hijos, siembra chile, pepino, pipián, tomates, sus padres le enseñaron este oficio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos para la siembra, como abono y fertilizantes, también semilla, con este financiamiento podrá tener todos los materiales necesarios para dar inicio al cultivo.
El objetivo de ella es tener buenos resultados con sus cosechas, que sean sanos sus productos y que esto le permita tener una buena comercialización.
texts.en:
Maribel grows vegetables such as: chiles, cucumbers, squash, and tomatoes to support her children..  She and her two daughters, 10 and 7,  live with her parents, who taught her this business.  

Maribel is requesting the loan to buy supplies such as manure, fertilizers and seeds.  This financing will give her all she needs to start planting.  Her goal is to have good crops that are healthy and will sell well.

loans.use: To buy manure, fertilizer and seeds to plant chiles, tomatoes, cucumbers and squash.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorbike taxi.

loans.name: Yuly Karina

texts.es: Yuly es socia del Banco Comunal Amaqella, tiene 29 años, conviviente, tiene 2 hijos. Yuly se dedica a la venta de repuestos por pedidos. Yuly y su pareja tienen una mecánica de carros es especialista en turbo y Yuly vende repuestos. Ingreso a FINCA Perú, por la invitación de una socia, le gusta por la facilidad de los créditos y les dan la oportunidad de trabajar, se puede ahorrar. Su sueño es poder abrir una tienda de repuestos.
texts.en:
Yuly is a member of the Amaqella community bank.  She is 29 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children.  Yuly's business is selling spare parts to order.  Yuly and her partner have a car maintenance business.  They are specialists in turbo-charged cars.  Yuly sells spare parts.

Yuly joined FINCA Peru through an invitation from an existing member.  She likes it because of the ease of obtaining loans, the fact that they are given an opportunity to work and the fact that they can save.  Yuly's dream is to open a store where she can sell spare parts.

loans.use: to buy vehicle parts

loans.name: William Ernesto

texts.es:
William, se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, vive con su familia, y tiene un año de dedicarse al negocio, lo inicio después de trabajar como motorista de buses, decidió instalar el negocio que fuera más rentable que su anterior trabajo.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, maicillo, frijol y café, esta compra le ayudara a tener más inventario para mejorar la atención a los clientes.
Su objetivo es a través del negocio mejorar las ventas, ya que al contar con todo lo necesario espera estabilizarse, y así mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
William's business is selling basic grains.  He lives with his family and has been in this business for one year.  He started in his business after having previously worked as a bus driver.  He decided to set up his business as it was more profitable than his previous job.  

William is requesting a loan to buy corn, millet, beans and coffee.  This purchase will help him to have more merchandise in stock so that he can improve his customer service.

William's goal is to improve his sales.  Through having everything he needs available to him, he hopes to stabilize his business and thereby improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy corn, millet, beans and coffee to sell

loans.name: Girasol Group

texts.es:
El grupo Girasol está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Rosa Emelia de 36 años quien desde hace 17 años tiene una refresquería en mercado de San Judas la cual poco a poco por su ardua labor y los prestamos ha ido creciendo.

Rosa invertirá el crédito en la compra de materia prima para su negocio como son las frutas, el azúcar, los baldes, las bolsas, vasos… etc.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Sugey de 29 años y Eva Esther de 50 años quienes se dedican a la venta de cosméticos y con el crédito compraran productos de encargo.
texts.en:
The 'Girasol' (Sunflower) group has three hard-working, determined and entrepreneurial members.  One of them is 36 year-old Rosa Emelia who has owned a soft drinks business in San Judas market for 17 years.  Gradually, through her hard work and loans, she has managed to grow her business.

Rosa will invest her loan in buying supplies for her business such as fruit, sugar, buckets, bags, cups, etc.

The other members of this group are 29 year-old Sugey and 50 year-old Eva Esther who both sell cosmetics and will use their loans to buy products that their customers have ordered.

loans.use: to buy fruit, sugar, buckets, bags, cups, etc.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, es empleada, vive con su esposo y su hija de 2 años, ella trabaja en una pastelería, de este trabajo obtiene los ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
Actualmente tiene la necesidad de reparar una bomba de pozo de agua, ya que esta bomba es la que se encarga del paso del agua por la tubería para la vivienda, ella solicita un préstamo para el pago de la mano de obra que trabajaran para arreglarla.
El objetivo de ella es tener en buenas condiciones las herramientas necesarias en su vivienda, además que para un futuro desea aprender el negocio de la pastelería  e instalar su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca has a job. She lives with her husband and their daughter, who is two years old. She works in a pastry shop and with this work she obtains the income to cover the needs of her family.

Now she needs to repair a pump in a water well, since this pump is what delivers the water through the pipes to her house. She is applying for the loan to pay for the labor to fix it.

Her goal is to have the necessary fixtures in her house in good condition. In addition, in the future she wants to learn the pastry business and start up her own business.

loans.use: to pay for the labor to repair a water pump

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith, a 38-year-old artisan from the city of Ibarra, Ecuador, is divorced and lives with her three children aged 12, 10, and 7. A hardworking, efficient, and honest woman, Edith runs a sewing workshop. She began her business working from home after she bought her first sewing machine with a previous loan from FODEMI. Her business has been growing since then and Edith is seeking her third loan to purchase supplies for her business such as cloth and closures.

Her goal is the obtain a higher quality of life and expand her business. Her dream for the future is to open a clothing store selling her handmade clothes.

loans.use: to buy supplies like cloth and closures for her sewing workshop.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Amistad, inicia su ciclo 8 con 14 socias, las cuales se dedican a la venta D. zapatos, cosméticos, quesos, colchones, frazadas, llamadas telefónicas, tiene botica, elaboración D. panes.
La presidente para el presente ciclo es Marleni, tiene 27 años, es conviviente, con 2 hijos, se dedica a la venta D. zapatos, los días domingos venD. e la feria D. la Americas y los días lunes en la feria D. las Nazarenas. Aprendió D. este negocio desD. muy niña pues su mamá también se dedica a este negocio. Ingresó a FINCA Perú, por la invitación D. su mamá está hace 7 ciclos. Le gusta por la facilidad en los préstamos sin tanto papeleo, y porque se practican los valores. Esta ahorrando para tener su propio capital. Su sueño es poder tener su propio local y darle una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The 'Amistad' (Friendship) community bank is starting its 8th loan cycle with 14 members.  The bank's members sell shoes, cosmetics, cheese, mattresses, blankets and telephone calls, own a drugstO. and make bread.

The bank's president for this cycle is 27 year-old Marleni who lives with her partner and has two children.  Her business is selling shoes.  On Sundays she sells her products in the Las Américas street market and on Mondays in the Las Nazarenas street market.  She learned this business when she was still a young girl because her mom is in the same business.

Marleni joined FINCA Peru through an invitation from her mom.  She has been a member for 7 loan cycles.  She likes it because of the ease of obtaining loans, without the need for so much paperwork, and because they practice values.  Marleni is saving so that she can build up her own capital.  Her dream is to be able to own her own business premises and proviD. her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy products because she has orders to fill

loans.name: Aracely Maria

texts.es: La señora Aracely tiene un negocio de comercialización de artículos para el hogar tales como Colchones, abanicos, licuadoras, ollas , artículos plásticos, artículos de cocina su esposo quien fue el de la iniciativa,  es  quien hace trabaja la venta ambulante y de cobro de la cartera mientras que ella vende en el local, ubicado en una zona muy comercial del municipio de Galapa, donde vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 3 y 9 años. El negocio de Aracely y su esposo, funciona hace 8 años y tiene una buena infraestructura física,  la mayor parte de sus ventas las hace a crédito y los pagos los recibe semanalmente. Sus ventas le permiten cubrir sus costos y los gastos familiares, compra a sus proveedores a 45 días y tiene un buen surtido de mercancías, pero su capital de trabajo está representado principalmente en cartera a largo plazo y necesita financiarla; esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva que es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará sillas, mesas plásticas, electrodomésticos menores etc. En el negocio de Aracely sus razones de liquidez son altas  y conserva  un margen de rentabilidad acorde al tipo de negocio; la consecuencia de que su nueva inyección de capital de trabajo tendrá éxito es su buen posicionamiento en el mercado, además de que Aracely y su esposo poseen  la experiencia   para este logro. Su sueño se proyecta en tener su propia vivienda y lograr con sus esfuerzos que sus hijos logren un futuro próspero apoyándolos en el tema educativo.
texts.en:
Aracely has a business selling household products such as mattresses, fans, blenders, pots, plastic products and kitchen items.  The idea for this business was her husband's and he is the one who makes sales door to door and collects payment for their goods while Aracely makes sales in their business premises which is located in a very commercial area of the town of Galapa.  Aracely lives in Galapa with her husband and their two children who are 3 and 9.

Aracely and her husband have been running their business for eight years and have a good physical infrastructure.  They make most of their sales on credit and collect payment weekly.  Aracely's sales allow her to cover her costs and family expenses.  She buys goods from her suppliers every 45 days and has a good stock of merchandise.  However, her working capital is mainly tied up in her long-term portfolio and she needs to finance her business.  This is why she is requesting a Kiva loan, which will be the first loan that she has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy plastic tables and chairs, small electrical appliances, etc.

Aracely's liquidity ratio is high and she maintains a profitability margin which is in keeping with this type of business.  Her new injection of working capital will be successful because she has a good position in the market.  In addition, Aracely and her husband have the experience they need to achieve their goal.

Aracely's dream is to own her own home and, through her efforts, to ensure a prosperous future for her children by supporting them in their education.

loans.use: to buy plastic tables and chairs and small electrical appliances

loans.name: Las Tejedoras Group

texts.es:
C.F. JUAN PABLO
A.C. LAS TEJEDORAS
FECHA: 07/06/11

La A.C. “LAS TEJEDORAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Juan Pablo, está compuesta por catorce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Leandra. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de mantas, venta de comida, tienda de abarrotes, venta de fruta, taller de soldadura, taller de costura, tejido artesanal, venta de repostería, taller de carpintería. 

La señora Lenadra indica que es la primera vez que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio, que viene trabajando hace cinco años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de refrescos, cerveza, aceite, arroz, fideos), que consiguieran por mayor de la Ceja y los venderá en su tienda todos los días. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene una hija.  

En la fotografia nos acompaña la hermana de una de las socias, la señora de negro.
texts.en:
The 'Las Tejedoras' (The Weavers) community bank is about to start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Juan Pablo regional office.  The bank has fourteen members and is managed by a board of directors, which is led by Leandra.  The women are engaged in a range of different business activities which include: knitting blankets, selling food, grocery store, selling fruit, metalwork shop, sewing workshop, weaving, selling confectionery, carpentry workshop.

Leandra says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer.  She joined through a promotional invitation.  She current business is a neighborhood store and she has been working in this business for five years.

The loan that Leandra will receive will be used to increase her capital, buying soft drinks, beer, oil, rice and noodles, which she acquires wholesale in La Ceja and sells in her store every day.  This work allows her to make money to support her family.  She lives with her partner and has one daughter.

In the photograph, a sister of one of the members is accompanying the group.  She is the lady in black.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, oil, noodles, rice, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise such as oil, meat, dairy products and condiments

loans.name: Gladys Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Gladys del Socorro  es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 43 años. Ella tiene dos hijos de 16 y 11 años respectivamente por los cuales labora arduamente para que tengan un hogar, educación y salud; inicio lavando y planchando, luego con lo que ganaba fue ahorrando y empezó a vender cosméticos y con los préstamos puso una pulpería y comenzó a vender prenda de oro y plata.
Ella con la ayuda de su hija mayor quien en su tiempo libre se encarga de la venta ha ido saliendo adelante.  Su meta es poder trabajar por si sola sin necesidad de préstamo.
texts.en:
43 year-old Gladys del Socorro is a hard-working, industrious and entrepreneurial woman.  She has two children aged 16 and 11 for whom she works hard so that they have a home, an education and good health.  She started out washing and ironing clothes then saved the money that she was earning and started selling cosmetics.  Through loans, she set up a grocery store and also started selling gold and silver jewelry.

With the help of her eldest daughter, who takes care of the business in her spare time, Gladys has been getting ahead.  Her goal is to be able to work for herself without needing loans.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, products for sale, gold and silver jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm-oil, gari, groundnuts, etc. in bulk to add to his current stock

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su hija y su nieta, viven en  casa propia, y Ana se dedica a la venta de tortillas, este negocio lo inicio hace 4 años, su hija le ayuda a vender ya que de esta actividad se alimentan ella y su hija.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, cal y gas, estos materiales para la preparación de la venta de las tortillas, esta inversión la hará por mayoreo, obteniendo mejores precios de los vendedores.
El objetivo de ella es mejorar los ingresos del negocio, ya que es única fuente de ingreso, así también espera cambiar la calidad de vida para su hija y nieta.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her daughter and granddaughter in her own home.  Ana dedicates herself to selling tortillas, a business she started 4 years ago.  Her daughter helps her with sales and, with this activity, she feeds her and her daughter.

She requests a loan to buy corn, wood, lime and gas.  These are materials she uses for preparing to sell the tortillas.  She will make this investment at wholesale, obtaining better prices from the salesmen.

Her objective is to improve the business’ earnings, as it is her only source of income.  In addition, she hopes to change her daughter and granddaughter’s quality of life.

loans.use: buy corn, wood, lime and gas.

loans.name: Rosa Alpina

texts.es: Rosa Alpina tiene su negocio que es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este medio de vida. Ella inicio este negocio por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos de su hogar, con mucho sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante con esta actividad. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes y vestidos. Uno de sus mayores desafíos es comprar una gran variedad de prendas para mostrárselas a sus clientes lo que ofrece ya que los precios de estos productos varían.
texts.en:
Rosa Alpina has a clothing sales business.  She has been making her living this way for more than 2 years.  She started this business due to the need to defray her household expenses and, with much sacrifice, she has managed to get ahead with this activity.

The purpose of the loan is to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits and dresses.  One of her biggest challenges is buying a large variety of clothing to show her customers, as the prices of these products vary.

loans.use: buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits and dresses.

loans.name: Yader

texts.en:
Yader started his business in 2004. Yader’s business consists of buying plastic bags at a wholesale store and selling them to his local supermarket. Unfortunately, a violent robbery two years ago put a pause on his business success, taking him almost a year to recuperate. Yader’s first loan with ACCION USA allowed him to go back to his business with enough working capital to help him rebuild and cultivate business relationships.

Although Yader has a loyal client base, he would like to reach more clients and lower his cost of goods sold. With this second loan from ACCION USA, Yader will advertise his business and purchase more materials to continue its growth.

loans.use: to purchase more materials and advertise his business.

loans.name: Sivia De Fátima

texts.es:
La señora Sivia de Fátima de 55 años es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien hace 12 años puso una modesta venta de chiverías en la actualidad gracias a su ardua labor y los prestamos su negocio ha ido creciendo ahora tiene una pulpería donde vende desde granos básicos hasta productos de belleza.
Ella tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, casados y con hijos. En el negocio cuenta con la ayuda de una  sobrina quien despacha y ordena los productos.
texts.en:
Sivia de Fátima, 55 years of age, is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman.  She installed a modest grocery store in her home 12 years ago that currently, thanks to her efforts and the loans, has been growing.  She now has a grocery store where she sells everything from basic staples to beauty products.  

She has three grown children who are married and have families.  In her business, she counts on the help of a niece who takes care of and orders the products.

loans.use: buy basic staples, food, sodas....etc.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, es casada, vive con sus dos hijos  D. 12 y 14 años D. edad y su esposo, es ama D. casa y cría cerdos, también con sus hijos y esposo cultiva maíz y frijol, trabajan unidos, todos los días D. la semana, su esposo inicia desD. las 6:00am a 3:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. fertilizantes y abono para cultivar maíz y frijol, esta compra le ayudara para que ella pueda suministrar a su esposo los materiales para dar inicio a la siembra.
El objetivo D. María es tener una buena cosecha, ayudar a su esposo en todo lo necesario, y velar por las necesidades D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is married and lives with her husband and her two children aged 12 and 14.   She is a housewife and raises pigs.  Together with her children and husband, she also grows corn and beans.  They work together every day of the week.  Her husband works from 6.00am to 3.00pm.

María is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and manure for growing corn and beans.  This purchase will help her to proviD. her husband with the materials they need to start sowing their crops.

María's goals are to have a good harvest, to help her husband where necessary and to look out for her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure for her corn and bean crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients — rice, palm oil, fish, etc. — in bulk in order to produce a larger quantity of cooked rice for sale

loans.name: Mariscal Sucre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARICAL SUCRE” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Magaly. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción, cultivo, venta de comida, venta de juegos didácticos y servicios.

La señora Magaly,  indica que hace un 13 años que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un como negocio venta de juegos didácticos, que inicio, hace unos meses atrás. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de mercadería (compra de juegos didácticos) que los comprará de la Ceja (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto). Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella tiene un hijo.
texts.en:
The “MARICAL SUCRE” community bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional office.  It is managed by a board of directors, which is led by Magaly.  The group's members are engaged in a range of different business activities, including: commerce, production, farming, selling food, selling educational games, and services.

Magaly tells us that she joined the institution 13 years ago, through an invitation from a loan officer.  She currently has a business selling educational games that she set up a few months ago.

Magaly will use the loan that she is receiving to buy merchandise (educational games) which she will buy in La Ceja (a commercial area of the city of El Alto).  This work allows her to make income with which to support her family.  She has one child.

loans.use: to buy educational games

loans.name: Rolando Antonio

texts.es:
Rolando, vive con su esposa y una hija de 5 años, él es agricultor, siembra maíz y frijol, lo realiza desde hace 10 años, aprendió de su padre y trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
Este trabajo es la fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta, para sostener a su familia, actualmente solicita un préstamo para adquirir los insumos agrícolas e iniciar nuevamente la siembra, comprara abono y fertilizantes, con estos materiales puede tener una mayor seguridad del cultivo.
Su propósito es mantenerse en el trabajo, ya que de ahí depende su familia y sobre todo su hija, por quien espera tener una fuente permanente se ingreso, para ayudarle a superarse.
texts.en:
Rolando lives with his wife and 5 year-old daughter.  He is a farmer who grows corn and beans.  He has been in this business for 10 years and learned from his father.  He works every day, from 6.00am to 3.00pm.

This work is Rolando's source of income with which he supports his family.  He is currently requesting a loan to buy farming supplies so that he can start sowing his crops.  He will buy manure and fertilizers.  With these materials, his crops will be safer.

Rolando's goal is to keep working as his family depends on his work, especially his daughter.  He hopes to have a permanent source of income so that he can help his daughter to do well.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for growing corn

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita vive en Atlacahualoya, en el estado de Morelos, México, ella tiene 70 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 6 hijos todos son casados, ella tiene su tienda de abarrotes, ella solicito su crédito para comprar refrescos, sabritas, jabón, cloro, sal, cerillos, galletas, papel higiénico, huevo, azúcar para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, ella inicio su negocio hace 2 años con unos ahorros que junto de lo que le dieron sus hijos, su yerno le prestó unos anaqueles para exhibir la mercancía y ella compro un refrigerador para enfriar el refresco,  antes elaboraba las cazuelas las ollas y los jarros de barro porque vivía en San Marcos, ella cambio de recidencia porque su esposo y sus hijos se vinieron a trabajar a Atlacahualoya en el campo. Su negocio es importante porque aunque sea poquito va saliendo para algún imprevisto,porque ella tiene trabajo y se siente contenta atendiendo a sus clientes que son los vecinos y los visitantes o turistas, las ganancias la utiliza para volver a surtir su tienda. Ella está planeando sembrar maíz y cebolla en esta temporada de lluvia ya que a su esposo le gusta trabajar en el campo, a ella le gusta cuando ya tiene elotes y los asan para comer. Sus sueños y esperanzas son que toda su familia esté bien y vivir contentos. Atlacahualoya es un pueblo bonito hay campo donde se puede trabajar siembran la cebolla, el maíz y hay huertas de guajes verdes. Ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por sus préstamo por que si nos ayudan a crecer los negocios que se vean bonitos y a vivir mejor nuestras familias”.
texts.en:
Margarita lives in Atlacahualoya, in the State of Morelos, Mexico.  She is 70 years old, married, and has six children who are all married.

Margarita owns a grocery store.  She requested this loan to buy soft drinks, Sabrita-brand snacks, soap, bleach, salt, matches, cookies, toilet paper, eggs and sugar with which to stock her store.  She started her business two years ago with some savings which she added to some money her children gave her.  Her son-in-law lent her some shelves to display her merchandise and she bought a refrigerator to keep her soft drinks cold.

Margarita used to make casserole dishes, pots and pitchers from clay when she lived in San Marcos.  However, she moved because her husband and children came to work on the land in Atlacahualoya.  Margarita's business is important because, although it isn't much, she is prepared for any unforeseen circumstances as she has work.  She also feels happy serving her customers who are her neighbors, visitors and tourists.  She uses her profits to re-stock her store.

Margarita is planning to grow corn and onions during this rainy season since her husband enjoys working on the land and she likes it when there are ears of corn that she can grill and eat.  Her dreams and hopes are for her family to be well and live happily.

Atlacahualoya is a beautiful village with land where people work growing onions and corn.  There are market gardens full of green 'guajes' (a type of squash).  Margarita would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad "Thank you for the loan.  If you help us to grow our businesses, things go well and our families live better".

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, soap, bleach, salt, matches, sugar, cookies, Sabrita-brand snacks, etc. to stock her store

loans.name: Yenis Maritza

texts.es:
Yenis, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad, ella es ama de casa y también realiza actividades agrícolas, como medio de trabajo para recibir ingresos y también para tener disponible para el consumo familiar.
Ella solicita un préstamo, pues está por iniciar la siembra de esta temporada, para lo cual necesita tener abono y fertilizantes, con este préstamo podrá disponer en el tiempo oportuno, de los materiales que son su prioridad para iniciar el cultivo de maíz y frijol.
Su objetivo es ayudar a sus hijos a través de su trabajo, garantizando una fuente de ingreso estable que le permita tener todo lo necesario para ellos.
texts.en: Yenis is a single mother with two children aged 10 and 8. As well as looking after the house she also works in agriculture to earn an income for her family expenses. She is requesting a loan because she is about to start this season's sowing and she will need manure and fertilizers. The loan will provide her with the time and the tools that she needs to start growing corn and beans. Her goal is to help her children through her work, which provides a stable source of income that allows her to provide them with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers to plant corn and beans.

loans.name: Zulema

texts.es:
La señora Zulema es socia del banco comunal Las Gemas del Distrito Manantay, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene  23 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo.
Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo y lleva tres años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará:2 cremas de manos, 2 mascarillas, 2 cremas liporeductoras, 2 talcos para bebes, 2 cremas para  el cabello, 3 labiales, 1 rubor, 1 rimer, 2 cuartetos de sombras.
Generalmente tiene que salir a ofrecer sus productos para poder hacer sus pedidos mensualmente, cuando tenga un poco mas de dinero podrá comprar más productos y tenerlo en la vitrina como stock.
Espera que Manuela Ramos le siga prestando el dinero que necesita para agrandar su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Zulema is a member of the "Las Gemas del Distrito Manantay" ("The Gems of Manantay District") community bank, in the department of Ucayali. She is 23 years old and married with one child. She sells beauty products over a catalogue and has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for three years now. 

With this new loan of 1,000 soles she will buy 2 pots of hand cream, 2 face masks, 2 pots of anti-cellulite cream, 2 pots of baby powder, 2 pots of hair conditioner, 3 lipsticks, 1 blusher and 2 eye shadow palettes. She generally has to go out to offer her products so she can place her monthly orders. When she has a bit more money she will be able to buy more product and have it in stock. She hopes that Manuela Ramos will continue to lend her the money she needs to grow her business and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan  tiene 54 años, esta casado con Marcelina de 38 años, juntos tienen 2 hijos, Juan de 18 y Amílcar de 14 años. Juan y su familia viven en su casa propia ubicada en el anexo  de natividad del distrito de Pichari. Juan desde muy joven viene labrando la tierra con un entusiasmo persistente, hasta alcanzar sus metas trazadas, junto a él esta Marcelina que le brinda su apoyo constante para el mejor bienestar de su entorno familiar. Juan esta lleno de mucha satisfacción  al ver que los cultivos que tiene le brindan buenos frutos, además de una rentabilidad efectiva. Agradece al buen manejo agronómico que realiza, el único problema que tiene es, el no contar con suficiente mano de obra de los jornaleros, pese a ello trata de salir adelante, para brindar bienestar a sus hijos ya que ellos se encuentran estudiando en la provincia de huamanga y necesitan apoyo económico para así concluir sus estudios y convertirse en profesionales. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que el esta comprometido en realizar sus pagos muy puntualmente, con los  2.000 nuevos soles Juan comprará algunos equipos para el mantenimiento de sus plantas. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que esta comprometido en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Juan esta contento por ser parte de su banco comunal  por que todos son muy solidarios. Con los 2.000 nuevos soles Juan comprará equipos y herramientas para el mantenimiento de su parcela de cacao.
texts.en:
Juan is 54 years old and married to 38 year-old Marcelina.  They have two children: 18 year-old Juan and 14 year-old Amílcar.  Juan and his family live in their own home which is located in the small village of Natividad, in Pichari district.

Juan has been working the land since he was very young.  He has worked with persistent enthusiasm and managed to reach his goals.  Marcelina works alongside him, providing her constant support in improving their family's well-being.  Juan is full of satisfaction when he sees that his crops are providing good fruit and a real profit.  He puts this all down to the good agronomic management that he provides.  The only problem that he has is that he doesn't have enough help from laborers.  In spite of this, however, he tries to get ahead so that he can provide for his children's well-being.  His children are studying in Huamanga province and need financial support in order to finish their studies and become professionals.

This is Juan's second loan from MFP and he pledges to make his repayments punctually.  He is happy to be a member of his community bank because all of the bank's members are very supportive of each other.  Juan will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles he has requested to buy some equipment and tools which he will use to care for his cacao crops.

loans.use: to buy equipment and tools to care for his cacao plants

loans.name: Meribeth Diana

texts.es:
Meribeth es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun, se dedica a la compra de ropa para niños y lo envía a la selva para que su madre las venda. Su meta es terminar su licenciatura en teología y luego ir a la escuela de enfermería. Ella inició sus estudios de enfermería, pero no pudo terminar debido a dificultades económicas.
Desde que esta en FINCA Perú le ha sido mas fácil ahorrar. Ella manifiesta que sus ahorros se han incrementado. A través de las sesiones de capacitacion que FINCA Perú ofrece, Meribeth ha aprendido a tratar a los miembros de su familia, a valorarse como mujer y mejorar su autoestima. Gracias a los prestamos que recibe puede pagar sus estudios y asi dará a su bebé Thirsa de dos meses una educación adecuada.
texts.en:
Meribeth is a member of the Wiñarisun community bank. She buys children's clothes and send them to the jungle so that her mother can sell them. Her goal is to get her degree in theology and later go to nursing school. She started her nursing studies, but couldn't finish due to financial reasons.    

Since she has been in FINCA Perú, it has been easier to save.  She states that her savings have increased. Through the training sessions that FINCA Perú offers, Meribeth has learned how to treat her family members, to value herself as a woman, and to improve her self esteem. Thanks to the loans she receives, she can pay for her classes and in this way she will give her baby a a good education.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear-clothes in a large quantity to add to her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase manure for her farms and retail commodities to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy gallons of palm-oil and palm-wine to add to her business.

loans.name: Kanlé

texts.fr: Pour renforcer son activité dans la vente de la mercerie et du pure water (eau minérale qu’on met dans le sachet). Mme Kanlé  a 52ans elle est veuve et a 02 enfants en charge En 2000, elle a commencé l’activité en achetant au Grand Marché de Lomé.  Ce troisième prêt lui servira à acheter des produits pour agrandir son activité et mieux s’occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en: To bolster her business selling sewing supplies and Pure Water (mineral water packaged in plastic bags): Ms. Kanlé is 52 years old and a widow, and she has two children to support. She started this business in 2000, making her purchases at the Grand Market of Lomé. This third loan will serve to buy some merchandise for expanding her business and to do better in taking care of her children.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia es socia del Banco comunal Wiñarisun, tiene un stand en el mercado donde vende joyas, el préstamo que solicita lo usará en la compra de mercaderia. Sonia ha aprendido a mirar siempre hacia adelante y nunca darse por vencido, a pesar de las luchas que se pueda encontrar. Le gusta las reuniones de su banco comunal en FINCA Perú porque le enseñan a ahorrar y por la facilidad con que recibe los préstamos. Además, FINCA Perú le ha ayudado con sus problemas personales. En concreto, ha aprendido a lidiar con el abuso en sus relaciones de pareja: cómo responder, a quién pedir ayuda y dónde buscar refugio.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Wiñarisun community bank.  She has a stand in the market where she sells jewelry.  She will use the loan that she is requesting to buy merchandise.  Sonia has learned to always look ahead and never give up, in spite of the struggles that she might face.

Sonia enjoys her community bank meetings with FINCA Peru because they teach her to save and it is easy to receive a loan.  In addition, FINCA Peru have helped her with her personal problems.  Specifically, she has learned how to deal with abuse in relationships: how to respond, who to ask for help and where to seek refuge.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is married and has six dependents. She sells gari and maize in both small and large quantities in Elmina. She has done this for 10 years. Victoria uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Victoria will use the loan to purchase more bags of gari and maize to sell. With her expanded business, Victoria plans to reinvest the profits back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of gari and maize to sell.

loans.name: Farida

texts.fr: Agée de 27ans, Farida est revendeuse de d’habits, de perles et des accessoires pour dames. Il ya de cela 01an qu’elle a démarré cette activité et sollicite ce premier prêt pour acheter des habits afin de renforcer son activité et assurer sa future vie maritale. Elle s’approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé et revend dans sa boutique.
texts.en: At the age of 27, Farida retails women's clothing, pearls and accessories. She started this activity one year ago, and is requesting this first loan to purchase clothing, with the objective of increasing her activity and supporting her future married life. She gets her supplies at Lomé Grand Market and retails in her shop.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing and accessories.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: La Sra. Alejandra y su esposo están recién casados y están en espera de su primogénito,  es por este motivo que ellos han pensado en ir acondicionando su hogar y al  mismo tiempo   protegerla  de la inseguridad  de  estos  tiempos,  ya  que   actualmente  su  domicilio  no  cuenta   con  protecciones  y  en  ocasiones  se meten  los  animales a   su  casa,  agradece  el  apoyo  brindado  para  la  realización de  su  proyecto   ya  que  gracias  a  esta  ayuda   podrán  retirarse  a   su trabajo  tranquilamente  y  además podrán  ofrecerle  a su  pequeño  una  mayor  comodidad.
texts.en: Alejandra and her husband are newlyweds and awaiting the birth of their first child. That is why they have planned to fix up their house and also protect against the protect against the present day lack of security.  At this time, their house is unprotected and occasionally animals get into the house. She is thankful for the support given for this project. Thanks to this help, they will able to go to their jobs with no worries and also offer their child a more comfortable home.

loans.use: to install security and a gate in her home.

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits de premières nécessités (riz, sucre, huile végétale) depuis 2009, Ayaba est mère de 02 enfants. Elle a 47ans et a pour époux un fermier. Madame s’approvisionne d’habitude au Grand Marché de Lomé et revend dans sa boutique à HEDZRANAWOE. Ce premier prêt lui servira à acheter des marchandises vu que son stock s’épuise pour vendre à sa clientèle.
texts.en: A retailer of first necessity products (rice, sugar, vegetable oil) since 2009, Ayaba is a mother of two. She is 47 years old and is married to a farmer. This lady usually gets her supplies from Lomé Grand Market and retails in her shop in Hedzranawoe. This first loan will allow her to purchase merchandise to sell to her customers, as her stock is running low.

loans.use: to buy first necessity products.

loans.name: Umbelina

texts.es: Umbelina nació en el centro poblado de natividad, tiene 25 años, es viuda pero viven acompañada de sus 2 hijos, Edward de 5 y Smith de 2 años de edad quienes son que le llena de satisfacción y las ganas de seguir viviendo. Umbelina  es una mujer  modelo en el centro poblado de natividad, que por azares de la vida perdió a su querido esposo en un fatídico accidente vehicular, quien desde entonces tomó las riendas de su hogar. Umbelina es agricultor, se dedica a cultivar sus plantaciones de cacao, pues considera un negocio que tiene muchas posibilidades de seguir surgiendo, además posee una pequeña tienda para generarse más ingresos económicos, y del cual desea intensificarse, por tal recurre a MFP a solicitar un préstamo para adquirir la mercadería necesaria para abastecer su negocio. Para Umbelina, su tienda es el único negocio que hay en el lugar donde ella habita, pues no existe una bodega o tienda alguna donde los pobladores puedan adquirir los productos de primera necesidad, sin necesidad de estar caminando muy lejos, esto es que lo motiva a realizar este nuevo emprendimiento. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y por tal se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ella esta muy a gusto con su banco comunal porque son muy puntuales. Con los mil nuevos soles comprará más productos que sus clientes lo requieren.
texts.en: Umbelina was born in the town of Natividad. She is 25 years old and a widow and lives with her 2 children, Edward, 5 and Smith,  2. They fill her with satisfaction and eagerness to keep on living. Umbelina is looked up to in the town of Natividad because of the challenges she has had in life. She lost her beloved husband in a fateful car accident, and since then took up the reins of the household. Umbelina is a farmer. She works planting crops of cacao, because she considers it to be a business that has a lot of possibilities to keep growing. She also has a small store to generate more income. She wants to intensify that business, and that is why she has gone to MFP to ask for a loan to acquire the necessary merchandise to supply her business. For Umbelina, her store is the only business there is in the place where she lives. There is no other store or where the residents can go to acquire basic necessity products without walking very far. This is what motivated her to open this new enterprise. This is her first loan with MFP and she is committed to making her payments on time. She is very pleased with her community bank because they are very punctual. With the thousand soles, she will buy more products that her customers need.

loans.use: to buy products to supply her store.

loans.name: Las Animas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Las Animas". Está ubicado en el Estado de México. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes. La señora Victoria es una integrante del grupo. Tiene 25 años estudio la secundaria, esta casada y tiene una niña de tres años. Ella se dedica a la venta de dulces negocio que inició hace 2 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar dulces de diferentes marcas y sabores para tener mayor variedad en los gustos de sus clientes que la mayoria son niños quienes comentan que la señora es muy linda con ellos porque los trata bien y siempre tiene lo que ellos le piden. Con las ganancias quiere ahorrar para más adelante poder invertir en su negocio ya que su sueño es comprar un horno de microondas para poder vender palomitas, café, y otros productos. También desea mejorar su negocio para brindarle esducación a su hija ya que le gustaria verla algun día con una carrera profesional y así pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida logrando sus sueños.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Animas" and is located in Mexico. It is made up of nine members. Señora Victoria is one of the members of this group. She is 25 years old, has a high school education, is married and has a three year old daughter. Two years ago she started a business selling candy. 

She is requesting a loan to buy candies of different brands and flavors to have more variety for the tastes of her customers, who are mostly children who say that she treats them very kindly and always has what they ask for. 

She wants to save the profits so that she can later invest them in her business, as it is her dream to buy a microwave so that she can sell popcorn, coffee and other products. She also wants to improve her business in order to provide for her daughter's education. One day she would like to see her daughter with a professional career so that she can have a better quality of life and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy candies of different brands and flavors.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi makes gari in large quantities for distribution to her customers. In addition, she sells maize in Elmina. Gari is made from a starchy root vegetable called cassava. The process involves peeling, milling, squeezing the water from the dough, and stir-frying.

Esi is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. Esi has been selling gari for 10 years now. She responsibly helps to pay school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy cassava to process into gari for sale. She hopes to reinvest her new profits back into her business.

loans.use: to buy cassava to process into gari for sale.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Guadalupe y su esposo el señor Martín tienen más de ocho años con su taller de reparaciones de carros. 

Están solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar herramienta más moderna y nueva ya que tiene varios trabajos para realizar y los quieren entregar a tiempo y por falta de algunas herramientas no los han podido terminar. 
Con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio pagaran el crédito ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia. 
Desean mejorar la calidad del negocio y de  su familia, también con este nueva inversión podrán darles empleo a dos personas mas y ayudarlas.
texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe and her husband Martín have had their automotive repair shop for more than eight years. 

They are asking for a loan to be able to buy newer and more modern tools, since they have have many jobs to do and they want to finish them on time. Due to a lack of tools, they haven't been able to finish them. With a part of the earnings they make from their business, they will pay off the loan, since this is their family's source of income. 

They want to improve the quality of their business and of their family. With this new investment, they will also be able to give jobs to people and help them.

loans.use: to buy tools for her business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama cooks banku and serves it with fried fish in Elmina. The banku is made from corn. In this picture, Ama is placing her hand in soaked corn that will be milled into dough for the banku.

Ama is divorced and has five dependents. She has been in this trade for four years. Her loan will be used to buy bags of corn and fresh fish to cook and sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn and fresh fish to cook and sell.

loans.name: Piyalo

texts.fr: En 2004, Piyalo s’est lancée dans le commerce des céréales (mais, haricot, mil). Elle achète à l’intérieur du pays et revend dans un marché de la place. C’est une femme battante qui désire renforcer son activité et ce prêt lui servira à acheter des céréales  pour pouvoir vendre à toutes personnes. Elle a 31ans et est célibataire.
texts.en: In 2004 Piyalo launched into selling cereals (corn, beans, millet). She buys her stock inland and sells it at a local market. She is a fighting woman who wants to strengthen her business, and this loan will be used to buy cereals to sell to all kinds of people. She is 31 years old and single.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana processes gari, a grain made from grated cassava, in a village called Breman near Elmina. She is married and has eight dependents. Her business is 20 years old. Her husband is a farmer, and together they take care of their dependents. Her loan will be used to purchase additional bags of cassava to process into gari for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to reinvest her additional income.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of cassava to process into gari for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is into multiple businesses, including cooking banku and kenkey and selling corn and bags of gari in Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy bags of gari for resale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to buy land. In this photograph, Grace is sitting by a bag of gari.

loans.use: to buy bags of gari for resale.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is a gari seller in Breman, a village near Elmina. She is currently living with her husband and three children. She responsibly helps her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy bags of gari to sell. She anticipates reinvesting the new profits back into her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of gari to sell.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Mariée à un menuisier, Ablavi  a 01 enfant. C’est une ancienne cliente de WAGES, elle est à son troisième crédit. Elle n’a pas eu de difficulté à payer les deux derniers. Ce montant lui permettra d’acheter des œufs (l’activité qu’elle exerce depuis quelques temps).
texts.en: Ablavi is married to a carpenter and has one child. She is an old customer of Wages and is on her third loan. She has not had any difficulty repaying the past two loans. This loan will enable her to buy eggs (an activity which she has been carrying out for some time).

loans.use: to buy eggs

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad, ella es ama de casa y vende tamales pisques y de gallina, los tamales pisques son rellenos de frijol, tiene 2 años de estar realizándolos, fue iniciativa propia y los clientes son amigos y vecinos, también quienes visitan el pueblo, las ventas las realiza todos los días de 4:00pm a 7:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprarse materiales para preparar los tamales, compra de maíz, frijoles, aceite, condimentos, pollo y hojas de banano, ya que al comprar todos estos materiales, tendrá una mejor solvencia en el negocio y le servirá para aumentar la producción.
Su objetivo es tener una fuente de ingreso estable, que le ayude a cubrir las necesidades del hogar y a ayudar a su pequeña hija para que tenga un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
María is a single mother with a 6 year-old son.  She takes care of her house and also sells 'tamales pisques' and chicken tamales.  The 'tamales pisques' are stuffed with beans.  She has been making tamales for two years and started her business on her own initiative.  Her customers are friends, neighbors and people who visit her village.  She makes her sales every day from 4.00pm to 7.00pm.

María is requesting a loan to buy supplies for making tamales.  She will buy corn, beans, oil, condiments, chicken and banana leaves.  Buying all these supplies will mean that she will have better solvency in her business and will be able to increase her production.

María's goal is to have a stable source of income which will help her to cover her household needs and allow her to help her young daughter so that she can enjoy a better future.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, oil, condiments, chicken and banana leaves

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: For the past 20 years, Ama has been selling smoked fish in Elmina. She is a widow and has four children. She is solely responsible for the feeding, clothing, and education of her children. Her loan will be used to buy more curtains of fresh fish to smoke for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children and to reinvest in her business for further growth.

loans.use: to buy more curtains of fresh fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.es: Norma, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos de 11 y 1 año de edad, en el barrio Ciudadela Metropolitana del municipio de Soledad, escenario social apoyado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en su proceso de construcción de comunidades. Allí en un espacio de su vivienda tiene su propio negocio de vender mercancías y variedades en su miscelánea, experiencia construida desde que trabajó al lado de su cuñada en el comercio de calzado y una vez se independizó comenzó vendiendo muchos productos, como accesorios femeninos, pulsos, moños, ganchos, sandalias, y hasta dulces. Su clientela principal son mujeres que compran diariamente pero principalmente en fechas especiales como el día de las madres, día del padre, Halloween, carnavales, navidades etc. fechas en las cuales ocurre un repunte de sus ventas, que son principalmente a crédito aunque también vende de contado. Su negocio le genera ingreso con los que ayuda en la gestión de su hogar y por eso desea hacerlo crecer para aumentar el bienestar familiar. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará dulces, sandalias elaboradas por un familiar propietario de una microempresa y accesorios femeninos que ya tiene encargados por sus clientes rentables, lo cual augura que su rotación de mercancías sea rápida y que su inversión tenga éxito. Su sueño más adelante es tener su casa propia, para adecuar un local comercial separado del ámbito familiar, definiendo la jornada laboral y momentos saludables de buen descanso. Mientras esto ocurre Norma continua trabajando para responder a su mayor desafío que es su poco capital de trabajo y la competencia,  que muchas veces se torna intensa y ella  entonces debe acudir a su capacidad de servicio oportuno para sostenerse.
texts.en:
Norma lives with her husband and their children aged 11 and 1, in the Ciudadela Metropolitana barrio in the municipality of Soledad, a social scene helped by the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo in the process of community construction. Here within the space of her living quarters, Norma has her own business, selling merchandise and a variety of miscellaneous goods. She created this business since working along side her sister-in-law in a shoe store. Once Norma became independent, she began selling many products, including feminine accessories, bracelets, hair fasteners, hair pins, sandals, and even sweets. Her principal clientèle is women who buy daily but principally on special dates like mothers day, fathers day, Halloween, carnivals, Christmas, etc., dates when sales surge. These sales are usually on credit, although she also sells for cash.

Norma's business generates income that helps with household expenses, and for that reason, she wants to make it grow to increase her family's well being. This “credikiva” is the first financing she has received through the Fundacion, and she will use it to buy sweets, sandals made by a familiar proprietor of a micro enterprise, and womens' accessories already ordered by her profitable customers. This indicates that merchandise rotation will be rapid and her investment will enjoy success.

Her dreams for the future include having her own house, providing a commercial site separate from family living quarters, and defining the working day to include healthy moments of rest. While this evolves, Norma will continue working to respond to her greatest challenge, which is her small working capital and the competition, which at times becomes intense, and she needs to increase her capacity for opportune service to sustain herself.

loans.use: buy sweets and sandals in larger volume to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is married and has five dependents. Rebecca cooks food such as jollof rice (as seen in the picture above) and plain rice. The plain rice is served with tomato sauce and fried chicken. Her husband is a carpenter. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. The loan she hopes to receive will be used to buy food items to cook for sale. The profit realized from the sales as a result of the loan will be reinvested back into her business.

loans.use: to buy food items to cook for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bags of groundnuts in order to add to her business.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a teacher. Aba has been selling cosmetics in Elmina for the past 10 years. She uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Aba will use this loan to purchase more cosmetics to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business as a result of the loan, she plans to plough back into her business.

loans.use: buy cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: In this picture is Nana.  She is a cook. She prepares banku which is made from maize. She also sells sweet potatoes seasonally. She takes care of five dependents.  Nana wants to grow her business and needs a loan to buy bags of maize to cook to meet the demands of her customers. The income generated from her sales is used to take care of her children. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to reinvest back into her business for further growth.  At the of time of the visit, she had finished selling for the day.

loans.use: buy maize to make banku for sale

loans.name: Edgar Eduardo

texts.es:
Edgar de 22 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres en su casa, cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Zona que tiene una actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Edgar se dedica  a la venta de golosinas y bebidas desde hace 1 año, en su domicilio ofrece sus productos  para mayor comodidad, además puede atender a cualquier hora a sus clientes, con los ingresos que obtenga será para ayudar económicamente a sus padres.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para  comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para implementar su pequeño negocio y así puede solventar sus gastos personales, como poder pagar el crédito otorgado.  Edgar es conocida en la zona por ser una persona trabajadora, que con mucho empeño desea mejorar en la vida y darle algunas comodidades a sus padres.
texts.en:
Edar is 22 years old, single, and lives with his parents at home with running water and electricity. They live in the Olmos district which belongs to the Lambayeque department. The area consists of agricultural and livestock workers.

Edgar has been selling sweets and drinks for a year now. He sell them from home since it is convenient and he can serve his clients at any hour. He uses the profits to help his parents financially.

He requested Edpyme Alernativa a 500 Peruvian soles loan to buy merchandise to supply his store and make profits to cover personal payments such as paying back his loan. Edgar is known to be a hardworking person in his area as well as having the drive to improve his life and offers his parents life's comforts.

loans.use: buy merchandise to supply his store.

loans.name: Atta

texts.en:
Atta buys fish from the cold store, comes home and fries them for resale at Elmina a fishing community in Cape Coast. Atta has received a junior high education. She is married and has one child.  Her husband is a carpenter. 

Atta has been selling fish for 3 years. She assists her husband in the payment of utility bills and other household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more  fresh fish for sale.  She hopes to reinvest her additional income.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Rose Efua

texts.en: Rose makes gari, a dish made from a deep rooted vegetable called cassava. She also sells kako, a type of salted fish cut into pieces for resale.  She sells her food in Elmina. Rose Efua has received a senior high level of education. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She responsibly assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more cassava and kako for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a food stand. In the picture, she is cutting the kako into pieces. Behind her are a few tubers of cassava.

loans.use: buy cassava and kako

loans.name: Terminal 3 Group

texts.en: Edis Jeorgina, Oscar Alexander, and Wilfredo are from Choluteca, Honduras.  They formed the “Terminal 3” solidarity group in June 2011. All three applicants sell goods at the Choluteca bus terminal where local vendors congregate. Edis Jeorgina, who is a widow of two years, lives with her children and sells handmade garments. Edis requesting a loan of Lps. 8,000 to buy materials to make clothing. Oscar is single and lives with his elderly parents.  Oscar makes furniture for a living and is requesting a loan of Lps. 5,000 with which he will purchase supplies to make furniture. Wilfredo is married and is the father of a one-year-old daughter. Wilfredo and his wife sell homemade food at the bus terminal and are requesting a loan of Lps. 5,000 to invest in their small business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, thread, mahogany, cedar, screws, glue, varnish, beans, cheese, meats, cornmeal, vegetables, cooking oil, and rice.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.es: Guillerma es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun, se dedica a la venta de carne, el préstamo que solicita lo va a invertir en la compra de carne para su negocio. Gracias a las reuniones de su Banco Comunal en FINCA Perú ha aprendido como tratar a los miembros de su familia y como manejar adecuadamente su negocio. El sueño de Guillerma es construir su casa con los ahorros que FINCA Perú le ha ayudado a crear. Ella ha estado con FINCA Perú desde 1999. A través de las sesiones de capacitación que ofrece FINCA Perú ha aprendido a ahorrar, ser puntuales, devolver los préstamos y cómo ser responsables.
texts.en:
Guillerma is a member of the Wiñarisun community bank.  Her business is selling meat.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying meat for her business.  Thanks to her community bank meetings with FINCA Peru, Guillerma has learned how to treat members of her family and how to manage her business properly.

Guillerma's dream is to build her own home with the savings that FINCA Peru have helped her to build up.  She has been working with FINCA Peru since 1999.  Through the training sessions that they offer, she has learned how to save, how to be punctual, how to pay back her loans and how to be responsible.

loans.use: to buy meat

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu is a single young lady who wants to make life a little comfortable for herself. She has multiple businesses, such as the sale of provisions, yam, gari and others. Her business is just a year old and a loan from Kiva will enable her to buy more provisions such as biscuits, toffees and other items to expand her sales.  The  income realized from her sales is used to take care of utiltity bills and her upkeep.  Her future plan is to save part of the money for further investment and to reinvest the rest back into her business.

loans.use: buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Maria le está haciendo falta el portón al frente de su casa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar el portón y colocarlo en su casa. 
Pagara el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como empleada de una agencia aduanal, ya que su esposo el señor Antonio se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de sus hijos, con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo que tiene para la ciudad. 
Desean que su familia tengan un lugar seguro y la protección de sus vienes.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria's house needs a front gate. She is asking for a loan to be able to pay the person that will make and install the gate in her house.
She will pay for  the loan with the income she gets from her job at a customs agency,  since her husband, Mr. Antonio, takes care of the family and school expenses for their children with his salary from his job for the city. They want to have a safe place for their family and protection for their belongings.

loans.use: to put a gate in front of her house.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is married and has seven dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Efua sells gari, as seen in the picture. She also sells secondhand clothes in  Elmina. As part of her responsibilities, she makes sure the food is always available in the home. A loan will go a long way to help her purchase more bags of gari to resell and grow her business. Efua plans to save up to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: buy more gari to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. Efua sells grilled fish, gari, beans and plantains in Elmina, which she has done for 5 years.  Efua uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  She will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to grill for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: purchase fresh fish to grill for sale

loans.name: Amenatu

texts.en: Amenatu is a gari processor in Elmina. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. She helps her husband take care of their home. Her loan will be used to buy more cassava to make into gari for resale. In this picture, her hand is placed on the bagged cassava dough, yet to be  squeezed out before it is fried.

loans.use: buy cassava to make gari to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Willian

texts.en: Willian lives in a small village in the Choluteca region of Honduras with his four small children. He has been operating a small convenience store out of his home for the past 15 years, getting up at 5:00 a.m. every morning to attend to customers.  Willian is a returning client and is requesting a loan of Lps. 20,000 to buy more general merchandise for his store. In his free time on weekends, he likes to attend church.

loans.use: buy merchandise for his store

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 4 años, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderia para su tienda de ropa.
Maximiliana es socia de FINCA Peru desde el 2000, inicialmente usaba sus préstamos para su negocio de venta de carne, pero ahora se encuentra mejor con el negocio de ropa. 
En las reuniones de su Banco Comunal FINCA Perú ha hecho muchas amistades y  en las sesiones de capacitación ha aprendido a ser responsable, puntual y cómo ahorrar. 
Su objetivo es que su negocio siga creciendo para que pueda ofrecer sólo la mejor calidad de vida de sus hijos que tienen 15 y 13 años de edad.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a member of the Wiñarisun community bank.  She has been selling clothes for four years.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying merchandise for her clothes store.

Maximiliana has been a member of FINCA Peru since 2000.  She initially used her loans for her meat sales business but now she is doing better with her clothes business.

Maximiliana has made many friends during her community bank meetings with FINCA Peru and she has learned to be responsible and punctual, and also how to save, during the training sessions.

Maximiliana's goal is for her business to continue growing so that she can offer the very best quality of life to her children who are 15 and 13.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells kenkey (fermented maize or cassava) and fish in Elmina. She also makes gari (grated and fried cassava) for sale. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. Efua has been selling gari for 10 years. She helps her husband take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more cassava to make gari for sale.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more cassava to make gari (grated and fried cassava) for sale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: For the past 10 years, Ama has been married to an electrician. They live together with their five dependents. Ama sells gari (processed cassava) and maize in Elmina. Her income is used to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Ama will use the loan to purchase cassava to process for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to save to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase cassava to process for sale.

loans.name: Maria Julia Del Rocio

texts.es:
María Julia D. 30 años, vive con su esposo e hija en casa D. sus padres, cuenta con servicio D. agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito D. Pimentel que se encuentra a unos minutos D. la provincia D. Chiclayo.  Esta zona desarrolla la actividad pesquera, comercialización D. pescado y turístico.

María Julia se dedica a confeccionar y alquilar disfraces para todas la edades, también realiza prendas D. vestir a pedido, actividad que realiza desD. hace 3 años aproximadamente, negocio que lo a colocado en su casa y cuenta con su propia  clientela, al aumentar sus pedidos podrá tener una mejor calidad D. vida.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 2000 nuevos soles para comprar material para seguir confeccionando sus disfraces como ropa D. vestir, al aumentar sus ingresos podrá cubrir su crédito y solventar sus gastos familiares.  María Julia es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas D. superarse y D. sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
María Julia is 30 years old and lives at her parents’ house with her husband and daughter. They receive water and electricity services. María Julia resides in the District of Pimentel, which is a few minutes away from Chiclayo Province. This developed area is known for its businesses related to catching and selling fish, as well as tourism.

María Julia produces and rents out costumes for all ages. She also makes everyday clothes upon request. María Julia has been in this business for approximately three years. She works out of her home and has her own customer base. An increase in orders has helped her achieve a better quality of life.

María Julia is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN in order to buy material so that she can continue producing both costumes and clothing. The increased revenue will allow her to cover both her loan payments and her family expenses.

María Julia is an enterprising woman who desires to excel and help her family move forward.

loans.use: to purchase material for making costumes and clothing.

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en: Abenawa buys fresh fish from the seashore to smoke for resale. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a carpenter. Abenawa uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of utility bills and other household expenses. Abenawa will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. Abenawa plans to plow the new profits from her expanded business back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Yolanda Robe

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella, se dedica a la venta de tara, cochinilla y cuero en su casa, Yolanda compra a un distribuidor para vender a sus clientes. Ella ha estado en FINCA Perú durante ocho años y nunca ha tenido problemas para pagar su préstamo. Su sueño es ser capaz de pagar la educación superior de sus hijos, para que sean profesionales.
Le gusta FINCA Perú porque recibe con facilidad los préstamos, lo que le permite mejorar su vida y su negocio.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Amaquella community bank.  Her business is selling 'tara' (a tannin), cochineal and leather from her home.  Yolanda buys from a wholesaler and then sells to her customers.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for eight years and has never had any problems repaying her loans.  Her dream is to be able to pay for her children's higher education, so that they can become professionals.

Yolanda likes FINCA Peru because it is easy to receive a loan.  This allows her to improve her life and her business.

loans.use: to buy 'tara' and cochineal

loans.name: Magaret

texts.en: Magaret sells provisions such as milo (a drink powder), milk, sugar, biscuits and other items in Elmina. She has been educated through junior high school.  She is married to a farmer and has six dependents. Magaret has been selling provisions for 6 years.  She also helps her husband take care of their home. Her loan will be used to buy milo, milk sugar, biscuits and other items. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy milo (a drink powder), milk, sugar, biscuits and other items

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena tiene su negocio que es una pulpería. Tiene más de 6 años de obtener este medio de vida. Inicio su actividad por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos de su hogar. Sabe que todos los días tiene que levantarse temprano para atender a sus clientes que llegan en busca de granos básicos, cremas, sopas, detergentes, granos básicos y otros. El por eso que solicita el crédito para la compra de estos productos.
texts.en: Maria Elena has a grocery store business which she has owned for more than six years.  She set up her business because she needed to cover her household expenses.  She knows that she must get up early every day in order to serve her customers who come looking for basic grains, creams, soups, detergents and other products.  She is requesting a loan to buy these products.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, creams, soups, detergents and other products

loans.name: Daimer Rafael

texts.es: Daimer de 37 años  Vive en el municipio de Soledad  y está dedicado al comercio desde que llegó de la capital de Colombia Bogotá, buscando oportunidades de trabajo en empresas pero finalmente se dedicó a vender mercancías variadas y luego vio como una oportunidad la venta de alimentos como carnes, panes, galletas, queso que distribuye en una motocicleta sector a sector.  Su meta más adelante es incrementar los repartos en otros sectores, pero su mayor desafío es que su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para abordarlos, por eso recurre a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará carne, queso y galletería en general, los cuales tiene encargados en nuevos sectores donde ya empezó su promoción y encontró nuevos pedidos. Su sueño es tener su propia casa y un local en un punto muy comercial, además de comprar un vehículo que le permita aumentar el volumen de distribución y con ello lograr el aumento de sus ingreso familiares. Sus indicadores financieros son apropiados para obtener una inyección de capital de trabajo y aumentar su rentabilidad, que se encuentra en un 48%,  mediante compras en mayor volumen y de contado.
texts.en: Daimer, 37 years old, lives in the Soledad municipality.  He has been a merchant since he came from Bogota, the capital of Colombia, looking for work opportunities in companies.  He finally started selling various merchandise and later saw an opportunity in the sale of food such as meats, bread, crackers, cheeses, which he distributes from area to area on his motorcycle.  His goal is to increase the distribution to other areas, but his main challenge is not enough capital to be able to pursue this  This is the reason for his turning to his credit institution.  This is his first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo foundation, with which he will buy meat, cheese and various crackers for which he has orders in new areas where he started to promote his business and received orders.  His dream is to have his own  home and a site in a commercial area, in addition to being able to buy a vehicle that will allow him to increase the volume of his distribution.  This way he can increase his family income.  His financial indicators are appropriate to obtain an increase in working capital and up his profitability, which is at 48%, through the purchase of larger volumes and with cash.

loans.use: to purchase meat, cheese and crackers.

loans.name: Lucila Esperanza

texts.es:
Lucila es una madre de familia de 30 años, vive con su esposo e hijo en casa de unos familiares, cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Picsi que se encuentra a unos minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 5 años Lucila se dedica a la crianza y venta de cuyes (animales domésticos, su carne es consumida en diferentes presentaciones, cuenta con muchas propiedades beneficiosas para la salud), los alimenta con alfalfa y otras plantas, su corral lo tiene en la parte posterior de su casa para su seguridad, una vez que han llegado a su crecimiento ideal los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Chiclayo, sus ventas han aumentado lo que le permite solventar sus gastos diarios.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y su respectivo alimento, al tenerlos bien alimentados los podrá ofrecer a un mejor precio a sus clientes, lo que  permitirá pagar su crédito como brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.  Lucila es unamujer trabajadora, responsable y con mucho esfuerzo desea que su familia se supere y que su hijo tenga otras oportunidades.
texts.en:
