Lucila is a 30-year-old mother. She lives with her husband and child in the home of some relatives. They receive water and electricity services. Lucila resides in the District of Picsi, which is a few minutes away from Chiclayo Province.

For the past five years, Lucila has been raising and selling guinea pigs. The meat from these domesticated animals is prepared in different ways and known to have health benefits. Lucila feeds her animals alfalfa and other plants and keeps them in a pen located behind her house so that they remain secure. Once the guinea pigs have reached the ideal stage of development, she offers them for sale at different market in Chiclayo. Her sales have increased, which allows her to cover her daily expenses.

Lucila is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that she can buy more animals and the appropriate feed. By feeding them well, she will be able to sell the animals to her customers at a good price. This will enable her to repay her loan and provide her family a better quality of life.

Lucila is a hardworking and responsible woman. With great effort, she hopes to see her family succeed and provide her son with other opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase more animals and the appropriate feed.

loans.name: Alva Nora

texts.en: Alva Nora lives in the Choluteca region of Honduras with her husband and two children. For the past four years, she has operated a small business selling women’s cosmetics.  Occasionally her sisters assist with the business. She is a returning loan client and is requesting an HNL 8,000 loan with which to buy merchandise to sell. In her free time, Alva Nora raises pigs and chickens at home.

loans.use: to purchase women's cosmetics.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
El señor Adolfo hoy en día, trabaja en servicio de taxi, pues gracias al esfuerzo por obtener mejores cambios, sigue adelante.
 Tiene diez años de estar laborando. Su esposa es comerciante y ayuda con los gastos de la familia, ya que son cuatro hijos los que cursan el año escolar.
Adolfo ha vendido trabajando con financiamiento  a plazos, en diez ciclos, siendo de gran alternativa para dar mantenimiento a su taxi, ya que por circular cada día, tiende a tener más gastos. Teniendo unas veces para repararlo y otras ha sido con los préstamo que ha hecho el cambio de su motor.
Con este nuevo préstamo será para la compra de caja de velocidad, sistema de suspensión delantero y trasero, a si como lubricante que ayude a dar un mejor funcionamiento para ejercer su trabajo.
texts.en:
Adolfo provides a taxi service.  Thanks to his efforts to improve and change, he gets ahead in life.  Adolfo has been working for ten years.  His wife is a saleswoman and she helps him cover their family expenses.  They have four children who are all in school.

Adolfo has been working with loans for ten loan cycles.  It has been very helpful and allowed him to have maintenance work done on his taxi since, because he drives the vehicle every day, he tends to have a lot of expenses.  On some occasions, he has had his taxi repaired and on other occasions he has used his loan to change his engine.

Adolfo will use this new loan to buy a gearbox, front and rear suspension systems and also lubricant which will help his car run better and make it easier to do his work.

loans.use: to change his gearbox and buy lubricants which will improve the condition of his car

loans.name: Divinas Group

texts.es:
L. A.C. “DIVINAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por L. señora Victoria. Los negocios que las integrantes D. L. asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta D. comida, venta D. zapatos, venta D. golosinas, venta D. ropa y mantas, venta D. ollas, chofer propietario, venta D. adornos D. porcelana

L. señora Victoria,  indica que hace doce años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que ingreso, cuando vino a preguntar a L. oficina. En L. actualidad elL. tiene un negocio D. venta D. calzados que inicio hace 29 años, aprendiendo este oficio D. su hermana. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para L. compra mercadería (compra D. calzados). Estos productos los comprará por mayor D. L. ciudad D. Oruro y posteriormente a los venderá en las ferias D. L. cuidad D. El Alto. Esta forma D. trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues elL. es viuda y  tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta D. Pro Mujer, elL. responD. que le gusta el ahorro y L. capacitación.
texts.en:
The “DIVINAS” community bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional office.  The bank has nine members and is run by a board of directors, which is led by Victoria.  The business activities that the members are engaged in are varied and incluD.: selling food, selling shoes, selling candies, selling clothes and blankets, selling pans, working as a driver (with own vehicle) and selling china ornaments.

Victoria says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for twelve years and she joined when she came to the office to ask about the program.  She has a business selling footwear which she set up 29 years ago.  She learned the traD. from her sister.

Victoria will use her loan to buy merchandise (footwear).  She will buy her products wholesale in the city of Oruro and then sell them in the street markets in the city of El Alto.  This work allows her to make income with which to support her family.  She is a widow and has three children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the savings and the training.

loans.use: to buy footwear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise and tools for his business

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. She has been educated through junior high school. Maame sells kako (a salted dried fish), wele (an edible cowhide) and fish in Elmina, which she has done for just 6 months. Maame uses her income to support her husband by paying for  utility bills and other household expenses. She will use the loan to purchase kako, fish and wele for resale. Her plan is to further grow her business with the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase kako, fish and wele for resale.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel is pictured above. She has eight dependents. She has been educated up to senior high school.  Mable fries doughnuts for sale and she also sells rice in Elmina, which she has done for 8 years. Mable promises to use the loan to purchase flour, sugar, oil and other ingredients for doughnuts, and to buy rice for sale. With the new profits from expansion, Mable plans to reinvest in her business.  Her right hand is on a bag of flour and her left is on a bag of rice.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, oil, rice and other items

loans.name: Afriyie Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
George is currently the group leader of "Afriyie" Trust bank Group which is made up of 3 members.  George is clearly a hard worker.  He drills mortar and sells to households in the local market together with pestles.  Mortar and pestle are local tools for the preparation of “fufu”, a very popular dish in Ghana happily enjoyed by many people.  

George carves mortar from a piece of thick stemmed wood. He plans to use the loan to purchase additional wood drilling machines to enable him carve more mortar and improve his income.  George possesses about 25 year’s of hands on experience mortar carving and pestle making.  He is also a hard working farmer.

George is married to a woman who is a farmer and together they have two children.  He lives with his family in Berekum, northern part of Ghana.  Above all, he hopes to increase his savings to acquire his own accommodation.  As the leader of the group, he ensures that all members attend meetings and submit their repayments.

loans.use: To purchase a mortar drilling machine.

loans.name: Las Malvinas Group

texts.es: La Sra. Susana  es casada, tiene 3 hijos, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Las Malvinas” grupo  conformado por 13  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Susana   trabaja desD. hace 8 años en la venta D. comida este trabajo  surge a raíz D. que a su esposo ganaba sueldo mínimo y no podía cubrir los  gastos básicos,  alimentación,  educación y pago D. servicios,  es así que Susana   pone su puesto D. comida, hoy en día tiene muchos clientes y eso le genera buena ganancia y también desD. hace tres años Susana junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta D. zapato y prendas D. vestir,  y las prendas y zapatos los venD. en provincia. Susana  trabajo muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia,  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mejores ingresos económicos , sus hijos van a colegios privado,  y sobre todo  su familia tiene una mejor calidad D. vida  ,  con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería prendas D. vestir y zapatos . Sabemos que Susana cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Susana is married and has three children.  She is a member of the “Las Malvinas” communal bank which has 13 members dedicated to various commercial activities.

Susana has worked for 8 years selling food.  This business arose because her husband earned minimum wage and it was not enough to cover basic needs, food, schooling and utility payments.  Therefore, Susana set up her food stand and today she has many customers which generate good profits.  Three years ago she and her husband also started selling articles of clothing and shoes.  They sell these out in the countrysiD..  

Susana worked very hard to move her family ahead and thanks to her effort and dedication she’s attained improved income; her children attend private schools and, above all, the family has a better quality of life.

With the thought in mind of continuing to grow she has asked for a new loan to buy clothing and shoes.  We know that Susana will meet her goals with much work and effort and that Edaprospo loans will help her.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing (clothes and shoes).

loans.name: Combine Sisters Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Combine Sisters” group.  These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 1,000,000.00 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Sallay is the leader of this group.  Sallay is about 45 years old and she is a widow with 5 grown-up children.  Sallay sells dried/smoked fish and has been doing this business for 7 years now.  With the help of this loan, Sallay will invest in her business by buying baskets full of dried/smoked fish to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy baskets full of dried/smoked fish to add to her business

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is married and has six dependents.  Her husband is a farmer.  She sells food items such as kako, tomatoes, pepper, onions, eggs, spices and others at Elmina, which she has done for 6 years. 

As part of her responsibilities of the home she feeds and clothes the children.  Efua will use the loan to purchase more food items for sale.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to build a bigger shop.

loans.use: Efua will use the loan to purchase more food items for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase displays, showcases, and more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay graduation expenses.

loans.name: Herrinta

texts.en:
Herrinta is married to an electrician.  She has four children.  She has been through junior high school.  Herrinta sells doughnuts in front of her electrical and provisions shop at Elmina, which she has done for 3 years. 

She uses her income to support the education and feeding of the children.  The loan when received will be invested into the doughnut, electrical and provision business.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Herrinta plans to reinvest back into her business.  She is currently standing in front of the electrical shop.

loans.use: The loan when received will be invested into the doughnut, electrical and provision business.

loans.name: Santos Daniel

texts.en: Santos lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras where he has worked as a security guard at the local Department of Environment and Natural Resources for the past five years. Santos also sells fruit in his spare time to earn extra income. He is requesting a loan of HNL 12,000 to purchase materials needed for making some improvements to his home. Santos hopes to apply for another loan in the future to fund additional home improvements.

loans.use: to purchase roofing materials, cement, and cinder blocks.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells smoked fish and provisions in Elmina. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a farmer. Efua has been selling fish for 10 years. She is responsible for assisting her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke and sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save toward her child's university education.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke and sell.

loans.name: "gye Nyame" Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Yaa describes herself as a neat and hardworking woman. She is a 39-year-old mother of four children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Yaa is currently the group leader of “Gye Nyame” Trust Bank. She is a petty trader who has been selling smoked fish and hides for the past twenty years. Smoked fish is a locally roasted fresh fish to make it more flavorsome for the preparation of soups and sauces. She also engages in farming as her second business to make extra income. 

She is excited to be receiving the loan, which she plans to invest into purchasing more cartons of fresh fish to smoke and serve her customers. She anticipates increasing her profit level and also expanding her market. Yaa hopes to increase her savings to buy a piece of land to start building a house to accommodate her family.

The other members of Yaa’s group are traders and service providers.  As the leader of the group, she ensures regular meeting attendance and repayment of loan installments.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fresh fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood, clay and 'nacazcol' (a dye) for making pots and 'comales' (special dishes for cooking tortillas)

loans.name: Unión Lealtad Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIÓN LEALTAD” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Panamericana, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Nilda. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de galletas, venta de DVD, comercio, producción, cultivo y servicios.
 
La señora Nilda,  indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de su mamá. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de galletas y DVD, que viene trabajando hace seis años atrás, el cual inicio con la ayuda de su cuñada.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para surtir su mercadería (compra galletas y DVD’s), este material lo compra del Desaguadero y los venderá en las ferias de Extranca y16 de julio (lugares comerciales de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las actividades de la institución.

Una de las socias no salio en la fotografía ya que se encontro la señora María Elena, por que se encontro en una mala ubicación
texts.en:
The “Unión Lealtad” (Loyalty Union) communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Center.  It has six members and is led by a governing body headed by Nilda.  The businesses that the communal bank members carry out are varied.  Among them are: cookie sales, DVD sales, commerce, production, farming and services.

Nilda has been in Pro Mujer for three years; she was invited to join by her mother.  Currently she has a business selling cookies and DVDs that she’s had for six years and she started with help from her sister-in-law.

The loan she’ll take out now is to stock her merchandise (to buy cookies and DVDs).  She buys this merchandise in Desaguadero and will sell it at the Extranca and 16 de Julio markets (commercial places in the city of El Alto).  This way of working makes it possible for her to generate income to support the family as much as possible for she has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the institution’s activities.

One of the members, María Luisa, does not appear in the photo because she was in a bad location.

loans.use: to buy cookiesa and DVDs.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: Luis  de 50 años, residente en Soledad en compañía de su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 9 y 13 años, es el propietario del negocio “Tienda El Patrón” experiencia que surgió hace muchos años cuando necesitó ayudar a su madre, así fue que recurrió primero a préstamos informales de alto costo, pero gradualmente cuando fue saliendo de estas deudas empezó a generar más utilidades y su negocio le entusiasmó, pero continuó trabajando con préstamos de proveedores a 30 días, Hoy quiere buscar mejores opciones en compras de contado y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva que es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará ranchos víveres, bebidas, dulces y enlatados en mayor proporción y de contado, lo cual le augura muy buenos descuentos con los que alcanzará a generar mayores utilidades sobre sus ventas. Su sueño más adelante es tener una casa propia con su local para poner su tienda,por eso mientras trabaja para lograrlo continua esforzándose por aumentar sus utilidades, que se encuentran en un porcentaje no menor a un 30%, y sigue manejando sus ventas de contado y tambien con mucha prudencia los pocos créditos que hace a sus mejores clientes.
texts.en:
Luis, 50, lives in Soledad with his spouse and two children who are 9 and 13 years old.  He owns a store called “Tienda El Patrón” that arose years ago when he needed to help his mother.  This is how he first called upon informal, high cost loans but as he gradually came out from under these debts he started to generate more profits and his business excited him.  He continued to work with 30 day loan providers, however.  

Today, he wants to find better options for making cash purchases and this is why he’s called on his Kiva loan which is the first loan he’s made with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and that he’ll use to buy snacks, foodstuffs, beverages, candy and canned goods in larger amounts and paying cash which will insure better discounts that will lead to better profits on sales.

His dream for later on is to have a house of his own with space to install the store.  For this reason, while he works to reach it he continues to try to increase his profits which currently are no less than 30% and he continues to handle cash sales and exercise much prudence with the few loans he extends to his best customers.

loans.use: to buy snacks, foodstuffs, beverages, candy and canned goods in larger amounts and paying cash.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Union And Strength Group

texts.en: Maira Dalila, Santos Humberto and Santa Margarita, all residents of the Valle region of Honduras, formed the "Union and Strength" solidarity group in June of 2011. Collectively they will serve as guarantors of each others' loans. Both Maira Dalila and Santos Humberto operate small convenience shops where they sell basic foodstuffs, personal hygiene products and other household items. They are requesting loans of 8,000 HNL and 5,000 HNL, with which they will purchase merchandise for their shops. Santa Margarita operates a business selling firewood in large quantities, as well as refreshments, snacks and other basic food items. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 HNL, with which she will buy merchandise to sell in her business.

loans.use: This loan will be used to purchase meats, cheeses, vegetables, fruits, dairy products, refreshments, snacks, beverages, basic grains, personal hygiene products, household cleaning supplies and firewood.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor es un padre de familia de 39 años  de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia y no cuenta con  servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Este distrito se caracteriza porque los pobladores desarrollan la actividad agricola, ganadera y artesanía.

Víctor se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace algún tiempo, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde  siembra limón; una vez que se da la cosecha lo vende en los mercados de la zona, es un producto muy rentable porque se cosecha semanalmente, con sus ventas podrá brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizantes para abonar sus tierras de cultivo y asegurarse de tener una muy buena producción de limón y para el pago de mano de obra para el deshierbos.  Víctor es una persona  responsable y trabajadora que lo único que quiere es darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Victor is a 39-year-old father who lives in his own home with his wife and children. He does not receive any basic services. Victor resides in the District of Tambogrande, which is part of the Department of Piura. This district is known for the businesses of its residents who engage in agriculture, livestock breeding, and producing handicrafts.

Victor has been farming for some time. He has his own land on which he grows lemons. When the fruits are ready to be harvested, he sells them at the local market. This type of product is very profitable because it can be harvested on a weekly basis. Through his sales, Victor is able to provide his family a better quality of life.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN so that he can buy fertilizers to apply on his farmland, which will guarantee a good level of lemon production. In addition, he will be able to pay workers to help with the removal of weeds. Victor is a responsible and hardworking individual. The only thing he wants is to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Rayo De Luz 4 Group

texts.en:
Cristina is the coordinator of her group, Rayo D. Luz 4 (Ray of Light), located in the rural area surrounding La Romana. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children and their father. Cristina and the other members are dedicated to operating businesses, like selling clothes, shoes, food and so on. She operates a variety store, where she sells different products at her house from a small stand she maD.. 

Cristina is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing cosmetics, beauty products, shoes, accessories, jewelry, clothes and other products. She enjoys being at home with her family and attending Church.

She started her business almost one year ago with her first loan from Esperanza. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, beauty products, shoes, accessories, jewelry, clothes, etc.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
María de 50 años, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Ferreñafe perteneciente a la provincia de Chiclayo.  La casa de María solo cuenta con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica. Esta es una zona de actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

María es dueña de una pequeña tienda de abarrotes y venta de comida en su domicilio. Esta  actividad la realiza desde  hace varios años y cuenta con clientela establecida.

María  solicita a Edpyme Alternativa  un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles para realizar mejoras en su casa pues esta también es parte de su trabajo y por lo tanto le permitirá seguir brindando un buen servicio a su clientela, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

María con su trabajo y ganas de salir adelante se ha ganado la confianza y el respeto de sus vecinos, demostrando que cuando uno se propone una meta se puede hacer realidad. Ella tiene muchos deseos de sacar a sus  hijos adelante.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and children. She resides in the District of Ferreñafe, which is part of Chiclayo Province. The only basic service she receives at home is electricity. This area is known for having businesses related to farming, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

María owns a small grocery store and also sells food out of her home. She has been in business for several years and has an established customer base.

María is requesting a loan of 3000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can make improvements to her house. Part of the loan will also be used for her business so that she can continue providing good service to her customers. With the revenue she generates, she will be able to repay her loan and improve the quality of life for her family.

As a result of her work and her desire to move forward, María has earned the confidence and respect of her neighbors. Whenever she sets a goal, she has demonstrated that she can follow through until it has been completed. María has many hopes of helping her children get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store and to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.es:
Miguelina de 61 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia que cuenta con servicio de agua y luz y esta ubicada en el distrito de San Pedro de Lloc que pertenece al departamento de la Libertad,  esta zona tiene como principal actividad la agricultura y ganadería.  Miguelina tiene hijos mayores de edad e independientes. 

Miguelina se dedica  a la venta de frutas en el mercado de San Pedro de Lloc, tiene una experiencia de 10 años y es muy conocida en la zona. Cuenta con clientela fidelizada y las ventas de sus productos han incrementado; al igual que sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida. 

El préstamo que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla es de 2000 nuevos soles, este lo utilizará en la compra de frutas para abastecer a su clientela. El aumento de sus ventas le permitirá cubrir su crédito y cumplir con sus obligaciones de casa.  

Miguelina es una persona con muchas aspiraciones y una de ellas es  tener un puesto más grande en el mercado para poder ofrecer mayor variedad de frutas, ganar más clientes, obtener mayores ingresos y tener las comodidades que tanto desea en su casa.
texts.en:
Miguelina is 61 years old. She lives with her husband in their own home, which receives water and electricity services. Miguelina resides in the District of San Pedro de Lloc, which is part of the Department of La Libertad. This area is known primarily for its agriculture and livestock businesses. Miguelina has grown children who are independent.

She sells fruit at the market in San Pedro de Lloc. Miguelina has 10 years of experience and is well-known in the area. She has a loyal customer base and the sales of her products have grown. Her earnings have helped to improve her quality of life.

The loan she is requesting from Edpyme Alternativa represents seed capital in the amount of 2000 PEN. This money will be used to buy fruit that she can sell to her customers. By increasing her sales, she will be able to cover her loan payments and meet her household obligations.

Miguelina is a person who has many aspirations. One of them is to have a larger vending post at the market so that she can offer a wider variety of fruits, attract more customers, and obtain more income. As a result, she can acquire the comforts that she wants to have in her home.

loans.use: to purchase fruit.

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - Pacasmayo - La Libertad

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
Modesto tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en la casa de sus padres, cuenta con sólo  servicio de luz y esta ubicada en el distrito de Túcume - Lambayeque.  Esta ciudad tiene como actividad principal la agricultura, ganadería y el turismo, debido a que es zona arqueológica.

Modesto desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno, su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, él alimenta a sus animales con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que estos llegan a un crecimiento óptimo, Modesto los ofrece en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtiene ganancias para solventar los gastos familiares.

Modesto solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar animales y su respectiva comida para tenerlos bien alimentados, con la finalidad de venderlos a mejores precios y así mejorar  su calidad de vida.  Modesto es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable cuyos únicos deseos son  que su negocio crezca cada vez más y que su familia se supere.
texts.en:
Modesto is 36 years old and lives with his wife and children in the home of his parents. The only service he receives is electricity. He resides in the District of Túcume-Lambayeque. The main business activities in this city involve agriculture, livestock breeding, and tourism. This area is known for its archaeological sites.

Modesto has been raising and selling cattle for a few years. He has a corral located behind his house. The diet of his animals consists of balanced feed and natural grasses. Once the animals have reached the optimal stage of development, he offers them for sale at different markets in the area so that he can generate income to cover the family expenses.

Modesto is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can buy more animals and the appropriate feed so that they will have a good diet. He hopes that he can sell them at a good price and improve his quality of life.

Modesto is a hardworking and responsible person. His only wishes are to grow his business with each opportunity and to help his family succeed.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and the appropriate feed.

loans.name: Bani Dolores

texts.es:
La señora Bani es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Triunfadoras del distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos. 
Es socia del Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años, todos los préstamos anteriores han sido para habilitar y mejorar poco a poco su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de comida.
Con su nuevo préstamo  de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprara  6 docenas de platos entre hondos y tendidos, 3 docenas de cubiertos y 1 ciento de plato descartables.
Tiene  3 personas que le ayudan en su negocio porque al medio día es cuando tiene más clientela y necesita de apoyo, esta actividad le demanda muchas horas al día, son varias comidas que elabora para dar mayor variedad y alternativas a sus clientes. 
Está muy agradecida por los préstamos que Manuela Ramos le da y sobre todo por la confianza.
texts.en:
Bani is a member of the “Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Triumphant Women) communal bank in Callería District, Ucayali Department.  She’s 33 years old, married and has two children.

She’s been a member of the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years.  All her previous loans were used to equip and gradually improve her business; she sells food.

She will use the new, 1000 new sol, loan to buy six dozen planes (both flat and soup), three dozen sets of cutlery and 100 disposable plates.

She has three people that help her with the business because at noon when she has the largest number of customers she needs the help.  This activity demands many hours a day.  She prepares several dishes that she makes in order to have more variety and choices for her customers on offer.

She is very grateful for the loans that Manuela Ramos provides but most of all for the trust.

loans.use: to buy plates.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza de 60 años es madre de familia vive en casa de unos familiares, sus hijos son mayores de edad e independientes. Esperanza vive en la provincia de Chiclayo. En la cual los pobladores desarrollan la actividad comercial, agrícola y turismo.

Esperanza se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado fresco en su puesto en el mercado Modelo ( mercado popular con mayor afluencia en la zona de Chiclayo), desde hace varios  años, los martes y viernes son los días que más concurrencia de gente hay en el mercado y su producto se vende rápido. La venta de sus productos la ayudan a solventar sus gastos diarios del hogar.

Esperanza ha solicitado un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para comprar más pescado fresco y una congeladora para conservar este producto, lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Esperanza desea que su negocio crezca cada vez más para tener mayores comodidades en su casa.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a mother who is 60 years of age. She lives at the home of some relatives. Her children are adults and live independently. Esperanza resides in Chiclayo Province, where the residents engage in developed businesses involving trade, agriculture, and tourism.

Esperanza buys and sells fresh fish from her own stand at the Modelo Market (the busiest and most popular market in Chiclayo). She has worked there for several years. Tuesdays and Fridays are her busiest days because there are plenty of people at the market and her product sells quickly during those times. The sale of her products helps her to cover her daily household expenses.

Esperanza is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy more fresh fish and a freezer for preserving her product. This will allow her to increase her income so that she can repay her loan and improve her quality of life. Esperanza wants her business to grow each time so that she can acquire more comforts for her home.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish and a freezer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy Dacron, gabardine and Sincatex.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José de 23 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en su casa propia que solo cuenta con servicio de luz, esta ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

La actividad que desarrolla José  es la crianza y venta de ganado ovino, desde hace unos años el lugar donde cría  sus animales es la parte posterior de la casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada  y granos naturales, una vez que tengan el tamaño y el peso ideal los oferta en los distintos mercados, ya que cuenta con su propia clientela en la ciudad de Piura. Adicionalmente, José cuenta con una mototaxi que la trabaja para tener más ingresos.  Esto le permite obtener mayores ganancias para cubrir sus gastos diarios. 

José solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1200 nuevos soles para comprar el alimento para sus animales, lo que le permitirá tenerlos bien alimentados  para ofertarlos a un mejor precio.  José es una persona muy conocida en el lugar donde vive porque siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de los suyos.

José tiene muchos deseos de  brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 23 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and child. The only service he receives is electricity. José resides in the District of Tambogrande, which is part of the Department of Piura. This area is known for agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

José has been raising and selling sheep for a few years. The animals are kept in an area behind his house. Their diet consists of balanced feed and natural grasses. Once the animals have reached the ideal size and weight, José offers them for sale at different markets. He has his own customers in the city of Piura. In addition, José drives a motorcycle taxi to earn more income to help with covering daily expenses.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1200 PEN in order to buy feed for his animals. This will allow him to provide a good diet for his animals so that he can offer them at a better price. José is a person who is well-known in the place where he lives because he is always concerned about the welfare of others. What he desires most is to provide his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his animals.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina and her multi-service business have had a great impact on many new immigrants in her community. Many clients from Central America use her store’s services--money transfers, calling cards, tickets and cargo--to help them connect with their families back home. 

Josefina received a loan from ACCION USA in the past, but unfortunately, like many small business owners she was greatly affected by the sluggish economy. She works full-time at her business and has a second part-time job in the evenings, delivering pizzas in order to cover her personal expenses and keep her business running.

Josefina’s second loan from ACCION USA will help her purchase a professional scale to improve the cargo services she offers. She would also like to implement an aggressive marketing campaign to gain more customers.

loans.use: to purchase a professional scale and implement an aggressive marketing campaign.

loans.name: Janeth Maribel

texts.es:
Janeth es una madre de familia de 37 años, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Chepén - La Libertad. Esta zona tiene como actividad principal el comercio, la agricultura y el turismo.  

Desde hace 5 años Janeth se dedica a la venta diaria de menestra cocida y especias, en el mercado de la ciudad donde vive, tiene su propia clientela quien se siente satisfecha con los productos que ofrece. 

Janeth ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para realizar algunos arreglos en su vivienda y con los ingresos que obtenga con las ventas de sus productos podrá cubrir su crédito y podrá tener más comodidades en su casa para su familia.

Janeth es una mujer responsable, trabajadora y honesta que lo único que quiere es sacar a su familia adelante en especial a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Janeth is a 37-year-old mother who lives with her husband and children. They reside in their own home in the District of Chepén – La Libertad. This area is known for its businesses in the retail, agriculture, and tourism sectors.

Janeth has been selling cooked stew and spices at the city market for five years. She has her own customers who are pleased with the products she offers.

Janeth is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 so that she can make a few repairs to her home. The income that she earns from the sale of her products will cover this loan and allow her to acquire more home furnishings for her family.

Janeth is a responsible, hardworking, and honest woman. The only thing she wants is for her family, especially her children, to move forward.

loans.use: to pay for home repairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used children's clothes, used sheets, used assorted young adult clothes and used shoes.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martín de 30 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en la zona rural del departamento de Lambayeque.  Los pobladores de ésta zona se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Martín maneja su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace 2 años aproximadamente, está actividad la realiza en la misma zona donde vive. A pesar de la gran cantidad de personas que realizan el mismo trabajo, el cuenta con clientes fijos que transporte desde muy temprano a sus diferentes destinos. Esto le permite a Martín contar con mayor cantidad de ingresos para solventar sus gastos y necesidades del hogar.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1500 nuevos soles y su destino será para el mantenimiento y renovación de asientos y carpa que necesita su mototaxi para seguir brindando un buen servicio a su clientela y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  

Martín es una persona responsable y trabajadora  que tiene muchos deseos de darles a sus hijos un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Martín, 30, lives with is wife and children in his own house in the rural area of the department of Lambayeque.  The inhabitants in this area are involved mainly in agriculture, livestock farming and tourism.

Martín has been in the moto-taxi service (short-distance transportation for up to three people) for approximately two years.  He works in the same area where he lives, and despite the fact that there are many people active in this same type of work, he has fixed customers that rely on him from very early in the morning to get them to their respective destinations.  This gives Martín more income to cover his household needs and expenditures.

The loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN that he has requested through Edpyme Alternativa will be used for maintenance and renovation of the seats and top of his moto-taxi so he can continue providing optimum service to customers and improve his family's lifestyle.

Martín is a responsible, hard-working person who is intent on giving his children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his motorcycle seats.

loans.name: Maria Violeta

texts.es:
María  D. 45 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y 3 hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en   el distrito D. Eten – Chiclayo, esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad pesquera y comercialización D. aves D. corral. La casa D. María cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.

DesD. hace 4 años María se dedica la venta D. abarrotes (productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos, etc) y D. bebidas. Su negocio lo ha colocado en su casa para mayor comodidad y seguridad, con las ganancias por la venta D. sus productos  trata D. cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar el nivel D. vida D. su familia.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio ha solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  D. 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías, con el fin D. que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.  

María es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por darle mayores comodidades a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María, 45, lives with her husband and three children in her own house in the district of Eten - Chiclayo.  This area is known for its fishing activity and chicken sales.  María's house has all the basic utilities.

For four years María has been selling groceries (daily consumption products such as: milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet tissue, tuna, eggs, etc.) and beverages. Her store is set up in her home for comfort and security purposes.  With the income she earns from product sales she tries to cover household expenses and improve her family's lifestyle.

In order to grow her business she has requested a loan in the amount of 2,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy more merchandise so she can increase business and offer more products to customers.

María is a responsible, dedicated and hard-working person who is concerned about giving her children a more comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: El Bonete Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "El Bonete" porque asi se llama el lugar donD. se formo el grupo, esta ubicado en el estado D. MoreL., en México. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes y es la quinta vez que solicitan un prestamo. Maria es integrante del grupo, tiene 32 años, estudio hasta el tercer año D. secundaria, es comerciante, tiene un total D. 3 hijos (2 mujeres y un varon). Ella se dedica a la venta D. colchas y cosméticos, negocio que inicio hace 3 años ya que con lo que ganaba su esposo no alcanzaba para solventar L. gastos D. la familia. Al momento D. solicitar el préstamo se siente contenta porque tendrá  mas productos que ofrecer a sus clientes y D. este modo podrá conseguirL. a mejor precio, quiere este prestamo para comprar cosmeticos, cremas, perfumes y colchas. Con las ganancias espera poder comprar uniformes para el próximo ciclo escolar D. sus hijos y otra parte para ahorrar y seguir comprando más mercancia para no verse presionada con L. pedidos que le hacen diariamente. Ella desea continuar brindandoles educación a sus hijos para que cumplan sus sueños, también desea apoyar a su esposo en L. gastos familiares y tener una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
This group is called “El Bonete” because that’s the name of the place where the group was formed.  It is located in the State of MoreL. in México.  The group has 9 members and this is the fifth time they’ve asked for a loan.

María, 32, is one of the group members.  She completed 9th graD., is a merchant, and has three children (two girls and one boy).  She sells bedspreads and cosmetics, a business she started three years ago because what her husband earned was insufficient to cover all the family’s expenses.

At the moment of requesting the loan she is happy because she’ll have more products to offer her customers and she’ll be able to get them at better prices.  She wants to use the loan to buy cosmetics, creams, perfume and bedspreads.  

She intends to use part of the profits to buy her children’s school uniforms for the upcoming term and she will save part of it so that she can continue to buy merchandise and not feel pressured when she receives her daily orders.  She wants to continue to proviD. education for her children so that they will make their dreams a reality and she also wants to help her husband with household expenses and to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, creams, perfume and bedspreads.

loans.name: Jesus Tiene Poder Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JESUS TIENE PODER” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Rosario. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de verdura, cultivo en carpas, venta de verduras, venta de arena, sistema eléctrico, venta de carne. 

La señora Rosario,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de la promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne que inicio desde niña con sus padres.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital de trabajo (compra de carne) que comprará de la Ciudad de El Alto y lo venderá mediante repartición a todas partes. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta todo.
texts.en:
The Jesus Tiene Poder (Jesus Has Power) Community Association started its first loan cycle with Kiva partner Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Villa Exaltacion. It is comprised of eight members and is run by a board of directors headed by Rosario. The businesses that the members of the community association run are varied. Among them we have: vegetable sales, greenhouse farming, (more) vegetable sales, sand sales, electrical systems, and meat sales.

Rosario states that this is the first time that Pro Mujer has been involved by way of an invitation from a promotion. Currently, she has a meat sales business that she started as a girl with her parents.

The loan she will now take is to augment her working capital (for purchasing meat). She will make her purchases in the city of El Alto and sell it by making distributions all over. This work allows her to generate income to support her family; she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said she likes everything.

loans.use: to purchase meat

loans.name: Norma Maria

texts.es:
Doña Norma tiene su propio negocio, iniciando hace seis años, con pequeña ventas, de ropa y joyas. Durante estos años ha logrado captar clientes, en donde tiene muchos pedidos.
Sus dos hijos siguen en la educación primaria, siendo su esposo el apoyo de la familia. 
Con su negocio se ha ayudado mucho, logrando suplir otros gastos de su familia, lo que esta satisfecha con su ventas. y con la institución por ser el medio que ha hecho posible esta mejora económica.
Con este nuevo préstamo será para la compra de: ropa de dama y varón, zapatos, y cosméticos de la zermat, para seguir aumentando sus ventas.
texts.en:
Norma has her own business, which she started six years ago with a few sales of clothes and jewelry. Over the years, she has been gaining customers who bring her a lot of orders.

Her two children are working on their elementary education; her husband supports the family.

This business has helped her greatly, allowing her to meet other household expenses. She is happy with her sales, and this organization has been the means through which she has been able to improve financially.

With this new loan, she will purchase clothes for women and men, shoes, and Zermat cosmetics so that she can continue growing her sales.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for women and men, shoes, and cosmetics, allowing her to have better sales and revenue

loans.name: Flor Kantuta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR KANTUTA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Lucha. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de mantas, venta de pescado, fábrica de lácteos, costura de chalecos, tienda de artículos varios, artesanías, venta de comida, tapicería.
 
La señora Lucha,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de chalecos, que viene trabajando hace trece años atrás, el cual inicio solo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de tela, este material lo compra de la Ceja y por mayor, posterior a la elaboración. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación, salud y ahorros.

En la fotografía nos acompaña la hermana de una de las socias, ella es la que mira la ventana.
texts.en:
The Flor Kantuta Community Association will start its first loan cycle with Kiva partner Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Panamericana. It is comprised of eight members and is run by a board of directors headed up by Lucha. The businesses that the members of the community association run are varied. Among them we have: crocheting blankets, selling fish, dairy production, making cardigans, a general store, arts and crafts, food sales, and upholstery.

Lucha states that this is her first time working with Pro Mujer and that she started by invitation from a promoter. She has a business of making cardigans. She has been in this business for three years, which she started on her own.

The loan she will take is to purchase fabric. She will purchase this material from Ceja wholesale after it is made. This work allows her to generate revenue to support her family. She is married and has six children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training, health, and savings.

In the photograph, the sister of one of the members is present. She is the one looking out the window.

loans.use: to purchase fabric

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Olga se dedica a la venta de productos naturales para la salud. 
A su negocio le está haciendo falta mas variedad de productos para la venta, es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en comprar productos y así poder tener inventario y entregar los pedidos pendientes que tiene. 
Con una párete de las ganancias D. negocio será para pagar, ya es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
texts.en:
Olga sells natural health products.

Her business has been lacking variety of products to sell, and this is why she is requesting a loan for purchasing products so that she will be able to have inventory and fill the pending orders she has.

She will be able to pay with the business's earnings. This is the source of income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase natural health products

loans.name: Kollitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KOLLITAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Panamericana, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Lidia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción, cultivo y servicios.
 
La señora Lidia,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa de bebe, que viene trabajando hace cinco meses atrás, el cual inicio con la ayuda de su cuñada.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para surtir su mercadería (compra de ropa de bebe), este material lo compra de la C. Tumusla y lo venderá en la feria16 de julio (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto). Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el consultorio.
texts.en:
The Kollitas Community Association will start its first loan cycle with Kiva partner Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Panamericana. It is comprised of seven members and is run by a board of directors headed by Lidia. The businesses that the members of the community association run are varied. Among them we have sales, production, farming, and services.

Lidia states that this is her first time working with Pro Mujer, and she joined at the invitation of a promoter. She has a business selling baby clothes, which she has been running for five years, and which she started with the help of her sister-in-law.

The loan she will take is to invest in merchandise (buying baby clothes). She will purchase these items on Tumusla street and will sell them at the 16 de Julio Market (a commercial zone in the city of El Alto). This work allows her to generate revenue to support her family. She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the training and consulting.

loans.use: to purchase baby clothes

loans.name: Fatima Del Socorro

texts.es:
Fátima es una mujer emprendedora, con su negocio propio, pues cuanta con el alquiler de un cuarto, vende cosmético y está realizando un nuevo negocio de visituria el cual ella misma elabora pulsera, collares, colas, chapas, entre otros siendo de buenas venta por ser bonitos y accesibles de precios.
Tiene el apoyo de su esposo, quien labora como ingeniero industrial, con dinero propio de su liquidación, ahorros de su esposo y con financiamiento de Afodenic, ha logrado establecer las ventas varias para cubrir gastos básicos de la casa.
Ahora con este nuevo financiamiento comprara: ropa, zapatos, y variedades de visituria para hacer su trabajo manual en collares y otros, con esto espera llamar más cliente atreves de sus ventas siendo el objetivo la captación de clientes nuevos.
texts.en:
Fátima is an entrepreneurial woman who owns her own business.  She rents out a room, sells cosmetics and is currently carrying out a new business activity, making costume jewelry.  She makes bracelets, necklaces, hair ties, badges and other items.  Her products sell well because they are pretty and also affordable.

Fátima has the support of her husband who works as an industrial engineer.  With her own severance pay, savings from her husband and loans from Afodenic, Fátima has managed to establish her sales business to cover her basic household expenses.

With this new loan, Fátima will buy clothes, shoes and various pieces for making her necklaces and other jewelry products (by hand).  In this way, she hopes to attract more customers.  Her goal is to capture new customers.

loans.use: to invest in clothes, shoes and pieces for making costume jewelry

loans.name: Maria De Los Santos

texts.es:
Doña María estableció su pequeño negocio, con más de quince años en las ventas, el cual ha venido cambiando de productos y obtener otras mejoras para el bien comun de la familia, hoy en día tiene una pulpería y la venta de tortilla.
Teniendo el apoyo moral y económico de su esposo e hijos quienes le ayudan en la venta, también atreves del financiamiento en Afodenic ha logrado el aumento de inventario, lo que ha tenido mejores ventas al ofertar variedad de productos.
Lo que quiere invertir es en compra de tres quintales de maíz, carbón, bolsones de papel, y la compra de una vitrina de vidrio para exhibir mas sus productos, ya que ha venido comprando, teniendo en mejores higiene sus ventas. Siendo para ella de gran provecho esta alternativa del préstamo.
texts.en:
María set up her small business, with more than 15 years experience of working in sales.  Over time, she has changed the products that she sells and made other improvements for the common good of her family.  She currently owns a grocery store and a tortilla business.

María has the moral and financial support of her husband and children who help her in making her sales.  Through loans from Afodenic, she has managed to increase her inventory which has resulted in better sales as she now offers a variety of products.

María would like to invest in buying three 100lb bags of corn, coal, paper bags and a glass display case to display more of her products.  She has been buying products and keeping her sales merchandise in better, more hygienic conditions.  This loan will be very helpful to María.

loans.use: to buy corn and coal to increase her tortilla sales.  She will also buy a display case for displaying more products

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
La señora Margot es socia del banco comunal Las Fresitas del  Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 21 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo.
Es socia de Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años, brinda servicio de vulcanizado, su negocio se encuentra en uno de las calles más transitadas de la ciudad, el trabajo lo realiza junto a su esposo, y como no tiene con quien dejar a su pequeño también lo llevan con ellos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, comprará  24 cámaras para autos, 2 cajas de rodajes, 10 llantas, 1 paquete de parches fríos, 1 litro de pegamento, 10 metros de cabes, 1 juego de llaves.
Está comprando estos productos debido a que el servicio que brinda demanda también el cambio de algunas partes o accesorios, de esta forma también tiene una ganancia a parte de lo que cobra por el servicio.
La señora Margot muchas veces también tiene que meter la mano (como se dice) para que los clientes no tengan que esperar, gracias a Manuela Ramos ha permitido que su negocio prospere y genere ingresos suficientes para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Margot is a member of the communal bank "Las Fresitas" in the Calleria district of the department of Ucayali.  She is 21 years old, married, and has one child.

She has been a member of Manuela Ramos for 3 years.  She has a tire repair business located on one of the busiest streets of the city where she works with her husband.  Because they don't have anyone who they can leave their child with, they bring him to work.

With this new loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles, she will buy 24 inner tubes for automobiles, 2 boxes of wheels, 10 tires, a bundle of cold patches, a liter of glue, 10 meters of cables and a set of keys.

She will buy these products because there is demand for the services that she provides.  She also sells spare parts and accessories, because in this way she can generate earnings from what she charges for these items.  

Margo also at times has to do the repairs so that her customers don't have to wait.  Thanks to Manuela Ramos, her business is prospering and is generating enough income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy tires, inner tubes and wheels

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Fortaleza, tiene 60 años y solicita un préstamo para invertir en su negocio D. agricultura. Ella venD. verduras y cría cuyes. Está casada y tiene cinco hijos, uno D. ellos ha estudiado en la universidad. 
Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. FINCA Perú Juana amplio su negocio. Con su crédito D. ahora ella va a invertir en tractoreo, peones, mantenimiento y en galpones D. cuy.  Juana empezó el negocio hace 10 años, junto a su esposo.  Gracias a la ayuda D. FINCA Perú ella siempre este contenta porque le va bien en su negocio.  D. las capacitaciones que ofrece FINCA Perú ella ha aprendido D. autoestima.  Sus sueños son siempre poder mejorar y aumentarle a su negocio, le gustaría empezar a criar chanchos y ovinos.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the community bank Fortaleza.  She is 60 years old and is requesting a loan to invest in her farming business.  She sells vegetables and raises guinea pigs.  She is married and has five children, one of them has attended the university.
She used the first loan from FINCA Peru to enlarge her business.  The current loan will be used to buy tractors, hire laborers, do maintenance and get sheds for guinea pigs.  Juana started her business 10 years ago with her husband.  Thanks to the help from FINCA Peru, she is always happy because her business is doing well.  The training that FINCA Peru offers has given her self esteem.  Her dreams are always to be able to grow and improve her business.  She would like to start raising hogs and sheep.

loans.use: to invest in tractors, laborers, maintenance and guinea pig sheds.

loans.name: Reforma 1-4 Group

texts.en:
Maria S. is one of the members of her group named La Reforma 1 to 4. This is a large group made up of twenty businesswomen and businessmen, dedicated to doing business all over their rural community, which is a batey (company town) between sugar cane fields outside San Pedro de Macoris. She has a long term partner and is a mother with seven children, all living with her in a simply structured home in a rural villa where many Haitian families live every day, working and fighting to have a better future. Maria S. is one of these women and men, doing business to improve her family's standard of living.

For about eight years, Maria S. has been operating her fried food stand and her comedor (a kind of local restaurant for lunch). She has improved her business with every loan she has taken with Esperanza. This is her 9th loan. She plans to use this loan to buy rice, meat, seasoning, vegetables, flour, cooking oil, etc.  Maria S. operates two food businesses. One is for breakfast and dinner (a fried food stall, where she sells chicken, meat, sausages, plantain, fried dough, etc), and the comedor, which is like a home restaurant where many people from the community come to have lunch.

She plans to continue to enjoy cooking and serving in her businesses. Another favorite thing to do is to be at her home with her family. Her story is generally representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. 

Note: There is more than one group picture in order to present as many visible faces as possible.

loans.use: to buy, rice, meat, seasoning, vegetables, flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Fortaleza, tiene 33 años y solicita un préstamo para su negocio de venta de golosinas que vende en su tienda y por teléfono. Ella no está casada y es madre y padre para sus cuatro hijos de 16, 13, 10 y 3 años de edad. Gloria uso el primer préstamo que recibió de FINCA Perú para aumentar su mercadería. Va invertir el crédito que recibirá ahora para empezar la venta de ropa interior en su tienda. La venta de golosinas es un negocio de familia, y ella decidió abrir su propia tienda para poder ayudar a sus hijos económicamente, ya que como madre soltera necesitaría una base fuerte de dinero.
texts.en: Gloria is a member of the communal bank "Fortaleza."  She is 33 years old and is requesting a loan for her business; she sells candy from her home and over the phone.  She is not married and serves as both mother and father for her 4 children aged 16, 13, 10 and 3.  Gloria used the first loan that she received from FINCA Peru to increase her merchandise.  She is going to invest the loan that she will receive next to start selling undergarments from her store.  The candy business is a family business, and she decided to open her own store so that she could help her children financially, since as a single mother she needs a reliable source of income.

loans.use: to buy undergarments

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Fortaleza, tiene 40 años, solicita un préstamo para invertir en su negocio de agroquímicos y veterinaria.  Ella es madre soltera de su hijo de ocho años que esta en el tercer grado.  El primer préstamo que recibió de FINCA Perú lo utilizó para aumentar de capital. También estará usando este crédito para el aumento de capital, y para empezar en la siembra de papa. Julia estudio ingeniería química, y vio la necesidad en el campo de agroquímicos, entonces decidió abrir su propio negocio cuando nació su hijo. Desde que comenzó con FINCA Perú ella pudo trabajar y cuidar a su hijo al mismo tiempo, ya que su negocio estaba en su casa. Ahora que su hijo es más grande va poder poner a alguien a cargo del negocio en casa para poder salir a trabajar.  Lo que más le gusta de FINCA Perú son sus amigas, las reuniones y la distracción que le da de su vida diaria.  También le gusta el hecho de que FINCA Perú la ha ayudado a ahorrar, y que gracias a ese ahorro va a poder comprar su carro.  Las capacitaciones que ofrece FINCA Perú le han enseñado sobre la violencia familiar y como prevenir que le afecte su vida.  El mes de Enero, Febrero y Marzo es época baja para su negocio, y está tratando de buscar una manera de reemplazar su negocio durante esa época.
texts.en:
Julia, 40, is a member of the village bank Fortaleza. She is requesting a loan to invest in her agrochemical and veterinary business. She is a single mother of an 8 year old son who is in the third grade. The first loan that she got from FINCA Peru was used to increase her capital. She will also use this loan to increase her capital and to begin planting potatoes. 

Julia studied chemical engineering and saw a need in the field of agrochemistry, so she decided to open up her own business when her son was born. Since she started working with FINCA Peru she's been able to work and take care of her son at the same time, because her business was based in her home. Now that her son is older she will be able to have someone else take care of the business at home so that she can leave to work. 

What she likes most about FINCA Peru are her friends, the meetings and the distraction from her daily life. She also likes the fact that FINCA Peru has helped her to save, and thanks to those savings she will be able to buy a car. The trainings that they offer have taught her about familial violence and how to keep it from affecting her life. The months of January - March are the slow season for her business and she is trying to find a way to replace her business during that period.

loans.use: to buy agrochemical products.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es: Saturnina es socia del Banco Comunal Fortaleza, tiene 58 años y solicita un prestamo para invertir en su negocio de canchas, que vende al por mayor y por menor. Ella está casada y tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad.  Específicamente estará usando el primer crédito para comprar ingredientes para las canchas.  Aprendió a hacer canchas con su esposo hace  40 años.  Desde que comenzó con FINCA Perú su negocio y su vida ha mejorado.  Lo que más le gusta de FINCA Perú son las reuniones con los amigos.  De las capacitaciones que ofrece FINCA Perú, Saturnina ha aprendido a ser responsable y puntual.
texts.en: Saturnina, 58, is a member of the Fortaleza village bank. She is requesting a loan to invest in her cancha business [a snack of toasted corn], which she sells in bulk and individually. She is married and has four grown children. Specifically she will buy ingredients to make the canchas. She learned to make canchas with her husband 40 years ago. Since she joined FINCA Peru her life and her business have improved. What she likes most about FINCA Peru are the meetings with her friends. From the trainings that they offer, Saturnina has learned to be responsible and punctual.

loans.use: to invest in her business making canchas [a snack of toasted corn].

loans.name: 14 De Junio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “14 DE JUNIO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Aurora. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura de polleras, venta de frutas, venta de comida, venta de refrescos, venta de ropa interior, venta de coca, venta de arroz.

La señora Aurora, indica que es la primera vez  que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que ingreso por invitación de la promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de polleras, que viene trabajando hace once años atrás,  aprendiendo el mismo de su tía que antiguamente realizaba esta actividad.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra tela (aumentar capital). Este producto los comprará por mayor de la calle Max Paredez, posteriormente cuando ya estén elaborados los productos los venderá a pedido en diferentes tiendas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.
texts.en:
The group "14 de Julio" will begin their first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the focal center Alto Lima. The group has 8 members and a board of directors headed by Aurora. The members have varied businesses including making traditional skirts, selling fruit, selling food, selling sodas, underwear sales, coca leaf sales and selling rice. 

Aurora says this is the first time that she has worked with Pro Mujer and that she joined at the invitation of the promoter. Currently she has a business sewing traditional Andean skirts. She has been doing this for 11 years, learning from her aunt who used to do the same thing.

The loan that she will take out now is to buy fabric (increase capital). She will buy the fabric in bulk on Max Paradez street. Once the skirts are made she will sell them by request to different stores. This work allows her to generate income to support her family, since she is married and has two children.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Kamirpata Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento Kamirpata,  esta conformado por un grupo de señoras que  viven en su mayoría en L. zona de kamirpata (alto achachicaL.) y se dedican al comercio minorista y otras actividades laborales,  L. presidenta es L. señora Daría se dedica al arreglo de refrigeradores en su taller de refrigeración de L. ciudad de el alto tiene tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar  y vive en L. casa de sus papas ha sido elegida en L. directiva por sus compañeras por ser una de las socias que asiste a todas las reuniones  y ha sido L. coordinadora en el grupo para su conformación además de ser un apersona responsable y trabajadora, con el dinero del crédito comprara herramientas para su taller de refrigeración  ya que las que tiene ya están descompuestas, el deseo de L. Sra. Daria es el de poder ver un día a sus hijos profesionales y personas de bien es muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con L. institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The entrepreneur's bank Kamirpata is made up of a group of women who mostly live in the Kamirpata zone (AchachicaL. Heights) and work as small merchants and other trades. The president, Daria, fixes refrigerators in her refrigeration workshop in the city of El Alto. She has three school-aged children and lives in her parents' house. She has been chosen to be on the board by her peers because she is one of the members that attends all of the meetings and has coordinated the group during its formation, in addition to being a hardworking and responsible person. 

With the money from the loan she will buy tools for her refrigeration workshop because the ones that she has are falling apart. Daria wants to one day see her children be professionals and well-off. She is very hardworking and is grateful to the institution for the support it has given her.

loans.use: to buy tools for her refrigeration workshop.

loans.name: Sant Yalla Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé le 27/06/2008.IL est composé de 17 membres issus du meme quartier.
Elles ont pour activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Rokheyatou à l’extrême droite,est responsable du groupement.Elle a pour domaine d'activité la vente de poisson.

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience de cette activité pour l'avoir exercer depuis plus de 02 ans.

Son prêt lui permettra de se ravitailler en poisson.

Son objectif est de construire sa propre maison et de s'occuper de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created on June 27, 2008. It is made up of 17 members who come from the same district. Their principal business is selling various small items. 

Madame Rokheyatou, on the far right, is the leader of the group. Her business is selling fish. She has a lot of experience in this activity as she has been working in this field for more than two years. Her loan will allow her to stock up on fish. 

Her goal is to build her own house and to see to the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Angoritas De Ingenio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANGORITAS DE INGENIO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Rosa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de mantas, venta de chantilin, tejido de bitles, producción de pelotas, producción de zapatos, venta de fruta

La señora Rosa, indica que es la primera vez  que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que ingreso por invitación de la promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido, que aprendió de una amiga.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra lana para tejer por mayor. Este producto los comprará por mayor de la Ceja y posteriormente elaborados los tejidos los venderá a pedido en diferentes puestos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y  tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The lending bank "Angoritas de Ingenio" will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the focal center Los Andes. It is made up of 8 members and is directed by a board headed by Rosa. The association members have varied businesses including: weaving tablecloths, selling cakes, weaving bridles, making balls, making shoes and selling fruit. 

Rosa indicates that it's her first time working with Pro Mujer and that she joined at the invitation of the promoter. Currently she has a weaving business, which she learned from a friend.

The loan that she will take out now is to buy wool for weaving in bulk. The bulk products will be bought in La Ceja, and once she makes the products she will take orders to sell them to different stalls. This work allows her to generate income to support her family. She lives with her partner and their two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Mireya Yancarla

texts.es: La señora Mireya dedicada al servicio de transcripciones en computadora, realiza este trabajo durante el día y algunos veces por la noche ya que en cualquier momento los estudiantes la visitan para pedirle sus servicios de transcripción e investigación, por el momento ella solo cuenta con una sola maquina, el deseo de la clienta es hacer crecer su negocio abriendo una librería tienda para así tener un poco mas de ingresos, sin embargo con las ganancia que obtiene ella realizando este servicio ayuda mucho con los gastos en su hogar, de esta manera solicito el crédito para poder abrir una pequeña librería y ahí poder también ofrecer sus servicios de transcriptora, es un apersona joven y muy amable, agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que ella quiere emprender con este negocio.
texts.en:
Mireya provides computer transcription services. She works during the day and sometimes at night because students come to her at all hours asking for her transcription and research services. Right now she only has one computer. She wants to grow her business by opening a book store so that she can have some more income. The money that she makes right now helps a lot with the costs of her home. 

She asked for a loan to be able to open a small bookstore and to offer her transcription services there. She is young and very friendly, and is grateful to the institution for the support that it has given her in starting this new business.

loans.use: to start a book store.

loans.name: Sope Naby Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé le 27/06/2008.Il est composé de 18 membres.

Leur principale activité est le commerce.
Celle  qui est à l’extrême droite de la photo est responsable du groupement.Elle a pour activité principale: la couture.

Elle possède une bonne expérience de cette activité pour avoir eu à la pratiquer durant le passé.  

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter en quantité suffisante des tissus de plusieurs variétés afin de satisfaire sa clientèle.

Son objectif est d'acheter une maison et d'accroitre la rentabilité de son activité
texts.en:
This group was created on June 27, 2008. It is composed of 18 members. Their principal activity is petty commerce.

The lady on the far right of the photo is the leader of the group. Her principal activity is sewing. She has a good deal of experience in this business since she has been in it in the past. Her loan will allow her to buy a sufficient quantity of various sorts of cloth  so that she can satisfy the needs of her clientele. 

Her goal is to buy a house and to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her sewing business.

loans.name: Karambenor Group

texts.fr:
