Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 07 juin 2011. Il est  constitué de trente six femmes qui habitent le même village. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Juliette qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 36  ans. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants.

Elle s’active dans la vente de poisson fumé. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et d'acheter plus de marchandises (poisson fumé) afin de mieux développer  son petit commerce.

Les profits générés par son activité lui permettront de participer à l’améliorer des conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on June 7, 2011. It is made up of 36 women who live in the same village. Their primary activity is petty commerce. 

Madame Juliette, who is on the right in the photo raising her hand, is the leader of the group. She is 36, married, and the mother of six children.

Her business is selling smoked fish. She has a good deal of experience in this field as she has been doing this work for several years. 

This loan will permit her to bolster her working capital and buy more merchandise (smoked fish) so that she can expand her little business. The profit she generates through her business will allow her to help improve living conditions for her family (health, food, clothing, etc.) and put aside more in savings.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish.

loans.name: Diog Liggeey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 07 juin 2011. Il est compsé de trente femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Khady qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 62 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants. Elle a aussi en charge deux autres enfants confiés par ses proches.

Elle s’active dans la vente de pâte d'arachide. 

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital pour acheter plus d'arachides afin d'augmenter sa production de pâte.

Les profits lui permettront de soutenir son mari pour l’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was established on June 7, 2011.  It is made up of thirty women who live in the same neighborhood.  Their main business if petty trading.  Madam Khady who is to the right of the photo, raising her hand, is the leader of the group.  She is 62 years old.  She is married and the mother of six children.  She also cares for two children of close relatives.  She stays busy selling peanut butter.  

This loan will allow her to strengthen her capital in order to purchase peanuts in order to increase her production of peanut butter.  The profits will allow her to support her husband in improving the quality of life (health, nutrition, clothing, etc...) of her family and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts.

loans.name: Elia Mariella

texts.es: Elia Mariella tiene 39 años, Ella tiene la venta de mercadería en general pues sale  todos los días a vender productos y en su vivienda. Donde ofrece una gran variedad de productos como toallas, sabanas, cosméticos, calzado y bisutería.  Atiende todos los días en su vivienda, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche ya que demás sale los fines de semana a visitar a sus clientes. A pesar de las dificultades que ha enfrentado a salido adelante. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima. Sus metas son tener una gran tienda localizada en el mercado.
texts.en: Elia Mariella is 39 years old. She sells general merchandise. Every day she goes out to sell her products or sells them from her home, where she offers a great variety of products such as towels, sheets, cosmetics, footwear, and costume jewelry. She tends her shop in her house every day from 7 in the morning until 9 at night, and she also goes out to visit her customers on weekends. She has made progress in spite of the difficulties that she has encountered. The loan is to buy her basic materials. Her goal is to have a large store located in the market.

loans.use: to buy towels, sheets, cosmetics, footwear, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Amapolas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMAPOLAS” iniciará su cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora sabina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de mantas, tejido de gorras, venta e chocolates, tejido de chompas, carpintería, tejido de awayos, confección de deportivos, tejido en máquina.

La señora Sabina, indica que hace tres años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que ingreso por que formaron grupo en zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de carpintería que inicio hace diez años; este negocio lo aprendió ayudando a su padre.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de madera por mayor. Este producto los comprará de la barraca y posterior a la elaboración lo venderá en la Feria 16 de Julio los días jueves y domingo, con la ayuda de su esposo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y  tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The lending group "Amapolas" will begin its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the focus center  Los Andes. The group is made up of 7 members and is directed by a board headed by Sabina. The members have varied businesses including: weaving cloths, weaving hates, selling chocolates, weaving sweaters, carpentry, weaving awayos (traditional cloths), making athletic shoes, and machine weaving.

Sabina has worked for Pro Mujer for three years and joined because they were starting the group in her area. Currently she has a carpentry business which she began 10 years ago. She learned the trade from her father.

The loan that she will take out now is to buy wood in bulk. She will buy them from the large storage stall and after making the products she will sell them in the 16 de Julio market on Thursdays and Sundays, with the help of her husband. This work allows her to generate income to support her family. She lives with her common-law husband and they have two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she reponsds that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Oulara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 07 juin 2011. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Henriette qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de trois enfants. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de citron et de savon en poudre. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car elle la pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital afin de faire la promotion de son activité.

Les profits lui permettront de participer à l’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…).
texts.en:
This solidarity group was established on June 7, 2011.  It is made up of ten women who live in the same neighborhood.  Their primary business is petty trading.  Madam Henriette, who is at the right of the photograph, raising her hand, is the group leader.  She is 36 years old.  She is a widow and the mother of three children.  She sells lemons and powdered soap.  She has much valuable experience in the business, having practiced it for many years.

This loan will allow her to strengthen her capital in order to promote her business.  The profits will allow her to participate in the improvement of her family's quality of life (health, nutrition, clothing, etc...).

loans.use: to buy lemons and powdered soap.

loans.name: Creando Futuro Group

texts.es:
Éste banco comunal se llama “Creando Futuro”, está conformado por 18 emprendedores, pertenecientes a la comuna de Independencia, ciudad de Santiago. Todos ellos se dedican al rubro del comercio, vendiendo comida rápida, ropa de segunda mano, lanas, ropa de bebé, artículos escolares, frutas y servicio de costuras. 
Ximena quien en la foto se encuentra de pie, al lado derecho del grupo, se destaca porque usa su cabello corto y su color es castaño claro, en ésta fotografía sólo aparece su rostro. Ella se dedica a la producción y venta de sopaipillas, empanadas, arrollados, té y café. Realiza éste oficio desde hace 2 años, vendiendo en una feria libre los días martes y viernes y los fines de semana instala su negocio en un persa (feria libre más grande).
Durante la temporada primavera verano Ximena se dedica a la producción y venta de jugos tropicales, para esto compra frutas dos días a la semana, para abastecerse con insumos. Durante ésta temporada de invierno Ximena compra su mercadería en comercios donde el costo de insumos es más conveniente.
Con el crédito comprará un carro más grande, por lo que necesita renovar la infraestructura y que éste sea más grande. Ésta inversión la realizará junto a su marido, ya que él también necesita de éste para trasladar su mercadería, ya que  trabaja en una feria libre vendiendo otro tipo de productos. Éste nuevo carro además le permitirá acceder a un permiso para vender sus productos sin dificultad. 
Ximena vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijas, una de ellas los apoya con las ventas en sus negocios los fines de semana. Sus sueños son brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad socioeconómica y a sus hijas en su educación.
Ximena asiste generalmente a cursos de perfeccionamiento, el último de ellos fue un curso de peluquería y en la actualidad realizará un curso de computación. Su motivación de aprender y conocer se debe a que Ximena anhela incursionar en el futuro en un negocio más estable. 
Ximena está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo esperanza en cuanto a las capacitaciones y crédito.
Independencia es una de las 34 comunas que componen la ciudad de Santiago (capital de Chile), ubicada en el sector centro-norte. Surgió a fines del siglo XIX como un sector tradicional de la ciudad. Su eje principal es la Av. Independencia, por la cual pasaba el antiguo Camino del Inca, puerta de entrada por el norte, a la ciudad de Santiago. Dada su amplia población indígena, en Independencia se encuentra el Centro Cultural Indígena de Chile. Cuenta también con importantes construcciones históricas, entre ellas 6 monumentos históricos de Chile.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called “Creando Futuro” (Creating the Future) and consists of 18 entrepreneurs. They are from the community of Independencia in the city of Santiago. All of them engage in businesses such as trade, selling fast food, selling used clothing, selling wool, selling baby clothes, selling school supplies, selling fruit, and offering sewing services.

In the photograph, Ximena is one of the women standing on the right side. She has short brown hair, but only her face is visible in the photo. Ximena prepares and sells sopapillas, empanadas, rolls, tea, and coffee. She has been in this business for two years. Ximena sells at an open market on Tuesdays and Thursdays. On the weekends, she has a business set up at a “persa” (a large fair).

During the spring and summer seasons, Ximena makes and sells tropical juices. To do this, she buys fruit twice a week so that she can stock her inventory. In the winter, Ximena buys her merchandise at stores because the cost of supplies is more affordable. With this loan, she will buy a larger cart. She needs to renovate the infrastructure of her business, and this cart will give her more space. Ximena is making this investment with her husband because he plans to use it to move his merchandise. He works at the open market selling other types of products. This new cart will allow her to obtain a permit so that she can sell her products without difficulty.

Ximena lives with her husband and two daughters. One of her daughters helps her on the weekends with generating sales for her business. She dreams of improving her family’s socioeconomic status and providing her daughters with an education.

Ximena has a perfect attendance record at the training seminars. The last course she took was in hairstyling and now she is enrolled in a computer course. Her motivation to learn and expand her knowledge will help her have a more stable business in the future. She is very pleased and grateful for the support that Fondo Esperanza has provided through the training classes and the loans.

Independencia is one of 34 communities that make up the city of Santiago, the Chilean capital. It is located in the north-central section. Independencia emerged in the late nineteenth century as a traditional section of the city. The main thoroughfare is Independencia Avenue, which intersects with the old Inca Trail, the gateway to the north and to the city of Santiago. Given the growing indigenous population, Independencia became the Indigenous Cultural Center of Chile. It also has major historical buildings, including six Chilean historical monuments.

loans.use: to purchase a large vending cart.

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.en:
Maria Lucia, 42, is a member of a band called "Roland's Band" in Otavalo, Ecuador. She is seeking an individual loan, but is pictured with the other members of her band. Maria Lucia plans to use her loan to purchase an audio amplifier for her band's performances. 

She is married and has five children, aged 22, 20, 18, 13 and 11. She is a humble person who desires to overcome personal and socioeconomic obstacles. "Roland's Band" began as a hobby because Maria Lucia's son enjoyed music. Three of her sons are now members of the band. She reports that her business is going very well and that there is demand for "Roland's Band" to perform every weekend. Her dreams are for her band to record their music and continue moving forward with her children and husband. 

Maria Lucia reports that there is competition in her line of work, but she does not have a problem with that because she gets along well with her children and her husband and their musical business.

loans.use: to buy an audio amplifier for her band

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 34 años de edad convive con oscar  de 32, con quien tiene dos bellas hijas que, son los regalos mas preciados que lo pudiera haber dado la vida, y por quienes esta dispuesta a  luchar y dar la vida si es que fuera posible. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicado en el centro poblado de natividad del distrito de Pichari. Cuando hace 20 años el país atravesaba un crisis social,  rosa aún era una niña de 14 años y en ese tiempo perdió a sus padres, por lo que dejó los estudios y tuvo que trabajar como empleada del hogar  para poder sobrevivir, especializándose en la preparación de comidas. Hoy se ha convertido en su fuente de ingresos económicos, es así que prepara diversos potajes, por lo que sus clientes no dudan en ir a consumir uno de ellos. Día a día trabaja y crea nuevos platos,  dándoles a sus comensales un trato amable y cordial deseándoles un pronto retorno. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP por lo que espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar con la preparación de comida. Rosa  es una mujer que le pone ese entusiasmo y espíritu de emprendedor en su banco comunal. Con los tres mil nuevos soles comprará utensilios de cocina y mejorar el ambiente de su restaurante.
texts.en:
Rosa is 34 years old and in a common-law marriage with Oscar, age 32. They have two beautiful daughters who are the most precious gifts she has in life and for whom she is willing to fight and provide the best life possible. Rosa and her family live in their own home in the central village of Natividad in the District of Pichari. Twenty years ago, when the country was enduring a social crisis, Rosa was 14 years old when she lost her parents. She had to quit school and work as a housekeeper in order to survive. As part of her job, she learned how to prepare food and now she uses that skill to earn an income. Rosa prepares different dishes and her customers do not hesitate to try at least one of them. She works every day and creates new dishes. Rosa provides her customers with friendly service in hopes that they will return soon.

This is her second loan with MFP. She hopes that everyone will support her so that she can continue preparing her food. Rosa is an enthusiastic woman and a spirited entrepreneur in her Communal Bank. Her loan of 3000 PEN will be used to buy cooking utensils and pay for improvements to the ambience of her restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase cooking utensils and to make improvements to her restaurant.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es:
Anabel de 18 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Se caracteriza por ser una zona de mucha actividad agrícola, ganadera, turístico y artesana.

Anabel se dedica  a la crianza de ganado porcino (cerdos) desde hace varios años, su corral donde se encuentran sus ovejas está en la parte posterior de su casa.  A sus animales los engorda con alimentos balanceados  y una  vez que tengan el peso y el tamaño óptimo las ofrece en el mercado de la zona donde vive, con el dinero que va adquirir por sus cerdos podrá atender sus necesidades personales.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales, con los ingresos que obtenga en ambas actividades podrá pagar el crédito otorgado y mejorará su calidad de vida.  Anabel es conocida en la zona por ser una persona trabajadora, responsable y desea más adelante poder realizar estudios superiores y poder ayudar a sus padres económicamente.
texts.en:
Anabel, 18, is single and lives with her parents in a house with electricity only in the district of Tambogrande which belongs to the department of Piura.  It is an area with a lot of agriculture, livestock farming, tourism and craft activity.

Anabel has been in the business of raising pigs for several years.  She gives them balanced feed and once they are fully developed takes them to the market in her area.  With the income she earns from the pig sales she covers her personal expenses.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced animal feed.  With the income from her business she can pay back the loan and improve her lifestyle.  Anabel is known in the area a being a hard-working, responsible person.  In the future she wants to continue her education and help her parents economically.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Melisa Nelva

texts.es:
Melisa es socia del Banco Comunal Fortaleza, tiene 19 años y solicita un préstamo para invertir en su negocio de papa seca y cereales. Melisa tiene una hija de un año y 11 meses.
El primer préstamo que recibió lo invirtió en cereales y animales en el mercado (que vendió por kilo).  Desde que Melisa y su mamá empezaron con FINCA Perú sus vidas han superado enormemente. Su madre se retiró hace dos años pero convenció a Melisa que ingresara a FINCA Perú.
Su sueño para el negocio son tener su propia casa y darle buena educación y alimentación a su hija.
texts.en:
Melisa is a member of the Communal Bank “Fortaleza” (Strength). She is 19 years old and requesting a loan to invest in her business of selling dried potatoes and grain. Melisa has a daughter who is a year and eleven months old.

This is her first loan and the funds will be invested in grains and animals from the market that are sold by the kilo. After Melisa and her mother joined FINCA Peru, their lives have improved tremendously. Her mother retired two years ago, but she was responsible for convincing Melisa to join FINCA Peru.

Her dreams are to have a house of her own and to feed and educate her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase grains and animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials for replacing the roof of his house.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Fortaleza, tiene 67 años y solicita un préstamo para invertir en su negocio que es la venta D. flores. Ella está casada y tiene siete hijos que ya son mayores D. edad. El primer crédito que recibió lo utilizó para invertir en su negocio D. venta D. flores que ya lleva 28 años. El crédito que está recibiendo ahora lo utilizará para aumentar la mercadería D. su tienda D. abarrotes que solo lleva 3 meses, la cual implementó junto con la venta D. flores para poder tener mayores ingresos, es por ello que actualmente no solo venD. flores sino que tambien venD. otros productos. Lo que más le gusta a Isabel D. FINCA Perú es el apoyo y la ayuda que recibe D. sus amigas en el banco y D. FINCA Perú mismo. D. las capacitaciones que ofrece FINCA Perú ella ha aprendido como tratar a la familia y convivir sanamente con sus hijos. Sus sueños son sacar profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the Communal Bank “Fortaleza” (Strength).  She is 67 years old and requesting a loan to invest in her business of selling flowers.  Isabel is married and has seven adult children.  The first loan she received was invested in her flower business, which has been in operation for 28 years.  

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase the inventory of her grocery store which she just opened three months ago. She opened the grocery store to be able to have more income, and it is for this reason that she sells not only flowers but other products as well.  What Isabel enjoys most about FINCA Peru is the support she receives from her friends in her Communal Bank and the FINCA Peru staff.  The training classes offered through FINCA Peru have helped her learn how to deal with her family and live peacefully with her children.  

Her dreams incluD. seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Martha Olivia

texts.en:
Martha is 45 years old and lives in the city of San Gabriel with her younger children. Three of her children are older and are on their own. One of these children studies in Quito, the nation's capital. Her two younger children are in school. Martha is a hard-working person dedicated to raising pigs. She owns a small piece of land where she breeds and sells her pigs. As the number of animals she owns increases, Martha says she sees a better income and tries to give her children the best she can. 

She began her business with the help of a loan from FODEMI. In the past she had kept livestock, but upon the death of her parents she had to sell everything. She is seeking her second loan to buy and raise more pigs. She believes that this loan will help her family, because with the money she makes she wants to help her children study. Her goal is to continue to move her business forward and to see her children have professional careers.

loans.use: to buy and care for pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Maritza Reina

texts.es:
La Señora. Maritza es socia del banco comunal Renacientes, vive por el sector de la Feria Libre en la ciudad de Cuenca, a esta ciudad le hace hermosa su gente, su cultura, tradiciones, la belleza de su naturaleza y arquitectura, también es conocida como cuna de grandes deportistas, tiene una variada gastronomía que cautiva a propios y extraños.
 
Doña Maritza tiene 32 años, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 14, 11, 9 y 6 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus tres últimos hijos en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora Maritza trabaja realizando los quehaceres domésticos en una casa, actividad que la desempeña hace un año y labora solo medio día.
 
Después de algunos años se encuentra reingresando al banco comunal y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos de la maraca Yanbal como perfumes, cremas, bisutería y cosméticos para iniciar con le venta de este producto.
 
Su sueño es comprarse una casa.
texts.en:
Sra. Maritza is a member of the Communal Bank “Renacientes” (The Resurgents). She lives in the Feria Libre sector of the city of Cuenca. This city is beautiful because of its people, culture, traditions, natural settings, and architecture. It is also the birthplace of great athletes and has a variety of cuisines that captivate the palates of locals and foreigners.

Doña Maritza is 32 years old and a single mother of four children (ages 14, 11, 9, and 6). Her oldest child is in high school and the other three attend school in the city. She lives in a rental property since she does not own a home.

Sra. Maritza works as a housekeeper at a private home and has been in this job for a year and a half. She returned to the Communal Bank after being absent for a few years. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of Yanbal products such as perfumes, crèmes, trinkets, and cosmetics so that she can begin selling these items.

Her dream is to buy a house.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, crèmes, trinkets, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es: Emiliano tiene 50 años, es separado, vive con su hijo William en su casa propia  en el centro poblado de natividad del distrito de Pichari. Ante la separación con su esposa, por lo que solo tuvo que afrontar la vida solo y hacerse cargo de su hijo. Desde entonces se dedica a los negocios, donde posee un terreno agrícola y es ahí donde cultiva café y cacao. Por otro lado es dueño de un motel y por tal desea amueblarlo completamente para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, por tal razón pide un crédito a MFP para cumplir con su propósito. Este es su segundo empréstito  con MFP, por lo que esta agradecido y comprometido a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Emiliano es un hombre  solidario con todos los de su banco comunal. Con los 3.000 nuevos soles desea amueblara mejor su motel.
texts.en:
Emiliano is 50 years old, separated from his spouse, and lives in his own home with his son William in the central village of Natividad, District of Pichai. Having separated from his wife, he had to face life alone and take care of his son. Emiliano focuses on his businesses. He has a plot of farmland on which he grows coffee and cacao. Emiliano is also the owner of a motel and wants to completely furnish it so that he can offer the best service to his customers. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from MFP to accomplish his goal.

This is his second loan with MFP. For this reason, he is grateful and promises to be punctual with his payments. Emiliano is supportive of everyone in his Communal Bank. His loan of 3000 PEN will be used to buy furnishings to improve his motel.

loans.use: to purchase furnishings for his motel.

loans.name: Amistad Del Sur Group

texts.es: Amistad del sur es una asociación conformada por 9 socias ingresan en su segundo ciclo sin haber tenido problemas de pago en el anterior ciclo. Son personas que a la fecha han demostrado mucha responsabilidad con sus cuotas. Ellos se dedican a distintas actividades con lo que logran mantener a sus familias y para lo que requieren el préstamo, tal es el caso del Sr. Agapito actualmente presidente de la asociación, el se dedica al autotransporte, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos que a la fecha se encuentran en etapa escolar. Con el dinero del crédito realizara mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esta presentando algunas fallas y no le permite ofrecer un buen servicio,  Su máximo sueño es de poder comprarse su casita y así dejar de vivir en alquileres ya que es un gasto enorme,  muchos integrantes como el son personas trabajadoras por lo que agradecen la colaboración otorgada por la institución.
texts.en:
“Amistad del Sur” (Friendship of the South) is a Communal Bank that consists of nine members who are starting their second loan cycle. They did not experience any problems with repaying their previous loan. To date, the members have demonstrated great responsibility with their payments. They engage in different business activities in order to support their families. For this reason, they are requesting a loan.

Such is the case with Sr. Agapito. He currently serves as President of the Communal Bank. Agapito works in the transportation sector. He lives with his wife and two children who are attending school. The money from his loan will be used to maintain his vehicle, which is currently experiencing a few problems. This prevents him from offering good service. His greatest wish is to buy a small house because living in a rental property is an enormous expense.

Most of the members are hardworking individuals. They are grateful to be in a partnership with Emprender.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Mayra Soledad

texts.es:
La Señorita. Mayra es socia del banco comunal Renacientes, vive por el sector del Vergel en la ciudad de Cuenca, a esta ciudad le hace hermosa su gente, su cultura, tradiciones, la belleza de su naturaleza y arquitectura, también es conocida como cuna de grandes deportistas, tiene una variada  gastronomía que cautiva a propios y extraños.
 
La Señorita. Mayra es soltera tiene 20 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres a quienes les ayuda con  los gastos del hogar, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Nuestra socia labora como empleada domestica, trabaja de lunes a viernes solo medio día y el resto de su tiempo lo dedica a trabajar en el negocio familiar que es la fabricación artículos de hierro forjado.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de de materia prima como hierro, sueldas, pinturas, etc. para la fabricación de artículos en  hierro forjado.
 
Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Srta. Mayra is a member of the Communal Bank “Renacientes” (The Resurgents). She lives in the Vergel sector of the city of Cuenca. This city is beautiful because of its people, its culture, its tradition, its natural settings, and its architecture. It is also the birthplace of great athletes and has a variety of cuisines that captivates the palates of locals and foreigners.

Srta. Mayra is 20 years old and single. She lives at home with her parents and helps them with the household expenses. They live in a rental property since they do not own a home.

Mayra works as a housekeeper Monday through Friday, but only for half a day. She spends the rest of the time working at the family business which manufactures products made of forged iron.

Mayra is requesting her second loan from the Communal Bank. She will invest the funds in the purchase of raw materials such as iron, welding equipment, paints, and other items for making forged iron products. Her goal is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase iron, welding equipment, paints, and other items.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es: Damaris tiene 50 años su negocio es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 2 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella inicio por una vecina quien le ayuda a sacar adelante a su familia. Es una persona que no es la primera vez que ha trabajado en Fundación. El motivo de este crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, ropa variada actualmente la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan productos variados. El sueña con sobrevivir con su negocio que es su única forma de vida.
texts.en:
Damaris is 50 years old.  Her business is selling clothes and she has been in the business for more than two years.  She started through a neighbor who helps her to get her family ahead in life.

This is not the first time that Damaris has worked with Fundación Leon 2000.  She is requesting a loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts and a variety of clothes.  Currently, most of her customers are requesting a variety of products.  Damaris dreams of surviving with her business which is her only way of life.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts and a variety of clothes

loans.name: Lucila Luciana

texts.es:
La Señora Luciana es socia del banco comunal Renacientes, vive por el sector del Vergel en la ciudad de Cuenca, a esta ciudad le hace hermosa su gente, su cultura, tradiciones, la belleza de su naturaleza y arquitectura, también es conocida como cuna de grandes deportistas, tiene una variada gastronomía que cautiva a propios y extraños.
 
La Señora. Luciana tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos de 27, 24, 21, 20, 18, 15 y 6 años de edad, dos de sus hijos son casados e independientes, su segundo y cuarta hija trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su quinta hija estudia en el colegio y también trabaja, su sexta hija estudia en el colegio y su ultima hija en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico industrial, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Luciana labora en el taller de su esposo, fabrican artículos de hierro forjado como rejas, cruces y artesanías, llevan en esta actividad 20 años y trabajan de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materia prima como hierro, sueldas, pintura, etc. para el taller.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Luciana is a member of the Renacientes community bank.  She lives in El Vergel sector, in the city of Cuenca.  This city is made beautiful by its people, its culture, its traditions, and the beauty of its nature and architecture.  It is also known as the birthplace of important sports people.  It has a wide-ranging cuisine which captivates locals and visitors.

Luciana is 45 years old.  She has seven children aged 27, 24, 21, 20, 18, 15 and 6.  Two of her children are married and live independently.  Her second and fourth daughters work and help her financially.  Her fifth daughter is in high school and also works.  Her sixth daughter is in high school and her youngest daughter is in elementary school in the city.  Her husband is an industrial mechanic by profession.  They do not own their own home but rent.

Luciana works in her husband's workshop.  They make products from wrought iron such as bars, crosses and handicrafts.  They have been in this business for 20 years and work from Sunday to Sunday.  They do not work fixed hours.

This is Luciana's second loan through her community bank which she was invited to join by a friend.  She will invest her loan money in buying raw materials such as iron, solder, paint, etc. for her workshop.  Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy iron, solder, paint, etc.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
La señora Rosaura es socia del banco comunal Ricardo Palma del Distrito Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 62 años D. edad, tiene 6 hijos D. los cuales solo uno está a su cargo, está casada y su esposo es maestro-jubilado.
Se dedica la venta D. prendas D. vestir y lleva 10 años trabajando con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos que han sido muy aprovechados por que ha sabido invertir en la compra D. más mercadería.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 12 polos para hombres, 10 camisas, 6 pantalones D. vestir, 6 pantalones jean, 6 polos para damas, 3 faldas y 12 blusas.
Su hija es la que le ayuda en su negocio cuando tiene que salir a repartir los pedidos o hacer algunas compras, también recibe el apoyo D. su esposo.
Está muy agradecidas por la confianza y los préstamos recibidos.
texts.en:
Rosaura is a member of the 'Ricardo Palma' community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 62 years old and has six children, only one of whom is in her care.  Rosaura is married and her husband is a retired teacher.

Rosaura sells clothes.  She has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for 10 years and they have been very useful because she has invested them in buying more merchandise.  She will use her new loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy 12 men's polo shirts, 10 shirts, 6 pairs of dress pants, 6 pairs of jeans, 6 women's polo shirts, 3 skirts and 12 blouses.

Rosaura's daughter helps her in her business when she has to go out and deliver orders or make some purchases.  She also has the support of her husband.  Rosaura is very grateful for the trust that has been placed in her and the loans that she has received.

loans.use: to buy a variety of men's and women's clothes

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La señora Josefina es socia del banco comunal Las Gemas, del Distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo.
Durante los tres años que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos ha podido poner su negocio de venta de bebidas gaseosas, agua mineral y cerveza, su negocio está ubicado en un ambiente de su propia casa, su esposo le ayuda con la atención a los clientes cuando se encuentra en casa.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,300.00 nuevos soles comprará: 10 cajas de gaseosas, 3 paquetes de agua mineral y 20 cajas de cervezas. 
Su trabajo empieza por las tardes hasta las noche según cuantos clientes tenga, necesariamente tiene que desvelarse para poder tener mayor ganancia, tiene muchas ganas de seguir trabajando y agradece a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad que necesitaba para poder trabajar y sentirse útil en la vida.
texts.en:
Josefina is a member of the 'Las Gemas' community bank which is located in Yarinacocha district, in Ucayali department.  She is 38 years old, married, and has one child.

During the three years that she has been working with Manuela Ramos, Josefina has been able to establish her business selling soda, mineral water and beer.  Her business is located in her own home.  Her husband helps her to serve her customers when he is at home.

Josefina will use this new loan for 2,300 Peruvian soles to buy 10 crates of soda, 3 packets of mineral water and 20 crates of beer.  Josefina starts work in the afternoon and works until night-time, according to how many customers she has.  She has to stay awake late in order to be able to make more profits.

Josefina has a great desire to continue working and she is grateful to Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity that she needed to be able to work and feel useful in life.

loans.use: to buy soda, mineral water and beer

loans.name: Rosa Marina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Ricardo Palma del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos (solo uno está a su cargo).
Son 9 años que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos, Rosa se dedica a la confección de  lindísimas sabanas, que luego vende a muy buen precio porque utiliza materiales de calidad.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 20 metros  de telas floreadas y 30 metros de raso de diferentes colores para dar más vida a las sabanas.
En su casa tiene su pequeño taller donde trabaja mayormente por las tardes porque por las mañanas se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, todo el dinero del préstamo lo invierte comprando sus materiales de trabajo, porque sabe que después se va duplicar cuando venda sus productos.
"Manuela Ramos da muchas oportunidades a las mujeres que quieren salir adelante por medio de su trabajo".
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the 'Ricardo Palma' community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 48 years old, married, and has four children (only one of whom is in her care).

Rosa has been working with Manuela Ramos for nine years.  Her business is making beautiful sheets which she then sells for a very good price as she uses good-quality materials.

Rosa will use her new loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy: 20 meters of flowery material and 30 meters of different-colored satin to liven up her sheets.

At home, Rosa has a small workshop where she works mainly in the afternoons because in the mornings she takes care of her housework.  She will invest all of her loan money in buying materials for her work because she knows that she will double the money later when she sells her products.

"Manuela Ramos gives lots of opportunities to women who want to get ahead in life through their work".

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia es socia del banco comunal Ricardo Palma del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.
En los ocho años que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos ha podido abrir un pequeño negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de artículos de abarrotes.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 caja de leche, 1 paquete de harina, 3 casillero de huevos, 1 caja de aceite de medio litro, 1 bolsa de detergente, 1 bolsa de lejía en cojín, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz, 1 bolsa de fideo.
Todo su dinero lo invierte en su negocio para poder tener más productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, su esposo es profesor de profesión y también ayuda en la atención del negocio.
Manuela Ramos ha sido quien le dió la oportunidad de iniciar su negocio y le  agradece por ser quien confió en su sueño del negocio propio.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a member of the 'Ricardo Palma' community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 42 years old, married, and has three children.

During the eight years that she has been working with Manuela Ramos, Cecilia has been able to open her own small business selling groceries.

With her new loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy: 1 crate of milk, 1 packet of flour, 3 trays of eggs, 1 crate of half-liter bottles of oil, 1 bag of detergent, 1 bag of bleach, 1 sack of sugar, 1 sack of rice and 1 bag of noodles.

Cecilia invests all her money in her business so that she can offer more products to her customers.  Her husband is a teacher by profession and also helps serve in the business.

It was Manuela Ramos who gave Cecilia the opportunity to start her business and she is grateful to them for having faith in her dream of owning her own business.

loans.use: to buy milk, rice, sugar, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Willan

texts.en:
Willan is 18 years old and lives in the town of Tulcán on the Ecuador-Colombia border. He is single and lives with his parents. He is an enterprising person who "fights to earn my own income and get ahead". He is working toward having his own agricultural business in the future. With his first loan, Willan will invest in his crops. He hopes that he can earn enough so that he will be able to help his parents with household costs.

His goal for the future is to continue working in agriculture and to buy a small tract of land. In the photo, Willan is working in his fields.

loans.use: to invest in growing his crops

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Pioneras Dos Group

texts.es: Banco de emprendimiento nuevo  que se encuentra en su 1er ciclo,  integrado por 8 personas las cuales todos viven en la zona de la guardia  pero en distintos barrios, la Presidenta es Karen de 23 años de edad, vive en la comunidad de la Guardia por el barrio  hace ya 10 años, Su negocio es costurera  en la feria barrio lindo hace 5,  su estado civil soltera, por el momento se encuentra estudiando todavía no esta en sus planes de tener hijo, ya que con el trabajo y el estudio no puede, ella saco el crédito para la compra de tela y de una maquina que le están vendiendo en oferta. Los clientes están agradecidos con la entidad por confiar en ellos y apoyarlos cuando mas lo necesitan, están bastante conforme y alegres ya que justo era el día de la madre cuando se les desembolso y lo estaban necesitando.
texts.en:
This is a new community bank which is in its first loan cycle.  The group has eight members who all live in La Guardia district but in different neighborhoods.  The bank's president is 23 year-old Karen who has lived in the community of La Guardia for 10 years.  She is a seamstress and works in the Barrio Lindo market.  She has been in this business for five years.  Karen is single and she is studying at the moment.  She still has no plans to have children since she knows that she couldn't manage with her work and her studies.

Karen took out this loan to buy fabric and a sewing machine that she is being offered at a good price.  These clients are grateful to our institution for trusting in them and supporting them when they most need it.  They are happy and cheerful since it was Mother's Day when they received their loan and they needed it.

loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine that she is being offered at a good price

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila tiene 46 años, es casado con Juan de 48 años de edad, juntos tiene 04 hijos , viven en su casa propia en el centro poblado de natividad del distrito de Pichari. Cirila viene dedicándose a la venta de productos de primera necesidad desde hace 5 años y hasta ahora sigue con el mismo entusiasmo de siempre ya que su fin es darles a sus hijos una mejor alimentación, educación. Considera que este negocio le genera buena rentabilidad, por tanto procura siempre tenerla abastecida de variados productos. Es por ello que espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para cumplir con su objetivo. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que ella esta muy contenta y comprometida en cancelar sus cuotas. Cirila es una mujer solidaria y cumplida con los acuerdos de su banco comunal. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles Cirila incrementará de variados productos su bodega.
texts.en:
Cirila is 46 years old.  She is married to Juan, who is 48, and they have four children.  They live in their own home in the village of Natividad, in Pichari district.  Cirila's business is selling essential household products.  She has been in this business for five years and she continues working with the same enthusiasm she always has since her goal is to provide her children with better food and education.

Cirila considers this business to be quite profitable and so she always tries to keep it stocked with a variety of products.  She hopes to receive the support of each and every one of you in helping her to achieve her goal.

This is Cirila's first loan from MFP.  She is very happy and pledges to make her repayments on time.  Cirila is a very supportive member of her community bank who meets her obligations within the group.  She will use these 1,000 Peruvian soles to increase her stock with a variety of products.

loans.use: to buy products with which to stock her store

loans.name: Mercedes Martina

texts.es: Mercedes Martina tiene 35 años de edad, la señora tiene 2 años de tener este negocio pero es importante resaltar que esta actividad nació por la falta de empleo con el objetivo de ayudar a su familia ya que ella se dedica a lo que es librería. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio, ha logrado mejorar poco a poco y ofertar más productos a sus clientes. Este es su primer financiamiento que ella realiza es así poda comprar lápices, cuadernos, borradores, hojas, tarjadores y reglas es por eso que realiza este financiamiento.
texts.en: Mercedes Martina is 35 years old.  She has been in her business for two years.  It is important to highlight that she started her business because she couldn't find work and she started the business with the goal of helping her family.  Mercedes Martina's business is a stationery store.  She has owned her business for more than two years.  She has gradually managed to improve her business and offer more products to her customers.  This is her first loan and she will use it to buy pencils, composition books, erasers, paper, pencil sharpeners and rulers.

loans.use: to buy pencils, composition books, erasers, paper, pencil sharpeners and rulers

loans.name: Lila

texts.es:
La señora Lila es socia del banco comunal Mujeres triunfadoras del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.
Se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas y cervezas, ya inicio su negocio con el poco dinero que tenia.
Lleva dos años integrando la gran familia de Manuela Ramos. .
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará 10 cajas de cerveza, 5 cajas de gaseosas y 2 paquetes de agua mineral.
Su esposo trabaja manejando motocar (servicio de transporte) y no es mucho el dinero que trae a la casa pero sirve para solventar los gastos del día, sus hijos todavía son pequeños y necesitan atención de parte de sus padres. Está muy agradecida por la oportunidad brindada por Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Lila is a member of the "Mujeres Triunfadoras" community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 32 years old, married, and has two children.

Lila's business is selling soda and beer.  She started her business with a little money that she had.  She has been a member of the large Manuela Ramos family for two years.

Lila will use her new loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy 10 crates of beer, 5 crates of soda and 2 packets of mineral water.  Her husband works driving a car (offering a transport service) and he doesn't bring home much money but it is enough to cover their daily expenses.  Lila's children are still young and need their parents' attention.

Lila is very grateful for the opportunity Manuela Ramos has given her.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda and mineral water

loans.name: Xocotitlan Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Xocotitlan" ya que ese es el nombre del municipio en el que habitan y se sienten orgullosas, esta ubicado en el estado de México. Es un lugar de oportunidades ya que al ser municipio hay visita de personas de diferentes comunidades. El grupo esta conformado por 9 personas. La tesorera del grupo se llama Ana tiene 2 hijos estudio hasta la Secundaria, es casada, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y tiene un negocio establecido de abarrotes. El prestamo lo solicitá para la compra de articulos como lo son (refrescos, jugos, jabon entre otros), ya que ha tenido un incremento en sus ventas gracias al buen servicio que brinda se ha ganado la amistad y preferensia de sus vecinos de la comunidad. Al momento de solicitar el prestamo se siente satisfecha por el buen desempeño de su grupo y porque en conjunto con su esposo van a seguir trabajando para darle a sus hijos un buen futuro y una base para que ellos puedan ser independientes y logren una carrera profesional.
texts.en: This group is named "Xocotitlan", since this is the name of the town where it is and its members are proud of it. It is in the state of Mexico. This is a place of opportunity since people from different communities visit the town. The group is made up of 9 people. The treasurer of this group is named Ana, and she has 2 children. She studied through high school and is married. She sells groceries and has a small grocery store. She has asked for the loan to buy items such as sodas, juice, and soap, among others. She has had an increase in sales because she offers good service and has earned the friendship and preference of the residents of her community. At this time, she feels satisfied by her group's hard work and because together with her husband she is going to keep working to give their children a good future and a base for them to be independent and have professional careers.

loans.use: to buy items such as sodas, juice and soap, among others, for her convenience store.

loans.name: Tomas Larrea (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Tomas Larrea se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les sirve de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos mejoraran sus pequeños negocios.  Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comida entre otras actividades.

Aquí  tuvimos la oportunidad de dialogar con el Señor Mauricio, tiene 40 años de edad, está casado y tiene cuatro hijos de 15, 14, 12 y 9 años de edad, tres de ellos estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposa es ama de casa.

Él se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, el viaja cada quince días a la ciudad de Esmeraldas con la finalidad de vender sus productos por esa linda provincia, nos cuenta que es muy sacrificado su trabajo ya que tiene que dejar todo ese tiempo a su familia sola, pero a la vez comenta que tiene que hacerlo para poderles llevar el pan de cada día. Él para  surtir su negocio tiene que viajar hasta las ciudades de Guayaquil y Santo Domingo donde compra su mercadería. Lleva más de 20 años dedicado al comercio pues empezó desde muy joven.

Este crédito es para comprar camisetas, blusas, camisas, pantalones, ropa interior y ropa de niños para surtir a su negocio.

Sus  sueños  son tener un lugar fijo donde trabajar y vender sus productos dentro de la provincia para no dejar sola a su familia por sus viajes.

La foto pequeña adjunta es una de las socias que no pudo estar presente por motivos de trabajo cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
El Tomas Larrea community bank meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. This area is known for being very commercial, and for its traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo as well as for the cheerfulness of its people.  

This is a group of people who decided to get together and make this community bank. It serves them very well because with the loans the improve their small businesses. They work at different activities such as business, services, and selling food, among other things. 

Here we had a chance to talk to Mauricio, who is 40 years old. He is married and has four children, aged 15, 14, 12 and 9 years old. Three of them go to school and the youngest is in elementary school.

He is a merchant and sells clothes. He sells door to door, and travels every two weeks to the city of Esmeraldas in order to sell his products in that beautiful province. He tells us his job is very hard, since he has to leave his family alone a lot of the time, but that he has to do it to get them their daily bread. To supply his business, he has to travel to the cities of Guayaquil and Santo Domingo to buy his merchandise. . He has been a merchant for more than 20 years, since he started when he was very young. 

This loan is to buy t-shirts, blouses, shorts, pants, underwear and children's clothing, to supply his business.

His dream is to have a permanent locale where he can work and sell his products in the province and not have to leave his family to travel.   

The small photo included is of one of the members who couldn't be present when the photo was taken because of work.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, blouses, shirts, pants, underwear and children's clothing.

loans.name: Daisi

texts.es:
La señora Daisi es socia del banco comunal Ricardo Palma del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos.
En el tiempo que lleva trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos ha podido ayudar a su esposo, se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir (ropa), su esposo es docente y no gana mucho por eso nace su decisión de ayudarlo.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,800.00 nuevos soles comprará: 6 pantalones, 6 polos para damas, 12 blusas, 6 shores, 6 playeras, 6 ropas de baño, 6 pareos, 3 toallas. 
Ofrece sus productos al crédito y al contado, no es mucho lo que gana pero al menos puede solventar algunos gastos menores.  Está segura que con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos podrá hacer crecer su negocio.  Está tranquila porque no tiene que pasar apuros económicos gracias a su negocio y el apoyo de su esposo.
texts.en:
Daisi is a member of the Ricardo Palma communal bank of the District of Calleria, Ucayali department. She is 41 years old, married, and has 3 children.

During the time Daisi has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos she has been able to help her husband. She sells clothing. Her husband is a teacher and doesn't earn much. For that reason, she had the idea of helping out.

With this new loan of 1,800 new sols Daisi will buy 6 pairs of pants, 6 womens' polo shirts, 12 blouses, 6 shorts, 6 T-shirts, 6 bathing suits, 6 pareos, and 3 towels.

Daisi sells her products on credit or for cash; she doesn't earn much but at least she covers some minor family expenses.  She is sure that with loans from Manuela Ramos she will make her business grow. Daisi is content because she no longer has to suffer through economic crises, thanks to her business and the help of her husband.

loans.use: buy clothing for women and men to sell.

loans.name: Katy Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Katy es socia del banco comunal Ricardo Palma, del Distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 21 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo.
Su esposo es músico en una orquesta de la ciudad, recién lleva dos años trabajando con los  préstamos de Manuela Ramos, tiene una bodega que funciona en su propia casa y puede trabajar sin descuidar a sus hijos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 comprará: 1 caja de conservas, 1 caja de leche, 1 caja de aceite, 1 caja de condimentos, 2 kilos de ají especial,  1 paquete de ajino moto, 1 caja de galletas, 1 bolsa de orégano, 1 bolsa de detergente, 1 bolsa de legía.
Espera que más adelante Manuela Ramos pueda darle un mayor crédito para poder abastecer mejor su negocio, de esta forma puede generar ingresos que le permita apoyar en la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Katy is a member of the Ricardo Palma communal bank, in the district of Yarinacocha, Ucayali department. She is 21 years old, married, and has 1 son.

Her husband is a musician in an orchestra of the city. Katy has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for 2 years. Katy has a general store that operates from her own house where she can work without neglecting her child.

With this new loan of 1,500 new sols Katy will buy: 1 case of conserves, 1 case of milk, 1 case of cooking oil, 1 case of condiments, 2 kilos of special garlic, 1 package of ajino moto, 1 case of cookies, 1 sack of oregano, 1 sack of detergent, and 1 bag of legia.

Katy hopes that later, Manuela Ramos may provide a major loan so that she can better supply her business, and in this manner, generate income that will permit her to boost the household economy.

loans.use: buy groceries: preserves, cookies, detergent, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Teva

texts.es: Teva tiene 44 años, tiene 4 hijos de su primer esposo que falleció, ahora vive con su nueva paraje en su casa propia. Por más de 10 años siembra pastizales, que es sirve de forraje para sus animales, entre ellos vacas y toros que tiene en su establo. Asimismo cultiva papa y quinua, productos que tiene mucha demanda en el mercado  y por ello lo vende al por mayor. La mayor parte de su tiempo lo invierte en la ganadería  para alimentar a sus vacas de las cuales vende la leche que extrae y los toros una vez robustecido y son exhibidos en la feria ganadera de su localidad. Ante esto es que puede vivir y ofrecer bienestar a sus hijos, y por tal se siente orgullosa  ya que en todos estos años ella sola ha sostenido su hogar desde que su esposo falleció. En la actualidad concentrará sus esfuerzos en la compra de más animales para aumentar su capital de trabajo. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, de la cual se siente muy complacida de renovar  un crédito más que le permite mejorar. Por ello pide la colaboración de cada uno de ustedes para cumplir con su propósito. Con este dinero comprará un ternero y así aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Teva is 44 years old.  She has four children from her first husband who passed away.  She now lives with her new partner in her own home.

For more than 10 years, Teva has been growing pasture which serves as fodder for her animals which include cows and bulls that she keeps in her cow shed.  She also grows potatoes and quinoa: products which are in great demand in the market.  For this reason, she sells these products wholesale.

Teva invests most of her time in raising her cattle.  She feeds her cows and sells their milk.  Once her bulls have grown strong, she shows them at the cattle market in her town.  She does all this so that she can support her family and provide for her children's well-being.  She feels proud because during  the years since her husband passed away, she has supported her household single-handedly.

Teva will currently concentrate her efforts on buying more animals to increase her working capital.  This is her second loan from MFP and she feels very pleased to be renewing her loan as it will allow her to improve her business.  She is requesting the cooperation of each and every one of you in achieving her goal.  Teva will use this money to buy a calf and thereby increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Reyna es socia del banco comunal Las Trabajadoras De Manantay del Distrito de Manantay, Departamento De Ucayali. Tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.
Es dueña de una pequeña bodega, hizo una ampliación en su casa especialmente para su negocio, que viene surtiendo poco a poco, debido a que recién está subiendo en la escala de créditos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 de comprará: 1 caja de sopas instantáneas, 1 caja de ayudin pequeño, una tira de suavizante para ropa, 1 caja de azul para ropa, 1 caja de mayonesa, 1 caja de mermelada en sache, 1 caja de salsa de tomate, 1 bolsa de detergente pequeño, 1 caja de chicle, 1 caja de leche chica.
Su hija la ayuda mientras realiza los quehaceres de la casa.
"Haber empezado con ese negocio es una alegría porque más adelante crecerá y tendrá un multiservicio"... esa es la meta que se ha puesto.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por hacer que una parte de su sueño se haga realidad.
texts.en:
Reyna is a member of the "Las Trabajadoras" communal bank of Manatay, in the Manatay district of the department of Ucayali.  She is 41 years old, married, and has 3 children.

Reyna is the owner of a small store which is located in an extension of her house that was built especially for her business.  She has been stocking this store gradually, as she has recently been able to get bigger and bigger loans.

With this new loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy: a case of instant soups,  a case of small Ayudin cleaning products, fabric softener strips, a box of laundry bluing, a case of mayonnaise, a box of marmalade in plastic packets, a box of tomato sauce, a bag of small detergents, a box of gum and a case of small milks.  

Her daughter helps her with the store while she carries out the household tasks.

Reyna states that "to have started this business is a joy because in the future it will grow and I will have a fully stocked store" ... this is the goal she has set.  

She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for making part of her dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy detergents, milk, marmalade, candies, etc.

loans.name: Galet Emerita

texts.es:
La señora Galet es socia del banco comunal Las Trabajadoras De Manantay del Distrito De Manantay, Departamento De Ucayali. Tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos.
Son dos años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, Galet se dedica a la confección de sabanas y su esposo es trabajador independiente.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 12 metros de tela, 20 metros blonda ancha, 10 metros de elástico.
La confección de sus sabanas lo hace en su casa en horas de la tarde, porque en horas de la mañana realiza otras actividades, además de atender  sus hijos para que se vayan al colegio.
La difícil situación actual del país hace que las familias trabajen todos para  poder  pagar todos los gastos básicos del hogar, gracias a Manuela Ramos ha podido emprender un pequeño negocio para el bienestar de su familia.

Notese en la foto un intenso sol que dificulta la visibilidad.
texts.en:
Galet is a member of the “Las Trabajadoras de Manantay”  (The Workers from Manantay) Communal Bank in the Manantay District, Ucayali department.  She is 27 years old, married, and has two children.

She has been working with the loans from Manuela Ramos for two years.  She makes sheets, and her husband is an independent worker.

She will use the new loan for 1,000 soles to buy 12 meters of fabric, 20 meters of wide silk lace, and 10 meters of elastic.

She makes her sheets at home in the afternoon.  This is because she does other things in the morning, in addition to taking care of her children and getting them off to school.

The current difficult situation in the country makes everyone work in order to be able to pay all of the basic household expenses.  Thanks to Manuela Ramos she has been able to start a small business for her family’s well-being.

Note that in the photo the intense sunlight making it difficult to see.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Rutzi

texts.es:
La señora Rutzi es socia del banco comunal Las Bellas del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 45 años de edad y un hijo.
Son tres ciclos que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la venta de comida en un mercado de la zona y lo realiza en horas de la mañana, tiene que madrugar para poder tener la comida lista para atender a sus comensales.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 soles junto a unpequeño capital que tiene, comprará: 1 juego de ollas, 1 cocina, 1 balón de gas, 1 estante, servilletas, condimentos.
Todas éstas cosas le hacen falta para poder trabajar cómodamente.
Su trabajo queda lejos de su casa, pero tiene que trabajar para poder llevar de comer a casa, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de la localidad y casi no está con ellos.
Está tranquila porque trabaja para sacar adelante a su hijo que todavía está a su cargo, agradece a Manuela Ramos por la oportunidad de darle un pequeño capital  para iniciar su negocio
texts.en:
Rutzi is a member of the Las Bellas Communal Bank in the Calleria district, Ucayali department.  She is 45 years old, and she has one son.

She has been working with loans from Manuala Ramos for three cycles.  She sells food at a market in the area.  She does this in the morning hours.  She needs to rise with the sun in order to be able to have the food ready to take care of her customers.

She will use her new loan for 1,000 soles together with a little money that she has to buy a set of pots, a cooker, one tank of gas, a shelf, napkins, and condiments.  She needs all of these things to be able to comfortably work.

Her work is far from her house, but she has to work to be able to put food on the table.  Her husband works for a company in town, and he is hardly ever with them.

She is at peace because she works to get her son, who is still under her care, ahead.  She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the opportunity of giving her a small amount of capital to start her business.

loans.use: to buy a set of pots, a cooker, one tank of gas, a shelf, napkins, and condiments.

loans.name: Miguel Abdon

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Miguel desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) y aves de corral, su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que llegan a su crecimiento ideal los ofrece a los mismos pobladores de la zona o los vende en el mercado de Tambogrande, con los ingresos que obtenga solventará sus obligaciones familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más alimentos balanceados para tenerlos bien alimentados y así podrá ofrecerlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes para poder cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Miguel es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que sus  hijos tengan otras oportunidades de estudio.
texts.en:
Miguel, 36, lives with his wife and children in his own house which has electricity only.  It is located in the rural area of the district of Tambogrande which belongs to the department of Piura.  This area is active in agriculture, livestock farming and crafts.

For several years Miguel has been raising and selling sheep and chickens.  His farmyard is situated behind his house.  He gives the animals balanced feed and natural grains and once they are fully developed he sells them to other people living in the area or he takes them to market in Tambogrande.  He uses the earnings to take care of family expenses.

He has requested a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed for his animals' development so he can offer them at a better price to customers.  This will enable him to pay back the loan and improve his family's lifestyle.  Miguel is a hard-working, responsible person who only wants the best for his children and for them to get an education.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys  es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en  el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace varios años Gladys se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos, etc), su negocio lo ha colocado en el mercado de la zona donde vive, con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar su nivel de vida.  También cría y vende ganado caprino (cabras),las cuales vende una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo en los mercados de la zona.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes y para cubrir su préstamo.  Gladys es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Gladys, 37, lives with her husband and three children in her own house, which only has electricity.  It is located in the district of Tambogrande which belongs to the department of Lambayeque.  This area is mainly involved in agriculture, livestock farming and crafts.

For several years Gladys has been selling groceries (daily consumption products such as: milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet tissue, tuna, eggs, etc.).  Her store is set up in the market area where she lives.  With the income she earns from product sales she tries to cover household expenses and improve her lifestyle.  She also raises and sells goats at the market in the area.

To expand business she is requesting a loan of 1,500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy more merchandise.  She wants to expand and offer more products to customers and pay back the loan.  Gladys is a responsible, dedicated and hard-working person who worries about helping her family get ahead.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
La señora Clara es socia del banco comunal Las Bellas del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 50 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos.
Ella cuenta con un salón de belleza donde brinda el servicio de corte de cabello para damas, caballeros y niños, su local está ubicado en un mercado de la zona.
Con su nuevo préstamo de  S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 caja de tinte para cabello, 1 caja de blondor, 1 litro de liquido para permanente, 1 pistola secadora, 2 cepillos para el cabello, 1 espejo.
Vive solo con dos de sus hijos que todavía están estudiando, en su trabajo pasa mucho tiempo recién por la tarde regresa a su casa y en las noches  puede compartir  algunos momentos con sus hijos.
Ella está sacando adelante a sus hijos gracias a su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Clara está feliz porque sabe que sus hijos le corresponden a todo el esfuerzo que hace su mamá y está muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos por los préstamos otorgados a su persona.
texts.en:
Clara is a member of the Las Bellas Communal Bank in the Calleria district, Ucayali department.  She is 50 years old, and she is a single mother with three children.

She has a beauty salon where she cuts hair for women, men, and children.  Her place is situated in a market in the area.

She will use the new loan for 1,200 soles to buy one box of hair dye, one box of “Blondor” (lightening product), one liter of liquid for permanents, one hand-held hairdryer, two hair brushes, and one mirror.

She lives with her two children, who are still in school.  Lately she spends a lot of time at work in the afternoons.  She returns home, and in the evenings she is able to share some time with her children.

She is getting her children ahead thanks to her dedication and effort.  Clara is happy because she knows that her children benefit from all of the efforts their mother makes.  She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for the loans she has received.

loans.use: to buy a mirror and dyes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to make improvements on her home.

loans.name: Faafili

texts.en:
Faafili is 53 years of age and married with six children. Faafili owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. Faafili needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Faafili joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Faafili's 5th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Alexander Riwsson

texts.es:
Alexander padre de familia de 22 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su hijo en su casa propia; cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Los pobladores de ésta zona se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Alexander  se dedica a manejar su mototaxi (transporte utilizado por las personas en rutas pequeñas), movilizando pasajeros a los diferentes caseríos de la zona, cuenta con su propia clientela e incluso lo contratan para llevar a niños en edad escolar por lo mismo que vive en el mismo lugar, ésto le permite tener mayores ingresos para poder ayudar  a solventar los gastos diarios de su hogar.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 800 nuevos soles y su destino será para brindar mantenimiento y cambio de repuestos a su unidad móvil,para tenerla en buen estado y pueda seguir brindando un buen servicio, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Alexander es una persona trabajadora y responsable, que con esfuerzo desea sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Alexander is a 22-year old head of household who lives with his wife and son in his own house; his home only has electrical service and is located in the Tambogrande district, which belongs to the Piura department.  The residents of this zone dedicate themselves to farming, raising livestock, and handicrafts.

Alexander works driving a mototaxi (a form of transportation used by people on short routes), moving passengers to the different villages in the area.  He has his own customers and, in fact, is contracted to transport school-aged children since he lives in the same place.  This allows him to have more income to help meet his household’s daily expenses.

The loan he has requested from Edpyme Alternative is for 800 new Peruvian Soles, which is destined to be used to provide maintenance and replacement parts for his mode of transportation.  This will allow him to keep it in a good state of repair so he can continue to provide an excellent level of service.  With the income he obtains, he’ll be able to cover his loan and provide a higher standard of living for his family.  Alexander is a hard-working and responsible person who, with his efforts, will get his family ahead.

loans.use: maintain and change some replacement parts for his mototaxi.

loans.name: Marcia Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora. Marcia es socia del banco comunal Nuevos Horizontes, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por la belleza de sus paisajes, su centro colonial, su cultura, tradiciones, gastronomía y su gente.
 
Doña Marcia tiene 38 años, es divorciada, no tiene hijos pero se encuentra a la tutela de una sobrina que es huérfana, ella tiene 9 años de edad y estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora. Marcia es comerciante de todo tipo de ropa, esta actividad la desempeña hace 20 años, su mercadería  vende en sus tiempos libres y fines de semana. Hace 2 meses  trabaja cuidando adultos mayores pero solo medio día. También tiene un puesto en la esquina de su casa donde vende chuzos (carne en palito).

En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 12 años y todos los cerditos le han beneficiado en sus negocios. El dinero de este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Marcia is a member of the communal bank, Nuevos Horizontes ("New Horizons").  She lives in the city center of Cuenca, a place known for its beautiful landscape, colonial city center, culture, tradition, gastronomy, and people.  

Señora Marcia is 38 years old, divorced, and doesn't have any children but is the guardian of her niece, whom is an orphan.  Her niece is 9 years old and goes to a local school in the city.  They don't own their home but rent it.

Señora Marcia is a vendor of different types of clothing.  She began this form of business over 20 years ago.  She sells her merchandise during her free time and on the weekends.  For the past two months, she has been taking care of senior citizens part time.  She also has a stall on the corner near her house where she sells meat on a stick.

She has been a member of her communal bank for over 12 years and all of the credits have benefited her businesses.  The money from this credit will be invested in the purchase of clothing, such as pants, blouses, shirts and kids' clothes.  

Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Nive

texts.en:
Nive is 62 years of age and married with seven children. Nive owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. Nive needs a loan of WST $2050 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.
