She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 230 talas or US $96 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Nive joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Nive's 6th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es: Jovita de 26 años, es una joven soltera alegre y trabajadora con ganas de triunfar en la vida, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es obtener mejores ingresos para así darle una buena estabilidad económica a su futura familia. Jovita en la toma fotográfica sale expuesta con una gorra, debido a un accidente, causándole  fisuras en el encéfalo craneano y alrededor de la vista, por ello no desea ser fotografiada.  La actividad a la que se dedica Jovita es el cultivo de las plantas de café, cacao y frutas cítricas; plantas y tierras que heredó de sus padres. Desde entonces labra sus cultivos con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se dedican a sacar la maleza, cosechar y trasladar los productos hasta las carreteras para luego ser transportados en triciclos o carretillas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene en el desempeño de su labor, ya que ella decide que es lo mejor para sus cultivos. Lleva 05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es combatir con las plaga de insectos que se apoderan de los brotes de sus cultivos. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, es conciente que este  dinero le será muy útil en el progreso de su trabajo. Se siente muy contenta por ser socia de su banco comunal y aportará de si misma por el desarrollo de su grupo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará semillas de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Jovita is 26 years old.  She is a happy, hard-working, single young lady with an eagerness to succeed in life.  She lives in her own house and greatly wishes to earn more in order to be able to provide her future family with a stable income.  In the photo, Jovita appears with a cap because of an accident which caused fractures on her skull and around her eyes.  As such, she did not wish to be photographed.  

Jovita works in the cultivation of coffee, cacao, and citrus fruit plants; lands which she inherited from her parents.  She works on her fields with the help of day laborers, who remove the weeds, harvest, and transport the products to the roads, where they are then transported in tricycles and wheelbarrows.  What she enjoys most about her work is the liberty that she has in the management of her fields, since she gets to decide what is best for her cultivations.  She has been doing this for over 5 years and considers the most difficult part to combating the insects that eat her plants.  But for now, her priority is to purchase new land in order to increase her cultivations.  This is her second credit with MFP and she is aware that this money will be very useful in the progress of her work.  She is very happy to be a member of her communal bank and does her best to support her group's growth.  With these 1,000 Soles, she will purchase cacao and coffee seeds.

loans.use: to purchase coffee and cacao seeds.

loans.name: Vaipou

texts.en:
Vaipou is 37 years of age and married with five children. Vaipou owns & operates a business venture, baking & selling cakes in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Vaipou needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase baking equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 150 talas or US $63 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Vaipou joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Vaipou's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase baking equipment

loans.name: Carmen Alegria

texts.es:
Carmen D. 27 años es madre D. familia, vive en casa D. sus suegros con su esposo e hijo, cuenta con servicio D. luz solamente, ubicada en el distrito D. TambogranD. que pertenece al departamento D. Piura.  Esta zona   se caracterizan por la actividad agrícola, ganadera, artesana D. sus pobladores.

Carmen se dedica a la venta D. ropa y accesorios para damas, negocio que a colocado en su domicilio desD. hace unos años, pero también deja mercadería en otros caseríos y cobra cada fin D. mes, tratando D. tener mayor demanda D. clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares.

Al observar Carmen que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 500 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad D. mercadería e implementar su tienda con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia, D. una manera responsable  y con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 27-year old mother who lives in her in-law’s home with her husband and son.  The house only has electrical services and is located in the district of TambogranD., which belongs to the Piura department.  This zone is characterized for its farming, livestock and the handicrafts of its residents.

Carmen dedicates herself to selling women’s clothing and accessories, a business she has had in her home for two years.  She also delivers her merchandise to other villages and charges at the end of each month, trying to increase customers demand so she can earn more income to help meet household expenses.

At seeing that her business prospered more each day, Carmen thought it necessary to request a loan of 500 new Peruvian Soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  This would allow her to buy a greater amount of merchandise and supply her store with new products.  Her goals are to augment her customer base so she can pay her loan, and to improve her family’s standard of living in a responsible manner and with much effort and hard work.

loans.use: buy more merchandise to supply her business.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Martha Lorena es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 43 años. Ella es propietaria de una pequeña pulpería la cual inicio con la venta del tramo de su esposo.
Marta con el préstamo reforzara su negocio con la compra de granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar…etc.) carne, verduras…entre otros productos. El sueño y su motivación de trabajo es que sus hijos se preparen y tengan una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Señora Martha Lorena is a hard-working woman and entrepreneur of 43 years old.  She is the owner of a small convenience shop, which she began with the help of her husband.  

With this loan, Marta will improve her business with the purchase of basic grains (rice, beans, oil, sugar, etc.), meat, and vegetables, amongst other products.  Her dream and motivation to work so hard is for her children to be prepared and obtain a university degree.

loans.use: purchase basic grains (rice, beans, oil, sugar, etc.), meat, and vegetables amongst other products.

loans.name: Clara Luz

texts.es:
La Señora. Clara es socia del banco comunal Nuevos Horizontes, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por la belleza de sus paisajes, su centro colonial, su cultura, tradiciones, gastronomía y su gente.
 
La Señora. Clara tiene 69 años, es madre soltera  de 3 hijas que son mayores de edad y casadas, vive con una de sus hijas con quien comparte los gastos del hogar. También cuida de su pequeña nieta de 10 años quien es huérfana. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Clara es comerciante ambulante y constantemente viaja a diferentes lugares para traer su mercadería, ella vende ropa, cobijas, sabanas, platos, tazas, cubiertos, etc. En este negocio lleva 30 años.

Lleva 12 años en el banco comunal  y está muy contenta de pertenecer a ella ya que los créditos le han beneficiado para crecer en su negocio, su nuevo crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de ropa, cobijas, sabanas, platos, tazas, cubiertos, etc. para la venta.

Su meta es crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora. Clara is a member of the communal bank, Nuevos Horizontes ("New Horizons").  She lives in the city center of Cuenca, a city known for its beautiful landscape, colonial city center, culture, tradition, gatronomy, and people.  She is 69 years old and a single mother of 3 daughters, all of whom are married.  She lives with one of her daughters with whom she shares the household costs.  She also cares for her granddaughter of 10 years old, who is an orphan.  She does not own her home, but rents it.

Señora Clara is a vendor and is constantly traveling to different places, carrying her merchandise with her to sell.  She sells clothes, covers, sheets, plates, mugs, utensils, etc.  She has been working in this line of business for over 30 years.

She has been a member of this communal bank for over 12 years.  She is very happy to be a part of it since the credits have benefited the growth of her business.  She plans to invest her new credit in the purchase of clothes, covers, sheets, plates, mugs, utensils, etc. that she could then sell.  Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: purchase clothes, covers, sheets, plates, mugs, utensils, etc.

loans.name: Lotolagi

texts.en:
Lotolagi is 54 years of age and married with seven children. Lotolagi owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. Lotolagi needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 240 talas or US $100 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2005, Lotolagi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Lotolagi's 8th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Digna Del Rocío

texts.es:
La Señora. Digna es socia del banco comunal Nuevos Horizontes, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por la belleza de sus paisajes, su centro colonial, su cultura, tradiciones, gastronomía y su gente.
 
Doña Digna tiene 37 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 13, 9 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio, sus dos últimos hijos en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico industrial, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora. Digna es comerciante y labora vendiendo frutas desde que tenia 9 años edad,  no tienen un puesto propio por lo que vende recorriendo el mercado de la ciudad, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin horario fijo.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas para incrementar más su negocio. Es socia del banco comunal hace 5 años y está muy contenta de pertenecer a este grupo de mujeres luchadoras y solidarias.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Digna is a member of the communal bank "Nuevos Horizontes."  She lives in the center of the city of Cuenca, a city that is renowned for the beauty of its countryside, its colonial center, its culture, traditions, cuisine and its people.

Digna is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children aged 13, 9 and 7.  Her oldest is in middle school, the other two children are in a school in the city.   Her husband is an industrial mechanic.  They do not own a home, so they live in rented housing. 

Digna is a retailer who has been selling fruit since she was 9 years old.  She does not have her own stall, so she sells from place to place in the market in her city.  She works every day without a fixed schedule. 

She will invest the proceeds of this loan in the purchase of fruit so that she can expand her business.  Digna has been a member of her communal bank for 5 years, and she is very content to belong to this group of hardworking and cooperative women. 

Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: María Jose

texts.es:
La señora María José es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 34 años. Ella inicio en Adim con un grupo solidario llamado Cristhiam con el cual tuvo 7 ciclos de los cuales dos fueron kiva y ahora se gradúa al crédito individual. 
Ella se dedica al comercio de ropa y cosmético negocio que inicio hace cuatro años con poco capital con la compra de algunos cosméticos y que con los préstamos ha salido adelante.
La meta de María José es tener una miscelánea donde venda de todo un poco con los espacios distribuidos para ropa, cosméticos, adornos y confites. Mientras describía su rostros se ilumino como transportándose a ese lugar que un día no lejano llegara.
texts.en:
María José is a hardworking and enterprising 34 year-old woman.  She started with ADIM in a communal bank called "Cristhiam" which had 7 loan cycles, 2 of which were funded by Kiva.  Now she has graduated to taking credit on an individual basis.

Maria has a business selling clothing and cosmetics.  She started the business 4 years ago with a small amount of capital that she used to buy some cosmetics; with the loans she has been able to make progress with the business. 

Maria's goal is to have a general store where she could sell a little of everything, with spaces allocated for clothing, cosmetics, accessories and sweets.  While she describes it her face lights up as she is transported to this place that will someday soon exist.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Melba

texts.es:
La señora Melba Argentina de 66 años es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien inicio con la venta de comida y con las ganancias puso una modesta pulpería. Sus negocios según comento gracias a los préstamos y su labor han ido creciendo poco a poco  ahora tiene un mejor inventario y vende más.

Ella tiene dos hijos ya mayores de edad quienes en sus tiempos libres le ayudan en el negocio. Melba con el crédito comprará mercadería y tiene la meta de  ser independiente y auto sostenible con su negocio y no prestar.
texts.en:
Melba Argentina, 66, is a hard working, dedicated entrepreneur who started out selling prepared food and then used the profits to set up a small grocery store.  Her businesses, according to her comments, have been growing gradually thanks to the loans and to her efforts; now she has better inventory and she sells more.

She has two adult children who help her in the store in their free time.  Melba will use the loan to buy merchandise.   Her goal is to be independent and self sufficient in her business to not have to borrow any more.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, fruit, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Antonio es  trabajador y emprendedor. Él es propietario de una sastrería desde hace 35 años aproximadamente y entrega ropa en mercado de Masaya y en el norte del país (Matagalpa, Estelí, Nueva Segovia, Chontales). 
Francisco trabaja junto a su esposa y sus siete hijos los cuales son mayores de edad. Con el crédito comprará telas, hilos, botones…etc. materia prima para su negocio.
texts.en:
Francisco Antonio is hard working and enterprising.  He has owned a tailor shop for 35 years approximately.  He sells his clothes in the market in Masaya and in the north of the country (Matagalpa, Estelí, Nueva Segovia and Chontales).

Francisco works alongside his wife and seven children who are all adults.  He will use the loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, etc.; the raw materials for his work.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and buttons.

loans.name: Abigail Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Abigail Esmeralda es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora originaria de Pacayita, Diría. Ella es contadora del comedor génesis y junto a su esposo se dedica al comercio de ropa. Ellos se distribuyen el trabajo del negocio para seguir progresando y que su nivel de vida mejore.

Con el crédito comprará mercadería en pantalones, vestidos, cortinas…etc.
texts.en:
Abigail Esmeralda is a hard working, enterprising woman from Pacayita, Diría.  She is an Accountant at the Génesis Eatery and together with her husband sells clothes.  They share the work in the business to continue making progress and so that their standard of living improves.
She will use the loan to buy pants, dresses, curtains, etc.

loans.use: to buy pants, dresses, curtains, etc.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel cultivates the tree of life that we call coconut. He is 41 years old, married with five children, and residing at Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. His income per month is almost $240 from the production of coconut. He has been doing this for ten years with his parents, and now he manages their coconut farm. He requested a loan of 20,000 PHP at GDMPC to buy fertilizer and pesticides for their two-hectare coconut farm.

Manuel is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, he hopes to buy an additional hectare of coco land.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperative in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC people empowering people.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng, 43, is a widow woman blessed with one child who has already married.

She is a domestic farmer who lives in the Prey Chor district. She has a plot of farm land that comes from her parents. She can plant crops at least twice a year, and her child helps her in the farming business. 

Heng would like to apply for a loan to purchase potato seeds for planting. Heng trusts that she will add more income after using the Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Haim

texts.en:
Haim is humble villager who has two children who are still young and living under her care.

She makes a living by selling fish in Siem Reap province. She is married to Roun, a fisherman who works along the Tunle Sap River. 

Haim has over five years experience in this fish-selling business. She can earn a profit of approximately of US $4 a day. 

Haim will use the loan to mend her old house. 

Note: Haim and her youngest child are in the photo in front of her house.

loans.use: to mend her old house.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 48 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business of buying and selling rice in the Philippines and requested a 40,000 PHP loan through NWTF to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries at her rice mill.

Rosemarie has borrowed and paid off 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buying and selling of rice for four years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries at her rice mill.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 53 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Mila has borrowed and paid off 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
For the past eight years Helen, a 57-year-old married woman, has operated a retail shop selling both food and daily-use products such as soap, shampoo, and toothpaste to the people in her community. She earns about PHP 9,000 each month from this enterprise.

Helen is requesting a loan of PHP 18,000 to purchase additional retail items such as cases of soft drinks, canned goods, and detergents that will increase both her sales and her profits. In the future, Helen hopes to have a big business and achieve financial independence that will make her family more economically stable.

loans.use: to purchase additional retail items such as soft drinks, canned goods, and detergents.

loans.name: Bona

texts.en:
Bona, a 53-year-old married mother of six children, lives in Tinacla-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental Bona, where she grows bananas, selling the banana fruit, fresh, processed and cooked to the community. In this business for a year, Bona earn PHP 4,000.00 each month.

A good member with GDMPC for one year, Bona has requested a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to purchase new planting materials such as tissue culture seedlings for her banana production. She hopes that in the coming years, she will have her own banana plantation.

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC -  people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase planting materials for banana production.

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita, a 59-year-old married woman, has a retail shop in the market where she sells slippers and sandals. In business for seven years, she usually earns about PHP 2,000 each month. Charita is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 to purchase additional slippers and sandals of various sizes to increase her sales capacity.

In the future, Charita hopes to make frequent sales and consistent profits to provide a progressive life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional slippers and sandals of various sizes.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 41 years old and married with five children. With two children in school, Bernadeth works very hard to provide for them.

Bernadeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of groceries.

Bernadeth has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, biscuits, shampoo and other groceries. 

In the future Bernadeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a recycled materials business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of recycled materials for her recycled materials business.

Benita has been in this business for six years. She earns additional income from food and snack vending.

Benita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of recycled materials.

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en:
Koeun is a 23-year-old man who makes a daily income by running a motor taxi in Siem Reap Province. From this occupation, he can earn around US $3 each day. His wife manages household work and plants a few vegetables to generate some additional income. 

Koeun is worried about his old motorbike, which needs to be fixed very often. For this reason, he has applied for a loan to buy a new motorcycle to replace the broken one. He will use a few parts of his loan to plant vegetable crops.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle to replace the broken one.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina, 35, is married and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Catalina has a food stall business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more chickens and other ingredients for her food production business.

Catalina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Catalina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and other ingredients for her food production business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Charlot

texts.en:
Charlot is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Charlot has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and breads. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Charlot has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Charlot hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Lucita has a retail shop that sells a variety of office and school supplies. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy additional office and school supplies.

Lucita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Lucita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional office and school supplies.

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
Daylinda, 35, is married and has five children. Three are in school.

Daylinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net and an engine for her pump boat. (A pump boat is an outrigger canoe powered by a small engine.)

Daylinda has been in this business for two years. In the future, Daylinda would like to save money for the future and the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy an engine for the pump boat and some fish net.

loans.name: Antonietta

texts.en:
Antonietta is 43 years old and married. she has seven children and four are in school, Antonietta works very hard to provide for them.

Antonietta runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks for her store.

Antonietta has been in this business for 27 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Antonietta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, 28, is a married and has three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Arlene has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Arlene has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children.
 
Bernadeth raises and sells goats. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy another kind of animal to raise and sell in the future.

Bernadeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Bernadeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy another kind of animal to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Fredeswinda

texts.en:
Fredeswinda is 64 years old and married. She has nine children. 

Fredeswinda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Fredeswinda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Fredeswinda has been raising pigs for four years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Fredeswinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Thong

texts.en: Thong, age 53, is widow, as her husband died of senility years ago. Currently, she lives with her four children, two of whom are married and the other two who are single. All of the children are employed in different occupations. To make a living, Thong plants rice and some vegetable crops, which she sells out in the market when they are mature. One of her children is a fisherman, but now he is lacking tools to fish. Therefore, Thong is applying for a loan for her son to purchase a boat, a machine, and nets in order to support his business activities.

loans.use: to purchase a boat, a machine, and nets in order to support her son's business activities.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: For the past nine years Zenaida, a 37-year-old married mother of two children, has been earning a living raising pigs in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from basket weaving. Zenaida is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vacccines and vitamins for her pigs, and is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is 61 years old and married with 4 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Pablita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Pablita requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and other fishing equipment.

Pablita has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Pablita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other fishing equipment

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lovella

texts.en:
Lovella is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Lovella has a shop that sells snacks, canned goods, noodles and biscuits. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Lovella has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lovella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. Nenita is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Nenita requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.  Nenita has been in this business for 9 years now, and also earns additional income from fish vending.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Enriquita has a shop that sells a variety of products like bananas and firewood and serves different varieties of meals. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy yellow and green bananas, raw ingredients for cooking viands (tasty dishes) and firewood.

Enriquita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Enriquita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy yellow and green bananas, raw ingredients for cooking viands and firewood

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase items for her sari-sari (variety) store and fishing net for her fish vending business.

Concepcion has been in this business for 10 years. Concepcion earns more income from sari-sari (variety) store.

Concepcion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and items for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional coconuts for copras.

loans.name: Ergenia

texts.en:
Ergenia is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Ergenia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, breads and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Ergenia has been a member of HSPFI since 2004. In the future, Ergenia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Nieng

texts.en: From Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province, Mrs. Nieng, age 32, is married to Mr. Ly, age 47. Both of them are working in the farming business. They have only one child, who is a student in public school. In addition, her husband has been earning a living for many years by climbing the palm trees behind his house for extra income. Mrs. Nieng has a plot of farming land and she and her husband always use this land to grow annual rice crops. Mrs. Nieng is looking for a loan to buy two cows because her old cow doesn't support her work in the field.

loans.use: to buy two cows for supporting her in the field.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer  is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Elmer  has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages and biscuits. He has had this business for 20 years. He requested a loan for PHP 16,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and breads.

Elmer  has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Elmer hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and breads

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Roselyn has a shop that sells canned goods, biscuits, breads & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Roselyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Roselyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Susana works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycle transport.  Susana is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and equipment for her fishing business.

Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Leonor has a auto repair shop wherein her husband works as the auto repairman. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of the service.

Leonor is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Leonor hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Lach

texts.en: Mrs. Lach makes a living selling clothing in the Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap Province. She currently sells clothing for both men and women at her home, and has one child who helps support the family by providing cosmetic services for weddings. Mrs. Lach is an energetic woman who never wastes time, and works hard to provide her family with a comfortable life. She has managed her business carefully and attracted a large number of clients, in part because of her strong communication skills. In order to better meet her customers' demands, she would like a loan to turn part of her house into a new shop.

loans.use: to turn part of her house into a shop.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en: Haydee is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Haydee has a tailoring shop that repairs and sews different kinds of clothing and curtains. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy materials she needs, like needles and cloth. Haydee is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Haydee hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed, like needles and cloth

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 46 years old and married with 6 children, 4 of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Evangeline has a cosmetics sales business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years and is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics stock to sell

loans.name: Mov

texts.en: The woman shown in the picture above, Mrs. Mov, is a 35-year-old farmer residing in the rural area of Kompong Cham Province. She has been planting rice crops as her annual business. Her husband works in construction. Mrs. Mov is looking for a $1100 loan as capital to support her farming business. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for planting. Mrs. Mov has three single children, two of whom are assisting her husband in the construction business. The other one is attending school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for planting.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 32 years old and married with 2 children. Cristina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store like soap, groceries, etc.

Cristina has borrowed and repaid 11 previous loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from apartelle (hostel) rentals.

Cristina aspires to to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, groceries, etc

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Susana is providing motorela or habal-habal transportation service. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of the service. Susana is a new member of HSPFI.  

In the future, Susana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza is 40 years old, married and a mother of 3. She has a food production business, particularly selling processed foods in her village. She has been in this business for almost 2 years and earns 5,000 PHP monthly. Analiza is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional raw ingredients to make more processed foods to sell. She would like to continue using loans and hopes that Kiva lenders will extend their assistance to her in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients to make more processed foods to sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 10 children. 

Rosario has a game shop that provides peso coin game machines. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of the game machines. Rosario is a new member of HSPFI.  

In the future, Rosario hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of the game machines

loans.name: Ngin

texts.en: Ngin has been in the farming business since 1990. She lives in the province of Kampong Chhnang. Ngin, 38, is married to Sokon, 41, who is a domestic construction builder who is able to make an income of about US$2.50 each day. They have three children, two of whom do garment factory work. Usually they are able to contribute their salaries for Ngin to use in meeting the needs of her family. In order to make additional income, Ngin needs capital to purchase many sacks of rice to store. She will sell them when the rice is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: to buy rice to stock up for future sale.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and three children. For the last five years, she has made a living running a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She is a new member of HSPFI and is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. In the future, Clarita hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food items and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 51 years old, married and lives in the Philippines. For the last 15 years, she has made a living by running a retail shop where she sells a variety of products such as canned goods and beverages. She is a new member of HSPFI and is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. In the future, Marilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and bread to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en: Eden is 56 years old, married and has one child. For the last 10 years, she has made a living by running a retail store where she earns PHP 4,500 a month. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, coffee and bread to sell to her customers. In the future, she hopes to continue to have access to credit, because this will allow her to expand her business and provide her family with daily necessities.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, coffee and bread to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Duk

texts.en: Mrs. Duk is a 42-year-old widow who work from home making baskets out of bamboo. Occasionally, she also buys baskets from other weavers in order to resell them to people in her community. She has two children, both of whom attend school and help her make bamboo baskets. In order to increase her income, Mrs. Duk has applied for a loan to buy more baskets to sell.

loans.use: to buy more baskets to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is 37 years old, single and lives in the Philippines. For the last five years, she has made a living by running a shop where sells cashews and peanuts. She is a new member of HSPFI and is applying for her first loan, for PHP 5,000, to buy additional sacks of peanuts to sell to her customers. In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of peanuts  to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ngư's Group

texts.en:
Ngư is 43 years old and lives in the Yen Phong district of Bac Ninh province, where she leads a six-member loan group affiliated with SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. This group is named Đông Mai nhóm 07 (7).

Ngư is married, has four grown children and earns a living by making furniture, mostly for bedrooms. She has been in this business for more than three years and earns about 4.500.000 VND a month. Last year, she joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND and is applying for a new one for 7.392.000 VND to buy more supplies for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue she earns to expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group, each of whom makes furniture for a living
1.  Tâm is 45 years old and is applying for 7.392.000 VND.
2.  Chuyên is 39 years old who is applying for 8.288.000 VND.
3.  Dung  is 37 years old who is applying for 5.152.000 VND.
4.  Lan is 35 years old and is applying for 5.152.000 VND loan.
5.  Thương  is 36 years old female who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan.

About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Ngư là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Ngư là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đông Mai nhóm 07 (7).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị trong phòng ngủ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Ngư thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Ngư kiếm được khoảng 4.500.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Ngư đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Ngư đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Tâm  là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


2.  Chuyên là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


3.  Dung là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


4.  Lan  là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


5.  Thương là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva

loans.use: to expand a small furniture-making businesses.

loans.name: Almira

texts.en: Almira is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and five children. For the last five years, she has made a living by running a retail shop where she sells a variety of fish. She is a new member of HSPFI and is applying for her first loan, for PHP 5,000, to buy more fish to sell to her customers. Her goal for the future is to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lovelle

texts.en:
Lovelle is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.

Lovelle has a retail shop that sells a variety of fish, such as sardines and milkfish. She has been operating this business for 5 years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to buy additional fish to sell.

Lovelle is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Lovelle hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with 4 children.

Sarah has a game shop with coin-operated game machines. She has been operating this business for 5 years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to buy tools and to pay the utilities needed to maintain her operations.

Sarah is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Sarah hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and to pay for the utilities

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single.

Analiza provides rickshaw (transportation) services. She has been operating this business for 5 years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to buy tools needed for the business and to use for her personal needs.

Analiza is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Analiza hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools needed for the business and to use for personal needs

loans.name: Thắm's Group

texts.en:
Thắm is a 46-year-old woman living in Yên Phong District of Băc Ninh Province. Thắm is the group leader of a two-member group receiving a loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Đông Mai - Nhóm 02 (2).

Thắm is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Thắm owns a manufacturing business, manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members. Thắm has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month.

In 2010, Thắm joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thắm has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings to include beds and wardrobes. This will be Thắm's second loan from SEDA. Thắm plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. H. is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a loan of 7,392,000 VND to support her manufacturing business, involving timber production and buying tables and chairs for sale.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Thắm thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thắm kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Thắm đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thắm đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Thắm là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.
