loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Thom

texts.en: Thom was born in 1966. She lives in Dai Bi village with her husband and two children. She is a farmer. Not only does she grow rice, but she also makes "rolled cake" (a crepe-like dish from northern Vietnam) to sell. She has had this job for eight years. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamese dong  (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2005. The last time she took a loan, she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid this amount punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to again borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy rice to make rolled cake.

loans.use: to buy rice to make "rolled cake."

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Joy has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has been operating this business for 5 years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to buy additional products, including canned goods, eggs, shampoo, soaps, and beverages.

Joy is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Joy hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products such as canned goods, eggs, shampoo, soaps, and beverages

loans.name: Jenilyn

texts.en:
Jenilyn is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.

Jenilyn has a retail shop that sells longganiza (homemade sausage) and rice by the kilogram. She has been operating this business for 3 years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to buy additional raw ingredients for making longganiza and additional sacks of rice.

Jenilyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jenilyn hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for making longganiza and additional sacks of rice

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van was born in 1974. She lives with her husband and two children in Dai Bi village. Her husband is a builder and both of her children are going to school. Not only does she grow vegetables and rice, but she also sells clothes in the market, where she has a shop. She has had this job for three years. She has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2005 and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 3 children. 
Juliet has a retail shop that sells a variety of fruits. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy different kinds of fruits, like watermelons & mangoes.
Juliet is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Juliet hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of fruits, like watermelons & mangoes

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van is 48 years old and lives in Kompong Chhnang Province. He works in construction as a day laborer and earns about $3.25 a day. For many years now, his wife has made a living weaving baskets out of bamboo, and earns about $1.25 a day. In addition to their jobs, the couple grows rice on land they rent. They have four children, one of whom is married and one of whom works in a garment factory. Van has applied for this loan to buy a piece of land on which he can grow rice. This would mean a big improvement in the family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land on which to grow rice.

loans.name: Binh

texts.en: Binh was born in 1978. She lives with her husband and three children in Dai Bi village. Her husband sells fruit in the market. Her family has a beverage store. She is a cobbler. She has  run this kind  of business for six years. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). The last time she took a loan, she borrowed 8,502,000 VND to expand her store. She repaid this amount punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to  buy more kinds of soft drink such as Cocacola, Pepsi, and bottles of beer to meet the demand of customers  in Summer.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of soft drinks

loans.name: Aisada's Group

texts.en:
Aisada is the leader of this group. She is 25 and married to a tractor driver. The family lives in Karabalta, a small town near Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan). A year ago the family got livestock as an inheritance from their parents.  At the moment in order to meet their daily needs, Aisada sells milk.  In this way she earns 1000 soms per month. 

Aisada wants to start breeding, fattening and reselling livestock. She hopes to get this loan in order to increase the number of livestock. In the future she wishes to further improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria  is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with two children.  She  has a retail shop that sells ready-to-wear clothing, T-shirts, blouses & underwear. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy T-shirts & blouses for sale.

Gregoria  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gregoria  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts & blouses for sale.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is 19 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. She has a business that sells a variety of fish like sardines & milk fish. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional fish to sell.

Hazel is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Hazel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Emily has a retail shop that sells canned goods, candies, biscuits & snacks. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Emily is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Emily hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 2 children. 
Maricar has a rolling food shop that sells snacks, like tempura & kwek-kwek . She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for tempura & kwek-kwek.
Maricar is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Maricar hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for tempura & kwek-kwek

loans.name: Kanybek

texts.en:
Kanybek is a resident of Tashkomur, a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. He is 46 and, together with his wife, he runs the family business. He breeds cattle, and has started building a café. Kanybek began to breed cattle twenty years ago with an initial investment of 2000 soms, and now he earns 14,000 soms per month.

He applied for the loan because he needs additional money for purchasing hay to feed the cattle. In the near future, with money gained from reselling cattle, Kanybek plans to finish the construction of the café. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase hay to feed cattle

loans.name: Uk

texts.en: From Kompong Chhnang Province, Mrs. Uk is a 28-year-old married woman and the mother of three school-aged kids. She is a local farmer who has been planting a variety of crops for nine years. She also relies on income from her husband’s work as a domestic construction worker. She planted rice crops two months ago, but her crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline for her plowing machine.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and gasoline for her plowing machine.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 3 children. 
Teresita has a retail shop that sells fish, like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional fish to sell.
Teresita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Chou

texts.en: Making baskets is a part of 48-year-old Mrs. Chou’s daily routine. She and her husband currently buy raw materials to make baskets to sell at the mobile place. They also buy baskets from other weavers at a reasonable price and resell them to gain extra profits. They have done this since 1990. Mrs. Chou has five children. Three of her children are employed as garment workers. Mrs. Chou will be using her loan to add to her personal savings to buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland near her house, which is a good location for farming. The loan will offer her an additional new asset. Mrs. Chou and her granddaughter are shown in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land for planting rice crops.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 5 children. 
Charito has a retail shop that sells hardware products, like bolts & electrical wires. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional stock of bolts & electrical wires.
Charito is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Charito hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of bolts & electrical wires

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 4 children. 
Candelaria has a game shop that provides computer games for a peso.  She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools & to pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of the game machines.
Candelaria is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future,Candelaria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & to pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of the game machines

loans.name: Saktiyan's Group

texts.en:
Saktiyan is the leader of this group. She is 56 and married to a security guard. Together with her husband she has raised two sons and two daughters. The younger son is a handicapped person; the older daughter is married and lives separately with her family. The second daughter works in a Social Fund and the older son is a security guard. 

Saktiyan herself works at a market selling foodstuffs. In parallel with this business she breeds livestock. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future Saktiyan wants to see all her children get married. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is married with a 7-year-old daughter. She is an entrepreneur from Energodar, which is a predominantly agricultural region of eastern Ukraine. Anna sells seeds, farming chemicals and pesticides in a little farming store and has another vending location at a market. She started this venture 10 years ago. Currently, she has about 180,000 Grivnyas invested in inventory. Her working capital amounts to 50,000 Grivnyas. 

Anna is seeking a 20,000 Grivnya loan to purchase seeds for the second planting season. She always tries to re-stock her inventory, keeping up with the demand and varied market. Anna’s long-term business goal is to remodel her little store to attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for the second planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine for his wife's sewing business.

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
Houssam is a 42-year-old married man and father of six children. Houssam lives and works in Saida. He studied to work as an X-ray technician, but because of lack of opportunities and because he has a big family to take care of, Houssam started working selling coffee in the streets. In 1996, he took a fixed place next to a hospital as his official selling point.

Houssam has been an Al Majmoua-Kiva partner borrower for three consecutive cycles, and all his previous loans helped in improving his business and his family's social and financial situation.

This time Houssam isn't requesting the loan for his business; he really needs it to pay for an urgent kidney surgery for his daughter. The surgery costs $26,000 and he was able to collect a big amount of it but he still needs the requested amount to start with the necessary medications before the surgery.

Houssam found it hard at the beginning to start such a business, because he's well-educated and not used to street work. Now he's friends with everyone in the region, and he got used to it.

He hopes his daughter gets well soon and that he never faces such a situation with any of his children again.

loans.use: To pay for his daughter's surgery.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina and her husband own an apartment in the city of Ramallah.  Amina rents the apartment to students. This apartment is the only source of income for her family and for her three daughters.

The apartment needs repairs such as plastering, painting the walls, changing the water pipes, etc.  Amina, who was photographed in FATEN's branch office, took out a loan from FATEN to pay for the repairs.

loans.use: Pay for repairs for  the apartment that she rents out to earn income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory

loans.name: Ya

texts.en: Mrs. Ya, who is 54 years old, is a humble villager living in Reussey Kao commune of Phnom Penh City. Mrs. Ya is married and blessed with six children, while her husband is a chief of construction who has a few laborers to assist him in the construction service. Mrs. Ya works with her husband in the same business. Recently, Mrs. Ya's husband has been very busy at his business due to there being many clients who need him to build houses for them. However, he is still lacking materials for construction. That is why Mrs. Ya has requested a loan as capital to buy extra construction materials.

loans.use: to buy extra construction materials.

loans.name: Koemlun

texts.en:
Koemlun (in the photo with her loom) is single. She lives wither her two brothers and one sister on an Island of the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Koemlun is a silk weaver. She is asking for a loan of $500 to provide capital for her sister who, two months ago, started a new business selling coffee.

loans.use: To provide capital for her sister’s business of coffee sales.

loans.name: Vivena

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Vivena works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Vivena is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fish net and other equipment for her fishing business.

Vivena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to earn and save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fish net and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is 33 years old. He is married and has three children who are school-aged. He is a farmer from Narok, Kenya, where he has been farming for 10 years. 

His farm produces wheat and maize, which he sells through middlemen. He has applied for his second loan of KES.50,000 from KADET LTD., to prepare land and buy maize seeds. The extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children and improve his family's living. 

He plans to acquire more acres of land to expand his farming in the near future.

loans.use: to prepare land for planting maize and to buy seeds

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en:
Chanthol (in the photo) has been a silk weaver for more than 30 years. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver for more than eight years. She also supplements her income with a new business, raising pigs at home. She hopes to continue her pig farming, so she is asking for another loan in the amount of $1,000 in order to buy more piglets and feed for pigs. 
The couple lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1990 and have four children-three sons and one daughter.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feed for pigs.

loans.name: Flordelis

texts.en:
Flordelis is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.  Flordelis has been in this business for 10 years. She also earns income from raising pigs.

Flordelis has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving enough money to  send her children to college and to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers

loans.name: Lauriano

texts.en:
Lauriano is 56, married, and has one child. He is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lauriano has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. He requested a 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the repair of the sidecar. 

Lauriano has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Lauriano would like to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for motorcycle sidecar repair

loans.name: Lang Eng

texts.en:
Lang eng, 44, sells food at her home. Her husband, Samnang, 42, is a motor taxi driver. Lang eng is asking for a loan of $700 to add to her own money to buy a motorcycle for her son to drive to work. 

The couple has two sons, one has full-time employment and another one is in school. They live in a suburb about twenty kilometers outside of Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To add to her own money to buy a motorcycle for her son to get to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy printing paper for the cyber-café and food for the grocery shop

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, 50, is married and has six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Maria has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a 17,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase raw materials for her tailoring business. 

Maria has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Maria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy equipment and ingredients for her bakery. 

Lourdes has been in this business for 24 years. She earns additional income from her sari-sari (variety) store. 

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy equipment and ingredients for her bakery business

loans.name: Chinrattana

texts.en:
Chinrattana is a clerk and his wife is garment factory worker. Chinrattana requested Kiva loan two times already, he now is asking for his third loan of $1,000 to build a fence around his house. 

This couple has been married since 2003 and have two young children: one son and one daughter.

loans.use: To build a fence around his house.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Mrs. Lan is a 31-year-old woman who has her own small business selling various kinds of goods in front of her house. She has been in this business since 2004. She sells items such as pure drinking water, cosmetics, cooking ingredients, plastic goods, and other essential items. She is able to generate an average income of US$5 a day. She has a life partner in her husband, who is working in construction. He employs others to provide these services. Mrs. Lan is seeking a loan for her husband to use as working capital to broaden his business size.

loans.use: to use as working capital for her husband to broaden his business size.

loans.name: Scott

texts.en:
Scott, aged 21, is married to Emily, and they are blessed with one child. He has been selling handcrafts for eleven years. The business earns him a monthly income of 4,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

This is his first loan from KADET Ltd. He will use the loan to buy more handcrafts for resale. Scott intends to use the anticipated profits to educate his child and hopes to join international exporters in the future.

loans.use: To buy handcrafts for sale

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Sitha, 46, is a widow with three sons and one daughter. Two are married, one is a garment factory worker and another one is a construction worker. The family lives in a village along National Road Number One about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sitha is a garment factory worker. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her son who is a construction worker to drive to work. 

In the photo are Sitha and her son.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is 53 years old and married with seven children. Claudia works very hard to provide for them. 

Claudia runs a Sari-sari (variety) Store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as bread, drinks, detergent, and other groceries. 

In the future Claudia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married and has a used clothing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Josephine requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more used clothes to sell.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elisa Jessica

texts.en:
Elisa Jessica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. Elisa Jessica earns additional income from fish vending.

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Elisa Jessica has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 44 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Anecita has been farming sugarcane for 26 years and also earns additional income from running a sari-sari (variety) store and raising livestock.

Anecita is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy is 32 years old and her husband, Samon, is 31 years old. They live in a village along National Road Number One, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2000 and have a young son.
 
Chanthy runs a grocery store at home, while her husband is a farmer and does construction work when he is free from the farm. 

Chanthy is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorcycle for her husband to drive to work. 

Photo: Chanthy and her husband.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.name: Socheata

texts.en:
Socheata sells fruit, while her husband is a chef. The couple has been married since 1997 and has two children: one son and one daughter. They live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Socheata’s husband hopes to supplement their income with a new business: driving a tuk tuk motorcycle taxi.  

Socheata is applying for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a tuk tuk for her husband.

loans.use: to purchase a tuk tuk for her husband.

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: There are many Cambodians who make a living as local cultivators; one of them is Mr. Sek, who has been working in this sector since 2000. She and her husband grow rice, vegetables and other fruits on their own farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. From this business they can generate an income of around US$4.20 per day. This gentle couple has three single children, two of whom are employed as sewing workers at the factory. Currently, Mr. Sek’s house is in the process of being built and he has some problems with financing. Therefore, Mr. Sek has decided to ask for some funds from Kiva to finish the process of building his new house.

loans.use: to finish building his new house.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 38 year-old businesswoman.  She is married and a mother of  four children. Lilian has been running a green grocer business in an open air market for the past 15 years. Her monthly income is KES. 30,000. 

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD, after paying the first loan successfully. She will use the loan to purchase cabbages, kale, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she plans to invest it back into the business. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 43-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and one child. She has owned a gifts and accessories shop since 2009. She sells an extensive range of original products. She decided to start her own business to better support her family. This will be her second loan; she said that the previous loan was sufficient to fulfill her business objectives. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional products for her shop. She has high hopes for the future of her business and looks forward to continued expansion of her business in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vantin

texts.en:
Vantin and his wife, Sopheap, live in a village along National Road Number One, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2000 and have three children - two sons and one daughter, two of whom are in school while the third is still young.

Vantin is motor taxi driver, while his wife, formerly a fish-seller, farms in the village. Vantin hopes to help his wife launch her own business selling sugarcane juice at home and so is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy a sugarcane juicing machine and build a shelter.

In the photo: Vantin and his wife and their young son.

loans.use: to buy a sugarcane juicing machine for his wife.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 38 years old and married with one child. Florenda works very hard to provide for them.

Florenda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store.

Florenda has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as rice, soft drinks and grocery foods. 

In the future, Florenda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 60 years old and is a married woman with nine children. The oldest child is 39 years old. Her two youngest children still go to school.

Margarita is engaged in farming. She grows rice crops and vegetables to sell. Margarita does her best to support her family. She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

Margarita hopes to improve their house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en: Dalal is the mother of two daughters and three sons. She is married to a municipality employee. One of Dalal's daughters is sick and needs urgent treatment that will cost the family lots of money that they can't afford. Dalal's family has government insurance, but it doesn't cover the expensive treatment the 6-year-old child needs. Dalal (who is in the photo) took out a loan from FATEN to pay for her daughter's treatment expenses.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's treatment expenses.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, 43 years old, is a gruel seller. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Their income is $11 per day. They have five children, 24, 20, 17, 15, and 13 years old. Two of them are still in school and the others are working in the factory. 

Every month, she has to spend $35 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees of her children, and $15 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy wood to repair her house. This loan will help her family to have a proper house to live in, and the rest of the money she will use for her business to make more income for her family. She plans to enlarge her business to get more profit to enable her children to study till they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy wood to repair her house.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida, a married woman who works hard to support her family, has had a personal products sales business in the Philippines for 10 years. She is now requesting a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products to sell to her customers. In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, a 58-year-old married mother of seven children, has been working in the quarry business for 10 years, earning 27,500 KES a month. She sells stones to customers on the Athi River, Mulolongo, and Kitengela. Mary is requesting her first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD to buy an additional piece of a quarry and will use the profits from the loan to buy another piece.

Describing herself as hardworking, in the future Mary hopes to have a very big piece of quarry and a lorry for transportation to customers.

loans.use: to buy a piece of a quarry.

loans.name: Maurito

texts.en:
Maurito is 47 years old and married with four children. The oldest child is 22 and the youngest is 17. 

Maurito is a farmer who tills land in Surallah, South Cotabato. He grows rice and corn crops, pineapples and bananas. Maurito also started a sari-sari store that his wife manages. Maurito works hard to provide the needs of his family. He requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

In the future, Maurito hopes to expand his farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 31 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Melanie works very hard to provide for them.

Melanie runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like soft drinks, groceries, etc to sell in her sari-sari store.

Melanie has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soft drinks, bread, etc. 

In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like soft drinks and groceries to sell

loans.name: Steven

texts.fr: Steven  est client d’ACB depuis 2010. Il est marié, il est  âgé de 29 ans ,il a  2 enfants entre 4 mois et  6 ans, il a 1 enfant va à l’école et il a 3 personnes en charge.  Il est né au  Rwanda.son niveau d’éducation est 3ans de primaire.il est  agri-éleveur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utilise le prêt pour achète une vache  à élever. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire  est d’améliorer son élevage pour être plus moderne et ajouter les nombre des vaches pour être un grand distributeur de lait et de vache pour les boucheries. Dans l’avenir il voudrait devenir un grand distributeur  de lait et pour devenir un vendeur des gros bétails et pour sa famille il voudrait éduquer ses enfants, et prépare un meilleur avenir  pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Steven has been a client of ACB since 2010. He is married, 29 years old, and has two children, 4 months and 6 years old. One child goes to school. He is supporting three people.

He was born in Rwanda, and his formal education consists of three years of primary (elementary) school. He raises livestock for a living.

This is Steven's first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy a cow to raise. His strategy to expand his business is to modernize his farm and increase the number of cows in order to become a large supplier of milk and of beef for butcher shops.

In the future he would like to become a large dairy supplier. To become a large livestock merchant and to help his family, he would like to educate his children and prepare a better future for his family.

loans.use: to buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a carinderia (local eatery) business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy ingredients to produce food for her carinderia (local eatery) business.

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years. Josephine earns more income from raising pigs.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to support her family and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Vilma works hard to support her family. She buys and sells dried fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a piggery. Vilma is requesting a loan of PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 43 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Gloria is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gloria has been farming vegetables for eight years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new summer collection of clothes to sell

loans.name: Edang

texts.en:
Edang is 48 years old and has four children. She is married and three of her children are in school.

Edang is in the agricultural business growing rice in the Philippines. Edang requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers & other farm supplies.

Edang has been farming rice for five years and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. 

In the future, Edang would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers & other farm supplies

loans.name: Inda

texts.en:
Inda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. She is borrowing 24,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Inda has been in this business for seven years. She earns additional income from food vending and working as a dress maker.

Inda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business and sending her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 43 years old and is married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 24,500 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Merlita has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for four years and also earns an income from selling frozen products and from a networking business.

Merlita aspires to save enough money to buy farm land.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Elva

texts.en:
Elva is 43 years old and is married with five children.

Elva works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 13,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy items like canned goods and groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

Elva has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from rice farming.

Elva aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 56 years old and is married with 11 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalinda is borrowing 14,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalinda has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns an additional income from selling dried fish and other foods.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money, expand her business, and send her five children to college.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new mechanical tools.

loans.name: Muafia's Group

texts.en:
Muafia has given birth to five children. Three of them are studying while the others are too young to attend school. Her husband is a cobbler by profession. He makes shoes to sell to different shoe shops to earn income. Muafia is a very skillful lady. She helps her husband in his business. Both work very hard to meet the orders of their clients.

Muafia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah, because her husband wants to improve his business. With the loan, he will buy leather and other materials required to make shoes in larger quantities to sell. He has been operating this business for the past eight years and Muafia hopes that an investment will help him improve his business so he will be able to fulfill the customers' orders on time. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan experience with Asasah.  

In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Muafia.

loans.use: to buy leather and other materials for a shoemaking business.

loans.name: Roquita

texts.en: Roquita has been engaged in farming for 35 years. She grows rice and corn crops to sell. Roquita works hard to help provide for her family. She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Roquita hopes that this loan will help to improve her harvest and her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Talhada

texts.en:
Talhada is 39 years old and married with six children. With four children in school, Talhada works very hard to provide for them.

Talhada buys and sells nipa palm fronds in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase additional stock of nipa to sell.

Talhada has been in this business for 23 years.

In the future, Talhada would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family and send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of nipa palm fronds to sell

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Vann, 43 years old, is a gruel seller. Before, she was a farmer, but the income from the field is small and some seasons she could not get any income at all. That’s why she sells gruel. Her husband is a water seller. They have five children. Three are still studying and the rest are working in the factory. She needs to spend $5 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on school fees, and $10 for other expenses every month. 

She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a hand tractor to plow her field. She plans to buy a hand tractor because she thinks she can get more income by using it to plow the other farmers' farmland when they need it. Her plan for the future is only to keep the current career running well.

loans.use: To buy a hand tractor to plow the field.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rosita works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling cosmetics products through networking in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from deep well drilling. Rosita is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy more stock of cosmetics products to sell.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics products to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 43 years old and married with seven children. With five children in school, Lilia works very hard to provide for them.

Lilia runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 16,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and  groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Lilia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, milk, sugar, and sardines. 

In the future, Lilia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional stock of Avon products.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is married with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emelda is 48 years old and has five children who are in school. She has a bakery business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like butter, sugar, salt, eggs, etc. for her bakery business.  In the future, Emelda would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like butter, sugar, salt, eggs, etc. for her bakery business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Iem

texts.en: Iem is 41 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. To earn a daily income, he provides photo services for his neighbors and other villagers who need him to take a picture for their party or other ceremony. He has a life partner in his wife, who sells many products, such as merchandise, plastic products, fruits, cooking ingredients and soft drinks at home (Iem is pictured inside his house). They are blessed with four single children.  Iem will be using his loan to buy a new motorbike for riding to clients’ houses in order to provide his photo service.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for riding to clients’ houses in order to provide his photo service.
